author: {'steamid': '76561198089319410', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1069, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1712429965}
review:
Alright, so I have played for a collective of 12 hours as of posting this on 4/6/2024 and here are my thoughts:

Pros:
-Very nice map size
-Survival mechanic is more in depth than I have seen in any game. You have to eat a diverse diet or find vitamin tablets, along with taking care of different wound types. Your nutrition and health are key to lasting longer.
-building mechanic is like a mix of 'Rust' and 'The Forest'. Very nice, very intuitive/simple.
-Dying is common, but easy to avoid if you just pay attention and don't be too risky for too little reward.
-NPCs that let you shop for items. I like being able to re-gear myself if I die, since I don't always get to play games as a working adult.
-All items have in-game models.
-PvP is really fun, especially in a PvPvE server where part of the map is designated for PVP.

CONS:
-The money system is currently broken. If you so much as join a server with a high enough loot spawning, you can just farm items to sell tot he NPCs and break the game for yourself (which I don't recommend because it ruins the fun). Honestly, it's not TERRIBLE for the reason I stated in the pros, but come on.
-Death is stupidly common if you go into this blind. Better to play single player for a while instead of jumping into servers, at least until you get down the initial mechanics.
-Way more fun with friends (this is a con for a reason) because, while I do enjoy games like this, DayZ, 7Days2Die or Rust, it is sorely lacking in any kind of end game content other than guns or vehicles. Like DayZ, having friends to play with makes for longer time spent having fun (in my opinion). Not saying it is impossible to have fun on this game, but nothing beats goofing off with other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200333731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 208463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3356, 'playtime_at_review': 207886, 'last_played': 1712450124}
review:
As a fan of survival games, I couldn't wait to dive into the world of Scum. The game promised to be something truly unique and now, after several thousand hours of gameplay, I can confidently say that it met my expectations.
Scum is a real gem in the survival genre. Firstly, the graphics. I must admit that I did not expect such detailed environments and realistic animations. Every detail, from the leaves on the trees to the muddy mud underfoot, has been crafted to the finest detail.
But of course it's not just about looks. The gameplay is extremely deep and challenging. At the very beginning you land on a huge island waiting to be discovered. From natural resources to places hidden from the eyes of enemies, Scum has a lot to offer.
However, what really distinguishes Scum from other games of this type is the character system. Creating and developing a prisoner is truly impressive. Not only do you have the ability to customize your appearance, but you can also control aspects such as health, skills, and hunger levels. Thanks to this, every decision matters and every choice affects your chances of survival.
The combat is also perfectly balanced. It may seem brutal and difficult at first, but once you learn the mechanics it becomes a rewarding challenge. Additionally, the ability to use different weapons and strategies means you never feel limited.
Overall, Scum is a game that draws you in from the very first moment and keeps you in suspense all the time, you just have to have it all the time
"eyes around the head" XD. Whether you're a fan of survival games or not, it's worth giving this game a chance. It is simply a successful work of its kind. I would highly recommend...

author: {'steamid': '76561198997602949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 208, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1712297287}
review:
To many commands keys and No response,  What a joker! You will die if you are falling from parachute into sea. If you think that the developers are helping you on the robots, as they say that robots can't see you if you are hiding in bushes, they lying, the robots wil see you. The crafting mode is fucked up and every items you crafts takes too much time. You will lose your items if you have them in your hand while you are climbing up over something. Respawning in defferent areas after dying are not normal. And you can't use the parachute bag after landing. The Air-Drop in not in where it showen on the big map. All the controls are not applayed when you start the game, even if you put the keys how you like them, they are not when you start the game. There are no firearms for mills. All enemies can always end you, even if you have weapons to defend youself. you can't make a respawn mat , so the developers want you to respawn in air. Going from one place to another, takes to much time and you characters marker on the big map is just a red thing, which has no real point in what direction you are pointing to. You will get hungry after 1400-1800 meters and the food is nowere to be found and over 92% of every houses you search has nothing in them. I found a shotgun (a old model) and when I died while I was hiding from a robot, I respawn and went back to the same spot, my shotgun was gone. The character can only have three items on him/her in the begining. The developers has made many misstakes on this game and when game-developers rushes, then misstakes popping up. 
It was a very poor choise of me to buy this game, because when I saw videos on youtube when other gamers play it, it was good, but I used 3 hours on trying to find food, backpack, items, clothes, weapons and trying to craft items, first after 170 minuts I found a weapon and lost everything after hiding from robots. Robots? How TF can we players destroy these robots? And where is all the good firearms? And respawning in defferent areas after dying is a big, big bug! Crafting Should b e much easyer or you developers have made a big bug! If in real live, there would be many weapons and all kinds of items, plus food would have a chance to crow. And why TF can we players not sneak in and kill zombies without being heard by zombies? 
This game has bugs, bugs, bugs and very bad sneaking skills!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071905633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2234, 'playtime_at_review': 6183, 'last_played': 1712460488}
review: One more survival game that will never be finished. Costs full-price, works as if made yesterday.
developer_response: Hi Zloy Doter! We're sorry to see that you have the feeling that the game will never be finished. We'd like to provide some context and remind you that we've managed to deliver three big updates just last year, which brought us ever closer to the final 1.0 release. Before we get there, the team will focus their efforts to fix the underlying issues that we admit are present in the game and to polish and optimize it in order to make it run as smooth as possible. That being said, we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance and that you'll consider returning to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199154018936', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 708, 'playtime_at_review': 280788, 'last_played': 1712445350}
review: It used to be a game I loved so much. I had just been playing on a server with all my friends, running from the zombies, building bases, and messing around with admin. They have removed all the good vehicles. I would recommend this game to people, but because of the new updates, I will no longer be getting people to play with me.
developer_response: Hi x9e! We're sorry to see that you've been disappointed with the game after investing that amount of time in it. We'd like to emphasize that the team is working to add the removed vehicles back into the game and that we're working to deliver a truly special 1.0 release where we'll get rid of the underlying issues with the game and polish and optimize it so it will run as smooth as possible. With that in mind, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll be able to get people to play with you again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147905434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13216, 'last_played': 1708736223}
review:
Before the Horde update I had high hopes for the game, but now i just feel like the devs keep pushing DLC's and give empty promises to fixs whats broken.

PROS:
-You can shit and piss on the NPC and your friends
-You can have a "who has the biggest peepee" contest
-Elephant willy warmer
-Dildo spear
-Great graphics 

CONS:
-If you're a passenger in the car you cannot jump out while the car is moving, if your friend who is driving the car, gets his game crash, you will most likely get a C3 or C4 and fucking die because once they leave the game the character for some reason floors the pedal and will go top speed in to anything in the area. And if you have extra luck you will go through a couple of walls and building before you peacefully park in a factory with sentry's and have a couple of zombies to run from all while bleeding out <3 
-The fucking zombie spawning makes me brain have a C4 because it's so horrible.
-Radiation area is a joke, just the same shitty loot you could get anywhere else. Only difference is you have to work hard to get the shit you need to be there.
-Once you finally settle down and have a peaceful moment where you think "you know what, i'll finish my house on scum today" they wipe the fucking server and you have to start over again
-Most my time in the game has probably been running around the map with a car seat because with my luck of course the only car with the front seat will be on the other side of the map
-You can't sleep at night time, like i get that on an official server that probably wouldnt work that well. But it should be possible on a private one
-It takes way too long to level up in stealth, running etc, ofc some of them i get, others i dont.
-Killing yourself will make you stupider, i did not know this neither did my friends.
-My friend who was driving jumped out of the car so naturally me and the car teleported into the sea and decided we wanted to see the Titanic. (We did in fact not implode, I died way before that)
-The lag when you're even thinking about heading into an outpost. 
-Items that despawns as you try to put them on, eat them or drink them from a closet, fridge etc.
-Limping when you hurt your arm
-Using a weapon with a silencer still can cause a horde


And there are so many other cons, so please make the game playable again.
My breaking point was the zombie spawning, i would probably still play if that didn't push me over the edge
developer_response:
Hi Sofia Bolem! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you in so many ways. However, we'd like to address several points that you've mentioned:

We have tested out the situation with the crash and vehicle and did not receive the same result. That is why we'd like to kindly ask you to contact us via https://scum.help.jagex.com/hc/en-gb and to describe the issue that you've encountered in more detail.
-We are aware that the puppet spawning system does not work as intended and are working to tweak this system so that the spawning of the puppets feels right. The same applies for the gripe you have with silenced weapons that can cause a horde.
-We'll share the feedback regarding the radiation zone with our designers
-The wipe situation was pure bad luck on your side, we unfortunately had to go through with it.
-You can lie down on a bed during night time and rest there. While it is not sleep per se, it is basically the same
-Penalties for suiciding yourself were introduced as a means to prevent exploitation of this mechanic
-We'll look into the the limping with arm injuries
-Lag will also we tended to as we'll be polishing the game prior to its 1.0 release

Hope that these will help you and that they provide some clarification. We hope that you will not be completely discouraged from the game and that you will give it another chance

author: {'steamid': '76561198427911257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1661016484}

developer_response: Hi Ezra_Esdras! We're sorry to see that the game did not live up to your expectations. The game's still in Early access and we still have a lot of work to do before we get it to the final 1.0 version, but once we get there, SCUM will be a truly awesome hardcore survival experience. As for the community, we're sorry that you felt a sense of hostility as this is certainly not our intention. We'd like to kindly ask you if you could point out where you encountered here or via DM on Discord so we can see what ahppened.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160220147', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1537615285}
review: ive never understood how "early access" games have DLC, last time i played was 2018 and still in "early access", so no i wont recommend
developer_response: Hi OppY! We're sorry to see that the existence of DLC's ruined your opinion of the game. While it is true that the game is still in Early access, the DLC's were added as an additional means of support of the game for fans that are enjoying it. Also, it is important to note that the DLC's are purely cosmetic and optional, and that they do not give any unfair advantage to those that have purchased them. While there's still some work to be done on the game, we're on track to deliver the full 1.0 version of SCUM really soon and wee hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062375713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1205, 'playtime_at_review': 7001, 'last_played': 1712250060}
review:
I used to have hope for this game's potential, but no longer. I had reasonable fun in it a few versions ago when I could ramp up the number of zombies, and just go to a bunker to have fun, but the game still needed some work then. The devs however went in the wrong direction, and seemingly don't care about what the players want anymore.

As an example, they started adding in special zombies (ugh), one of which is even unkillable. Many players asked for at least the option to remove these special zombies from their own servers or single player games, and the devs just said never gonna happen. They have ideas that fit a very narrow scope of playstyle that they do not play test or gather feedback on before pushing to the live updates. And if your style of play is outside of that narrow scope, well then you are screwed because they are determined to not even have the options to play how you want.

Unlike many EA games, they do not even have an experimental branch you can opt into for testing of new features, nor previous versions of the game you can play if you do not like some of the new updates. And one of those newer "features" overhauled the zombie spawning system, for the worse. Yes, they are still working on that system, and maybe even one day will fix the issue of zombies "beaming in" that most people have an issue with, but there are so many more issues with the new system than that, but this review is already long enough. I'd be happy to give them constructive feedback, but I feel it'd be a waste of time because I don't see them doing any of it.
developer_response: Hi SteelBlood! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game. However, there are things that we need to address. The idea behind abandoned bunkers was to add variety into the gameplay by introducing places that have an eerie atmosphere and even an element of horror. It is entirely okay if you do not prefer these places. They are completely optional and you still have access to the original bunkers. As for the experimental branches - we have alpha testers that are helping us with finding bugs, and, for security reasons, they are handpicked, and the choice is based on their activity in the community, their knowledge of the game, etc. To conclude with your final point, we are aware that the puppet spawning system does not work as intended and we'd like to reassure you that we're working to tweak it in order for the spawns to be more organic. All that being said, we hope that we've provided some context and we hope that you'll consider returning to the game eventually - at least when we'll manage to hit the 1.0 version of SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163085240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 37186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1622, 'playtime_at_review': 36975, 'last_played': 1712448185}
review:
I have been playing this off and on since 2018 and I would say the most recent updates have practically changed the game for the worse. They "fixed" things that doesn't require fixing; and we all know how well things end from that. 

Major gripes like puppets being active and roaming around the world has now changed to being proximity spawn and will just randomly appear next to you outdoors in bushes and indoor for absolutely no reason. They will already be aggro'd for no reason when they absolutely have no LOS or noise coming from you. Instead of using this as a bandaid for the server resource hog, why not refine the netcode which seems to be one of the main excuse you are using for implementing this new spawn system?

They took out the vehicles that were already in-game; planes, trucks, cars, tractors, boats for the sake of "rework" which results in even more bugs and frustrations only to reintroduce them again later as a "new content" in an even more broken state-- see the recent bike, boat and Rager bugs.

They have also recently introduced an invincible enemy like Brenner into Abandoned Bunker instead of making them killable like mechs with large investment of resources to balance it out.

I know I am not the only one who feels this way for this beloved game done wrong, like a good wine that ends up being packaged in a plastic bottle.

The community managers or whatever they are, are very hostile to people who tries to give constructive feedback for the changes and updates to game in the community forums. They will dismiss what the players say as the player themselves having zero experience in the game and that there are zero issues in the game. I have seen a few post as such and I can only look on in horror as I try to believe that there will be fixes and the game will be better. The goodwill; however is running out.

How did we get here? What is going on over there at the team? Get your act together so you will see blue instead of red like this one. Listen to the players and stop treating them like some sort of estranged relatives at a family dinner.

I would not recommend the game at the current state. Will see how the game turns out on release but I don't have very high hopes anymore.
developer_response: Hi Kenny! We're sorry to see that you've grown to become disappointed with the game. Some of the gripes that you've mentioned are completely warranted - like the one where you've mentioned the new spawn system for the puppets. We acknowledge that this system needs to be tweaked and we're working to bring about necessary changes.  As for the vehicles, their removal was not intended and on purpose, but was necessary as they did not function properly once modular vehicles were introduced. We are working to add these vehicles to the game again. It is taking a bit more time than we, as well as our fans, would want, but were slowly getting there. The Brenner is simply a design choice. We wanted to create a sense of dread and fear as players are braving the depths of the abandoned bunkers. As for the community managers, we're sorry if some of the replies that you've received came of as dismissive or hostile. This is definitely not the type of communication that we want to foster with our community and we'd like to kindly ask you to contact us via Discord so we can see what specifically gave this vibe so we can have a look. All in all, we hope that this provided some context and reassurance and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance - at least when we manage to hit the 1.0 version of the game. Our team is hard at work to deliver just that and to make the game as polished, bug-free and feature complete by the time we hit that mark. We just need a bit more time.

developer_response: Hi Nomad-Jack! We're sorry that you're disappointed with the game. While we do not know what exact gripes you have with SCUM, we'd very much like to hear them so we can provide either additional clarification or we can escalate the matter to the appropriate instance within the studio. Either way, we're all ears!

author: {'steamid': '76561198214092099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 283, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1712133778}
review: SCUM is a super in depth survival sim with clunky controls and very complicated and confusing crafting system. Even with the beginner help turned on I was Googling and looking to YouTube and the Steam Community for help on what to do from the very beginning. That being said, I still find myself drawn to playing it, but in an almost masochistic way. I've only tried Single Player mode so far and, as a gamer who loves (and still plays) RUST and Stranded Deep, this feels very rough. It has a bit of a PUBG feel to it. After 4 hours of solo game play, I was finally able to craft a bow and kill some puppets, but struggled for almost an hour of real world time trying to craft and light a fire pit and cook chicken on it. It was almost comically difficult. I've had my eye on this for awhile and decided to finally by it when it was 50% off at $19.99. I don't think it's worth $39.99. Not yet, anyway. It's been out so long, I thought it would be more finished by 2024, but it seems like the developers and more interested in making DLCs for hair and cosmetics for an unfinished game, then polishing the roughness out of the ambiguous crafting and cumbersome inventory systems. In summary: Good graphics, good map and environments, great idea for a game, but the crafting and inventory management are so hard to navigate and understand, they need a lot of work. One of my biggest complaints is having to craft the same thing multiple times because the games default is to drop EVERYTHING you craft onto the ground where you can't see it among the grasses rocks and weeds, instead of just letting you hold it in your hands. Very bad design. Would I recommend this game to other players? Hmmm... I want to like this game, because it looks, based off of trailers and game play videos, like it should be awesome; but the confusing crafting system and frustrating inventory management ruin what should be by now, an awesome game. Side note: the players who understand and excel at this game have put 1000s of hours into it. Maybe after a couple months of playing this I'll revise my opinion, but as of April 2024, it still needs some work before its ready for prime time... and it may never be.
developer_response: Hi Duke_Kaboom! We're sorry to see tha,t even though you like many aspects of the game, you cannot recommend it. Since you are a new player, we'd advise that you look over the MANUAL section once you press Tab. You'll find a lot of helpful info which will enable you to survive much more easily on the island. 4 hours to craft a basic bow is way too much as you can chop away at a few bushes, craft improvised rope and then craft a bow. As for the inventory, it depends on what you carry on your character, i.e. clothes with more pockets, bigger backpacks, etc. will open up more inventory space for you to carry more items. If you have any further questions, we'd love to hear them. You can either contact us here, via Discord, or you can send a ticket via https://scum.help.jagex.com/hc/en-gb

author: {'steamid': '76561198126080140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8272, 'playtime_at_review': 9483, 'last_played': 1712461482}
review: This game has a ton of potential, I spent close to 150 hours on a binge, what I've gathered is that they really hit the nail on the head when it comes to their food, and metabolism. The skills and leveling them is interesting, different and a fresh approach to leveling that  is seen in most survival games. I have had a ton of fun on SCUM, in the short time that I've played this game I have absolutely loved it. I have even met fun people on official servers and enjoyed chatting and interacting. Like any survival game with PVP there will be toxic players. However I would not recommend the game in its current state. The sole reason is the overwhelming number of Cheaters in the game, My close knit friend group spent hours only to be killed by a flying car. I've encountered less cheaters on dayz official as a long time player than I did in less hours on SCUM. The Devs are super responsive, in discord, through Jagex and through their other means of reporting cheaters. To no avail as the cheaters will buy another account and continue to grief players that choose to play the game legit. If you choose to play, find a server that is monitored by an admin or team of admins; otherwise hang it up because you'll spend hours looting and someone will kill you with a flying car, or waltz right into your base. Be warned it can be absolutely amazing, but its current state is absolutely frustrating. Thanks to xKiCkx for the timely response in regards to Chinese hackers in the West servers, but its sadly to little avail.
developer_response: Hi xxDeathxKnightx2! We'd like to thank you kindly for this extensive review and to express our regret that the cheaters ruined your time with the game. We truly aim to remove these bad actors from the game and we are continuously working to bring our anti-cheat capabilities to the point where their removal from the game would be almost instantaneous. That being said, we truly hope that you'll consider returning to the game once we manage to get this sorted out.

review: A waste of time and money It's not even fun but more frustrating then anything. Just recently the dev responded to this comment, " Oh I'm so sorry for your experience with the game. I'll tell the team and they will take your bit!@ing into consideration. Blah, blah, blah we care about your concerns about the game and other gamers with similar thoughts". Or, something like that. But, the truth is some devs don't give a rat's a!@ It's all about your money it's that simple. The devs should be ashamed of them selves and Steam too for allowing a game like this to be sold on their platform. There was a game that came out recently called The Day Before. That game's title screen was exactly the sane as this game's title screen. Hmmm, now that is strange make's me wonder. The dev wanted me to give examples on things I dislike about this game. And, I did but what I should have told him " read the other 50 or more negative comments I'm sure you'll find plenty of examples. As I'm updating this comment I'm playing the game hoping the game will get better but, I don't think that's gonna happen. I should just stop playing, delete this crap and consider it a lost. Won't happen again. Oh, and this goes out to the s!@# devs. Don't bother responding to this comment again because you'll be blocked. Damn, I though Mist Survival was bad it's 10 times better then this crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561199031677877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5872, 'playtime_at_review': 29969, 'last_played': 1712491002}
review:
The game is great, if you're reading reviews about the game being broken, keep in mind it is still in development, most major issues in the game are resolved within a few days after a major update and there's nearly weekly updates being made to the game. Your experience will be highly dependant on the server settings that you play on, if you're finding certain aspects difficult, move on to a different server. 

Highly anticipating the next major update, it should bring a much needed bit of content to single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299381083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 46289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 56, 'playtime_at_review': 46289, 'last_played': 1711463069}
review:
last wipe deleted my oldest character so all that effort to raise stats was for nada, to add insullt to injury they left me a newer one with lower stat numbers...dont care about losing stuff, cash, guns, ammo, even bases on wipes. This is par for the course with this game but I am not going to waste any more time on a game that will wipe the long and grueling grind to raise your stats and expect me to be happy about it :P

see ya scum, see ya jagex it has been meh af

developer_response: Hi The_TonyZ! We're sorry to see that the puppets ruined your time with the game. author: {'steamid': '76561198083994389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1669305620}
review: Still waiting for multiplayer Linux (proton) support for after several years.  Poor performance on my older Windows PC.  Can't say much about the game play itself as I could never get into it as a single player game.
developer_response: Hi Garfield[cat]! We're sorry to see that the lack of Linux support has diminished your opinion of the game. What we can tell you is that we currently focused on deliver a bug-free, feature complete and optimized 1.0 version of SCUM, but we manage to hit that - we'll see! As for the older PC's, the game has a minimum and recommended specs that are listed on our Steam page. We do not know how old is the PC on which you tried to run SCUM, but what we know is that you do not need to have a top-tier expensive gaming rig to run our game. That being said, we hope that this does not dissuade you from playing and enjoying SCUM eventually and that you will hopefully find a way to enjoy and play it in a manner satisfactory for you.

game is useless now! Don't BUY it

author: {'steamid': '76561199654917305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 161, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1712379595}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660793', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 120, 'playtime_at_review': 26564, 'last_played': 1711884492}
review: Puppet spawn system ruined the game - realistic everything in the game except for the part you see zombies spawning from air - nothing about that is realistic and no point of clearing any where when they will re-spawn right away sometimes on top of you.
developer_response: Hi Smokemonster! We're sorry to see that the puppet spawn system ruined the realism aspect for you. The team is aware of this issue and we're actively working on a fix which will no longer make puppets spawn out of thin air, we just need a bit more time. That being said, we hope that you'll consider returning to the game once we manage to get this sorted out.

review:
A very good game and I recommend it, but it needs some work
Improvements eg.

1- Eating and drinking without having to open inventory

2- Zoom in and out on the map

3- Changing the player's points on the map to a triangle shape or something similar helps determine which side to look at on the map because it is difficult to know where you are going.

4- Show the team on the map to determine locations

5- Show the option to exchange items between players. I don't want to lose my weapons again â˜¹

I finish

author: {'steamid': '76561199652141923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7116, 'playtime_at_review': 17722, 'last_played': 1712247812}
review:
My mentality is blown up! Yesterday, I encountered a team of cheaters who stole materials through the wall on the official server of Singapore 1 and provoked and abused me on the public screen, and I also scolded them and reported it. I don't really understand how the developers do this, I've been working on my game character in the cave for the past three weeks, 13 hours a day, I don't need to work out if I cheat, and I just got all the DLC in the library a week ago. I want the developer to give me an explanation!!Why ban my game without checking my game data!!!

By the way, the cheaters are orphans without parents!!ï¼ï¼

author: {'steamid': '76561198061891285', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 10749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2113, 'playtime_at_review': 9148, 'last_played': 1712395444}
review: After playing this game for 6 years, update 0.9 officially killed it for me. Specifically the new spawning and horde system. Clearing out buildings is now pointless because zombies will now respawn within seconds with no apparent minimum spawn radius, which means they can spawn right behind you and in rooms youve already cleared. This almost makes killing zombies in general pointless because they will just respawn in the same spot 30-60 seconds later. It doesnt seem like they plan on changing this either.
developer_response: Hi mr.dingaling! We're sorry to see that the horde update has ruined your time with the game. We'd like to reassure you by confirming that we acknowledge that this system does not function as intended and that the team is working on much needed tweaks and modifications which will make the puppet spawning much more organic. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll find enjoyment with the game once we'll have that sorted out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417055324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1490, 'playtime_at_review': 21132, 'last_played': 1712247338}
review: Horde system is disaster as well as the animation of running and jumping this the reason why i will not play this game any more!
developer_response: Hi there Arssassin! We acknowledge that the puppet spawn system does not function as intended and we're working to tweak it as soon as possible. As for the animations, we'll make sure to update those as well, we're aware that their update is needed. However, without giving out any false promises - this is something that we'll be attending to after the initial 1.0 release of SCUM. That being said, we hope that you'll consider returning to the game as we'd hate to lose a player because of something that will get taken care of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129087491', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3917, 'playtime_at_review': 28730, 'last_played': 1712462382}
review: still working out a lot of bugs, but when things are running well, it's a hell of a time. Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003230852', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4315, 'playtime_at_review': 4833, 'last_played': 1712200262}
review:
As a survival game this delivers, sometimes a little to much. Everything else is heavily lacking in thought, balancing, and content...and probably always will be. The horde mode is terrible, it makes using a gun (even silenced) a never end loop of zombie spawning even if you kill them all. The building mechanic has a LOT of flaws that make it awful and useless, people literally build in prefab buildings on the map because it's a better experience all around. For example, you can not build a wall on an upper floor without having a support or wall under it on EVERY floor and you can't build more then 2 floors out without needing another support. Also, did you build a wall i nthe wrong spot? Tough luck, break it and you risk losing half your building even if it has support elsewhere. It seems no one on the dev team has any experience with construction or consulted one because it is bad. You will be stuck with a 4x4 box in most cases unless you hate yourself. The hunting mechanic is tedious and a waste of time, its terrible allaround. Fishing is overly difficult unless you cheese it and there is no drag mechanic or fish tiring mechanic, which is why it is overly difficult. It's impossible to reel in a fish without using the cheese method. Some content isn't worth doing other then just to experience it once or twice, like raiding abandoned bunkers or fighting mechs. The cost/risk vs reward isn't balanced at all and probably never will be. And while we are on the topic of balance, the game still has a LOT of balancing issues when it comes to skills/stats and food/water consumption on top of some of it not making any realistic sense at all like crafting and building not helping with strength, constitution, or dexterity when it uses stamina. It just levels engineering and that is all. Plus the fact your intelligence is locked in and permanently goes down if you suicide is a real wtf were they thinking moment. I guess humans forgot how to learn in this universe. And the BIGGEST downside for me is that you can not run your own personal dedicated server. The devs make every excuse in the book for why they did this, but none of them hold any water. The biggest one is always "to keep people from developing online cheats" and pat themselves on the back because no one has made a health hack yet. What does that matter when you get 1 shot to the head from 1500m away by someone using an ESP aimbot combo? A quick google search pulls up plenty of free and paid multiplayer enabled cheats that work and are undetected because EAC is garbage. Either fix it or let us avoid it without having to shell out more money for some crappy company to host one for us. This is purely a cash grab move.

TLDR; This is just a 3D version of Project Zomboid but with a worse implementation and no dedicated server support. Playing with friends on a private server can be fun, but it is also frustrating a lot of the time, plus you have to pay for a server since you cant locally host a dedicated one for free...anything else isn't worth the time.

EDIT: For Dev Response

You can say you will fix everything in the world all you want, but the fact of the matter is that literally every aspect of this game has issues that make it a very unpleasant experience. I actually cut out 90% of my review because It was just complaining the whole time and I felt bad for anyone who might read it. I get that the game is in Early Access and still being flushed out, and if this was on a 0.2 patch or something I would have some faith in those words. But it isn't, it's 0.95, and if the backwards progress of previous patches are anything to go by I am not gonna hold my breath lol. You can't build garage doors or hangar doors on a foundation? Makes sense, not. No form of supporting upper floors that doesn't put a huge pillar in the way everywhere? Makes sense. A M249 suppressor gets completely annihilated from firing 1 mag? Makes sense. You get hit by a puppet and it stops your current action? Makes sense. I for one would stop pulling out my gun or sword if my life depended on it. Don't get me wrong, I like the game, but some things are in the game to literally piss the players off and I just can't for the life of me recommend it to anyone with design choices like that when they aren't even realistic design choices. Which brings me into why I can't, and wont recommend this game. The micromanagement of the dev team telling players how they can and can not play the game is what really puts me off. Even if this game gets flushed out properly, I still won't recommend it because a game by a dev team that refuses to implement basic options to let players play how they want will be a terrible experience for the vast majority of players. Disabling Mr. Brenner for example. Being told flat out "No, not gonna ever happen." because the dev team thinks they know better is messed up and any dev team like that I can not support. They may have an image in mind for how the game should be, but their are ZERO reasons to not allow these customization options if players want them, aside from arrogance or some twisted desire to annoy the players. An unkillable boss is fun, for about 10 minutes. Then players will find a way to cheese it because it is annoying, and that will get patched, then they find another method, and it gets patched, over and over again until it becomes a horrible experience and probably turns abandoned bunkers into unplayable content. Bad idea, this is why games don't do it anymore.
developer_response:
Hi Chem! First off, we'd like to thank you for this extensive review and we'd like to say that we're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. Allow us to address several things that you've mentioned in your review and to provide some clarification:
First off, we'd like to acknowledge that the current puppet spawning system does not work as intended and that the team is actively working on much-needed changes and tweaks to it. As for the hunting and fishing minigames, we'll be looking into these as we'll be nearing the full 1.0 release of the game. This also applies to the general balancing of various systems within the game that you've mentioned.
We hear you regarding the server files - we'll look into their potential release, but that will not take place before we manage to push 1.0 out.
The other thing that we'd like to address is the cheaters. We're very much aware how much issues they are causing on the servers, and we'd like to emphasize that we're working enhancing our anti-cheat capabilities constantly and that we're working to get them to the point where removing cheaters will become almost instantaneous. 
Again, we're sorry to see that you are thoroughly disappointed with the game, but we'd like to stress that the team is hard at work with delivering the last promised content additions, as well as bugfixes, QoL improvements and optimizations that will make the game run even better before we hit 1.0. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll find enjoyment with the game once more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972520994', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5467, 'playtime_at_review': 3814, 'last_played': 1712499553}
review:
Looks like DayZ has some serious competition.
The graphics are absolutely incredible and the world is very expansive and interesting not only that but the puppets are very challenging and the gun play is amazing to say the least.
However, many issues need to be fixed such as glitches, laggy servers and unreliable combat system ( melee ) and especially the instance where your hair is gone as soon as you put on a helmet or a hat.

review: come gioco Ã¨ grandioso alla 0.95 Ã¨ da sistemare il basebuilding a parere mio, il gioco Ã¨ molto valido ottimo survival divertente in sp e ancora meglio in mp spero ci siano grandi aggiornamenti in futuro

author: {'steamid': '76561198029017044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 33877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33877, 'last_played': 1705700150}
review: If you would of asked me two years ago, I would of highly recommended this game, the devs were actively fixing bugs and adding new content (for free) - upon looking back over the last year or so they seem to have jumped on the paid DLC bandwagon - not a fan, cannot recommend.
developer_response: Hi Cå„å£å£! We're sorry to see that you've grown to become disappointed with the game and that the presence of DLCs have soured your opinion on it. We'd like to acknowledge that the game may have some underlying issues and that bugfixing was slowed down due to the cadence of updates that were putting out. Our commitment and main focus is to deliver all the content that we have planned and to fix all the issues during the polish phase just before the release of the 1.0 version, not delivering only paid DLCs. We'd like to emphasize that these DLC are purely cosmetic and that they do not give any unfair advantage to those that have them. They are simply an optional way to additionally support the studio and the development of the game and they do not in any way hinder that process in the slightest. That being said, we hope that this provides some context and clarification and that you will consider returning to the game eventually.

review: WOW GAME IS NOT VERY GOOD TRYING TO LEARN AND BEING QUITE ALL OF A SUDDEN MORE THINGS THAN YOU CAN KILL ATTACK THEN RESPAWN ACROSS MAP BY THE TIME YOU GET TO WHERE YOU DIED GEAR ALL GONE HAS HAPPENED SEVERAL TIMES. developer_response: Hi Xcaldaddyblue! We're sorry to see that the game si not to your liking. SCUM has always been envisioned as a hardcore survival game that leans heavily into realism, meaning that there are a lot of things that you need to be weary of where almost anything can kill you. However, we acknowledge that some players might want a modified experience, which is why we'd like to recommend that you find a private server where some settings are modified (such as loot or number of puppets). You can find more info on them here: https://www.battlemetrics.com/servers/scum That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another go and that you'll find somewhere where you can enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839073685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 647, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1711594488}
developer_response: Hi Ch0ngus! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We're aware that the game has its underlying issues and we'd like to emphasize that we're still in Early access and that the team is working really hard to iron those out and to deliver the last of the promised content and features. We can see that your SCUM playtime was around 3 hours and that you would have probably benefited from a dedicated tutorial. We acknowledge that the game does indeed have a steeper learning curve, and we'd like to reassure you that, eventually, we will be adding something that will help new player ease into the game. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance, at least when we manage to hit the 1.0 version of SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136045116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2202, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1712498130}
review: Running Simulator, Items despawn tooo fast. Game is not very nice...
developer_response: Hi p3shk0!  We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed. The game is more of a slow burn, but the fun starts once you give yourself a task and then aim to complete it, such as finding all parts for a working vehicle and assembling it in order to drive around the map. The map holds a lot of secrets and intriguing points of interest. If you want a bit of help getting your bearings around the map, you can check out https://scum-map.com/en/interactive_map and plan your exploration route. That being said, we hope that you'll consider returning to the game and that you'll find enjoyment with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064925133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 271, 'playtime_at_review': 6306, 'last_played': 1711469210}
review: 6 years into the game and still in early access, that's a shame
developer_response: Hi Carbonaro! We're sorry to see that the long period of Early access has ruined your opinion of the game. We understand how that ma create frustration on your side, but the realities and complexities of game development, coupled with real-world events such as the pandemic have somewhat hindered our progress. However, the last year was incredibly fruitful for us as we've managed to deliver three big updates and a host of smaller ones, which brought us extremely close to the full 1.0 version our fans are waiting for. We're right on track and we can't wait to get there, which is why we hope that you'll consider giving the game another try and that you'll find it to be a fun and enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022318552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14490, 'last_played': 1625571534}
review: Garbage DLC just there to take your money, no thanks.
developer_response: Hi Duke Rain! We're sorry to see that the existence of the DLCs has soured your opinion of the game. While they indeed exist, the DLCs that are available for SCUM are purely optional and exclusively cosmetic-only, meaning that you do not have to own them at all to enjoy the game and that if you own them, you do not receive any  unfair advantage over those that do not have them. One of the more prevalent criticism regarding DLCs is that we focus on their development instead of the overall game, which is also not true at all. The game's development is progressing well and even if we run into some delays or whatnot, the reason is never because our focus is developing DLCs. They are simply an optional means of support for those that love the game. We want to reassure you that we never lose sight of the things that must be improved with the game or the features that yet have to come into the game and that they never take a backseat to DLCs. Hope this clears it up a bit and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086837989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 25411, 'last_played': 1711444943}
review:
First off, i LOVE this game!
I've been playing for years and i still come back to it several times a week, either on a packed serevr with friends or on a quieter one where i can live my best survival life in piece. 
This game has SO much, it is defineitley one of if not THE BEST survival game on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561199527264127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2518, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1712500509}
review:
Scum is the best zombie survival game out there right now. i've got 17 hrs in so far mainly with my friend Duck 
Graphics 10/10 
GamePlay 10/10 
Sound Design 100/10 the sound when a suppressed m9 bullet passes you sounds and feels so real 
Crafting System 10/10 So much more better than most games 
Servers 9.5/10 the reason why I give it that is sometimes the servers go out for a second and refreshes and can catch me in a bad spot also have commuity servers and vanila servers 
Bugs 9.5/10 there are some visual bugs but not excatly game breaking bugs nuntheless it is pretty much bug free
Health System 20/10 this system is like nothing ive ever seen so detailed yet so simple
N/A 
There is still so much more for me to cover so once i get to endgame stuff i will continue this review 
BUT if you are Wanting to buy this game Please do it has great players and SO MUCH Stuff you can do
GoodLuck on the island people!
By Quacky

author: {'steamid': '76561198038972824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1669, 'playtime_at_review': 9219, 'last_played': 1712180689}
review:
Es un juego que al principio parece interesante y que tiene muy buena ambientaciÃ³n, al principio puede parecer complicado sobrevivir, hasta que poco a poco vas descubriendo la mecÃ¡nica del juego y consigues sobrevivir... Todo estupendo hasta que empiezas a descubrir, mecÃ¡nicas mal hechas, como alimentarte (vomitando casi cualquier cosa que hagas a pesar de estar bien cocinada), mobiliario que no puedes fabricar, oleaje absurdo mal ejecutado que la Ãºnica intenciÃ³n es hacer que vuelque tu embarcaciÃ³n, respawn de zombis, que aparecen de la nada, despuÃ©s de haber limpiado un lugar hasta el Ãºltimo rincÃ³n, el zombi de la risa, que aparece de la nada, etc, etc..
Llega un momento que da igual lo que hagas, vas a morir, no por tu mala supervivencia, sino por una programaciÃ³n que ejecuta realmente mal el entorno de juego y la jugabilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139429577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 65, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1711411456}
review: The reviews for this game have to be "Paid" reviews. This games is terrible. I've got close to 4 hours in it and all I've done is run. This could be so much better but its absolutely boring & frustrating.
developer_response: Hi Wickedhopes! We're sorry that you feel disappointed with the game. While SCUM has its fair share of issues that are yet to be ironed out by the time we enter Early access, we'd like to emphasize that the game is genuinely enjoyed by many, to the extent of leaving a positive review on our Steam page. SCUM is sort of a slow-burn game as you need some time to get more high-end loot to tackle more challenging aspects of it, and judging by your playtime, it is highly unlikely that you've gotten to that point. We acknowledge that new player may have a harder time with the game as we currently do not have a dedicated tutorial in place. However, the team is working to add something like that in the game in order to curb the learning curve a bit. In the meantime, you can access the MANUAL section when you press the Tab button to find out how some of the features and mechanics in the game function. That being said, we hope that we've provided some clarification and that you will consider giving SCUM another chance - at least when we'll manage to hit the 1.0 version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029035848', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4988, 'last_played': 1679373821}
review:
Entire games have been created in the span it took this one to fix its SINGULAR busted map

European survival studios following the tradition it seems
developer_response: Hi Cardinal! We're sorry to see that you are dissatisfied with the speed at which the development of the game has progressed. We acknowledge that it took quite a while and we would also prefer that it released much sooner, but the realities and complexities of gamedev, coupled with real world events that have hindered our efforts, have slowed down our progress. However, last year was extremely fruitful for us as we have delivered three big patches for the game, which brought us extremely close to the final 1.0 version of the game. Currently, our team is hard at work with delivering the last content and feature additions that will find their way into the game, as well as QoL improvements, bugfixes and optimizations that will make SCUM feature-complete and polished. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199508141551', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9325, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1712445223}
review:
game is too inaccessible for me. the start of the game is very punishing, and there are many janky unexplained mechanics.
and death causes you to basically have to start again. and you will die many times before you can even figure out the simple stuff. 
your charicter is very delicate in this game, and most of the game-play is consumed trying to figure out how to treat infection, exhaustion and bleeding even slight damage can eventually kill you. 
slight damage also destroys your ability to carry things. your equipment is in constant need of repair otherwise you have no inventory space
at the start you are at the mercy of RNG to find the things you need

its one of those games where you need google constantly open 

the community is very good however. so many volunteers. 
but this game just isnt fun for me im going to try and play a little more see if my opinion changes
developer_response: Hi Psyclepath! We're sorry to see that the game feels too inaccessible to you. We acknowledge that first-time players might have a harder time as SCUM indeed currently has a steeper learning curve, especially for players that are new to the genre. We're glad that you have leveraged our community to help yourself with understanding the game, and we'd like to recommend that you use the MANUAL section when you press the Tab button for all information that you need about the functionalities of the game's mechanics. We'd also like to point out that the team is working to add a tutorial into the game in order to help new players ease into the game. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance  eventually and that you'll manage to learn the intricacies of SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129935674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1479, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1711928179}
review:
A hidden survival Gem. It's what Deadside could have been. The game is hardcore, but once you get the hang of the mechanics It's a much better experience. 
Does have it's quirks and some odd bugs, but overall a grand survival game at heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078647868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1711323574}
review:
a psydo-ralisim game. sure its realistic to get a bloody-wound in the figths with zombies, bbut how realistic is it that that fullydressed armyman-zombie dont give me a single piece of cloth, or worse: he give ma a full pants which somehow dont give enougth rags to cove my wound. so i run half an our around, looting full houses with nice made beds just to die of bloodloose. then there is this cluncy controlls and the fact that there is a big warning: you need to peed, but to find out how to pee i needed to search the damn steam forums.

maybe it is later a awsome game i dont know. but the start is just cluncky, unrewarding and over complicated.
developer_response: Hi SIr Drachenstein! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed with the game. To address some of the things that you've pointed out - the clothes that the puppets are wearing is decayed and basically falling apart, meaning that the clothes they are wearing are basically useless for you. Even if you could manage to cut some of their clothes into rags, using them on your wounds would most certainly result in a swift infection. Also, as for the peeing, there is a prompt that shows how to access the toilet menu when your characters ''needs to go''. We're aware that some of the mechanics of the game could be better explained and communicated to the player, and we'll definitely look into that as we'll be nearing the full release of SCUM. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually and that this did not make you lose interest in it completely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089292490', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1397, 'last_played': 1564799020}
review:
Practically non existant ultrawide support even with having to edit the file it basically scales the 1080p window to fit the monitor and thats it so everything looks ridiculous.

The devs like to claim you can host your own server but what they fail to tell you is that is only with 1 singular host that they have decided is worthy. I already pay for a dedicated machine in a datacenter im not paying an extra 20$ a month because you felt like forcing us to pay your friends.

Shame as i really wanted to like this game.

If you run an ultrawide monitor or like hosting servers on your own hardware its a hard pass.
developer_response: Hello, ultra wide support is WiP once the game is done. As for server hosting we have always made it known that it is possible through multiple providers we have granted access the server files to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280702563', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 33651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33651, 'last_played': 1584325646}
review: 6 yeasrs still in early access... nuff said.
developer_response: Hi Merkiavelli! We're sorry to see that the fact SCUM's been in Early access for quite a while has made you lose faith in the game. We acknowledge that 6 years is quite a lot, and if we ourselves would have preferred if that time period was shorter, but a lot has happened in the meantime which has hindered our efforts. However, we'd like to emphasize that last year was incredibly productive on our side as we have delivered three big patches which brought us ever closer to to the complete 1.0 version of the game. We are on track the deliver a truly awesome hardcore survival experience and we can't wait for our community to experience SCUM they way it was envisioned. That being said, we hope that you'll consider returning to the game eventually and that you'll find enjoyment with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199164804124', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2991, 'playtime_at_review': 1964, 'last_played': 1712000069}
review: Best Survival Game that I've ever played!

author: {'steamid': '76561199050137465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 199, 'playtime_at_review': 10629, 'last_played': 1712474747}
review: i love the game and every aspect i only wish for us solo survivors that it would be just a but easier to build bases or fortifie houses at a bit of a cheaper cost i know many would not agree but sometimes it just can be very tedious and even gaining fame is also a thing that kinda bothers me as well as the movement i feel the movement in the game is a bit fast and not as slow and tactical as it should be its overall a great game just can be very stressful give the game time and it will grow on you its not dayz its just scum i love walking around and seeing the sites if you do jump in just know they try their best to take care of the newer players and ask others for help the scum community is by far the nicest and non toxic batch i have ever played with stay safe survivors

author: {'steamid': '76561197971214958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1711224518}
review: No tutorial, you start out plummeting to the ground without knowing how to get out of it.  Some sort of how to or something to make it somewhat understandable.
developer_response: Hi ddugery58! As you are falling to the ground, a prompt will appear on the right-hand side of the screen telling you to press F to open the parachute. Once you manage to land, you can press Tab and go into the 'Manual' section to read more about the systems and mechanics present in SCUM. However, we acknowledge that there are better ways to convey the game and how it works to the player, which is why the team is working to add some kind of tutorial which will help new players ease into the game. That is why, knowing this, we hope you'll consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354475101', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1711223740}
review: Unfinished unplayable full of crazy bugs

author: {'steamid': '76561198050221229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 52388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 213, 'playtime_at_review': 52175, 'last_played': 1712419927}
review:
So much potential...waisted.
I have a few thousand hours in since .70, but it has gone down hill. Now the puppets just spawn wherever you are...clear an area and they'll spawn all around you, realism is gone. No more clearing an area and looting, they just drop on you, literally on top of you. I loved this game, but they have taken it a different direction, and as much as I want to play it, it just isn't worth the frustration.
developer_response: Hi ShiVeR! We're sorry to see that the puppet spawning system ruined your time with the game. We acknowledge that this system does not work as intended and you'll be pleased to know that the team is hard at work on tweaking and fixing this system to make it work properly. Also, the team is hard at work on delivering the last content updates, bugfixes and QoL improvements before we hit the 1.0 version of the game, which is why we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance when we manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432242310', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1396, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1712497475}
review:
Puppet spawns system is broken. You clear a place and then zombies spawn on you in a few seconds. This is not realistic at all. 
Also impossible to use a gun.. You clear a place, make one shot and zombies spawn a horde... Sniping  was killed since zombies are seen only when you get near them.  Do not order this till these things are fixed.   Devs made an update and ruined all they have created before.  UNPLAYABLE ATM.
developer_response: We're well aware of the issues that the horde update has brought with itself and we'd like to emphasize that the team is hard at work to tweak the puppet spawning as soon as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247891420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 533, 'playtime_at_review': 5010, 'last_played': 1711765237}
review: Still some work to be done, melee combat is quite buggy and doesn't register hits even when you're quite literally next to the zombie, speaking of which, during your scuffle they do have the tendency to suddenly turn into prime Mike Tyson and pivot right behind you, create an angle and left hook you out of nowhere. Besides that, there's the annoying ,,someone killed you in a driveby while being passenger and your loot disappears even though your friend evaded your assailants and normally it should still be there" part, not a lot of vehicles to choose from, the hordes respawn like three real time minutes after you get rid of them, and some guns (especially shotguns) are quite shaky. Still, on the bright side, overall it's still an enjoyable experience, even though there's still room for improvement, and I have hope that by the time the full release date comes around it will be the best version possible. Good Day-Z alternative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377227794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1711196045}
developer_response: Hi Boscare! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. While we do not know what exactly made you strongly dislike the game, we'd like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and that we still have a lot of work to do before we manage to hit the 1.0 version of SCUM. Before we manage to get there, the team will be focusing on delivering the last promised content addition and features. Also, we'll make sure to fix the underlying bugs that are present in the game, and that it is as optimized and polished as possible. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131335208', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 87131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 226, 'playtime_at_review': 86887, 'last_played': 1712093907}
review:
Spend a LOT of hours on this game, saw good stuff taken away, bad stuff put back.
And with that even more bad things happen. NPC's CHEAT (and yes they are programmed to do so)
when the player is clever and finds a way without damage to defeat the zombie, it miraculously TELEPORTS behind the player and hits him in the back..... Nice eh? Snipers in the SP were void. Sniping was no longer possible due to changes made and NOT rolled back even after tenthousands of complaints about it from the community. These people dont care about creating a good, fair and playable game. They are only interested in taking your money. DO NOT BUY IT!! its NOT worth it. Seriously.
And its a waste of your time...... and your money!
developer_response: Hi G4BBER4LIFE! We're sorry to see that you've experienced some issues with the puppets. The issue you've mentioned sounds like the server had a hiccup which made the puppet look like it teleported behind you. This is definitely not intended. As for the sniping, this was implemented in order to optimize the overall experience. We understand and acknowledge that these are not popular decisions, but they were made with the intention to secure the proper functioning of the game. As we'll be nearing the 1.0 version and optimizing it prior to the final release, we'll have much more leeway to return some of these functionalities back in the game. That is why we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance - at least when we'll manage to get to the full 1.0 version of SCUM.

developer_response: Hi The Lone Wanderer! We're sorry to see that you feel the game is progressively becoming worse. While we can understand where some of this sentiment comes from, we'd like to reassure you that we fully intend to create a satisfying and rewarding hardcore survival experience. We also intend to fix the underlying issues and bugs that are ruining the game for some players and to introduce a host of QoL improvements and optimizations that will make the game more polished and run even better. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176598726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2212, 'last_played': 1711143045}
review: Simulator Runner! this game not fun at all! run, Loot, Die, Run! its all about this!
developer_response: Hi THAMANICH! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with SCUM. If you want to find challenge in it, try finding a police station or a bunker in order to loot its content to find some firepower and then, try to brave one of the abandoned bunkers in the game to see what horrors lie within. We're still yet to add some of the content that we've promised to implement prior or with the 1.0 release of the game and we are on course to deliver just that. With that in mind, we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance and that you'll find something to enjoy in it.

review: the game is so inconsistent i rather play dayz just cause it works better in this game when servers kick u out and you try and load back in your character is reset all the way to the beginning and  when zombies scream they dont call other ssh you and the only way to get weapons and ammo is thru lock picking and you can never find the stuff for it this game looks and feels better than dayz but i rather play dayz than this due to the frustration of inconsistencies
developer_response: HI 6Bluddy6Wulf6! We're sorry to see that you've found the game to be disappointing. While the game has its underlying issues, the team is working to iron them out as we'll be nearing the full release of SCUM. As for the specific issue with being kicked out and having to start with a player, we'd like to kindly ask you to write a ticket via https://scum.help.jagex.com/hc/en-gb and explain in detail what happened in order to ensure that there was a bug. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving SCUM another chance and that you'll contact us with this potential issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025824045', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 11006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10995, 'last_played': 1711094140}
review: Coming from someone looking for a game like H1Z1 Just Survive, i am very satisfied, this is a very good survival game, as of the time of this review i have played almost 200 hours and probably will play hundreds more, BUT it has a very serious problem with disappearing items, both by design and bugs, cars and other very useful items disappear after a few days, around 2 weeks, this should not be a thing, at most they should deteriorate over time, you should not be held hostage by a game, corpses, either yours or of players that you kill also disappear, in this case, after a few minutes, horrible and unacceptable, and i hope they change that.
developer_response: Hi Gr8Gr3yM! Thank you for your review and for enjoying the game. We're aware of the issue with the disappearing items and we'll make sure to iron this out by the time we manage to get to the 1.0 version of SCUM. As for the cars and bodies, this is currently set in this manner for optimization purposes. However, as we'll be further optimizing the game, we'll look potential opportunities for making increasing some of these times. That being said, we hope that this will not discourage you from the game entirely and that you'll continue enjoying SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289748959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7873, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1712471506}
review:
Initially I said I did not recommend this game in its current state. Well after playing it a little longer, I have changed my mind. This game has a way of sucking you in the longer you play. The game is challenging, and rewards patience. 

Here's what I'd like to see after the full release:

1. Living NPCs walking around the world. Friendly and unfriendly. Maybe NPCs doing random things like hunting an animal, fighting puppets, attempting to rob the player, or repairing a vehicle. Things that give the illusion of a living world. 

2. Perhaps some tweaks to the hunting system. Although I like a good challenge, currently it feels broken. Though this game does challenge you to get better overtime, and I do like that about it, I have serious issues just tracking an animal. Maybe a higher encounter rate would suffice? I'm not sure. 

Anyway, great game overall. I am looking forward to the full release. I'd like to see this become a $60 game eventually. I want this game to be the best open world survival game on steam, and it does have things going for it. 

Good luck devs.
developer_response: Hi divsection! Thank you for leaving your feedback and we're sorry to see that the game currently feels boring for you. You'll be pleased to know that the human NPC's are actually one of the last promised features that will find their way into the game. These will help to further enrich the core gameplay and bring more variety into it. Also, we'll make sure to further support the game after we get out of Early access, which is why we hope that you'll be there with us and that you will be enjoying your time in SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084623033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 260, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1711638361}
review:
"Are you really shitting on the floor of our base??" 
If you played early Dayz SA and liked it then you'll like this game. Only negative is servers are either dead (0-5 people) or max pop amazing ping rates compared to most games. Takes a few hours to learn the zombie mechanics/types but if you've played a few different zombie games in your time you'll catch on quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304964983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77236, 'last_played': 1706713500}
review: There is loads of potential but the game is fundamentally broken and lacks any long term substance. New things are added constantly and things that work are removed and replaced by buggy gameplay which results in hotfix after hotfix to try correct the issues. DLC,s are the order of the day and they seem to be the priority for the dev team.
developer_response: Hi Dr_KATZ! We're sorry to see that you're disappointed with the game and we acknowledge the criticism put forth. Some of the things that were added do not function as intended, but the team will be doing their best to fix these, as well as other underlying issues that are still present as we'll be nearing the full 1.0 version. Also, we'd like to provide some clarification regarding the DLCs and confirm that they are completely optional, cosmetic-only in nature and that they do not give any unfair advantage to those that have them. Also, we'd like to point out that they do not detract the team from the overall development of the game and that everything's progressing as it should. That being said, we hope that we've dispelled some uncertainties and that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we manage to get to the full 1.0 release of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960429884', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 71156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71156, 'last_played': 1710716173}
review:
I can no longer recommend this game until the developers get their act together and fix all the major problems they are creating.

They broke the spawn system completely and made  puppet spawns completely insane and all kinds of buggy,  meanwhile several patches go by with no fix and they release a new DLC.

They ruined the hunting system and replaced it with some mini-game that nobody likes.

Also as of late they have started clamping down on issuing any kind of negative criticism on their Steam forums and will lock thread / delete posts  for  giving strongly worded opinions.  Arguing that you are being offensive or some stupid reason like that.
