author: {'steamid': '76561198329438846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5798, 'last_played': 1710635611}
review: Das Game ist einfach in so vieler Hinsicht noch nicht ausbalanciert, dass der SpaÃŸ oft auf der Strecke bleibt. Beim Looten wird es schnell langweilig, weil man meist immer und immer wieder das gleiche findet und wenig passiert, die "Hotspots" sind dagegen unverhÃ¤ltnismÃ¤ÃŸig hart, vor allem wenn man allein unterwegs ist. Man schlÃ¤gt teils durch die Puppets hindurch, die Waffen laden nicht nach oder der Waffenwechsel funktioniert nicht richtig (verzÃ¶gert). Und das permanente "ich friere/ich schwitze/ich muss pissen/ich hab Hunger/ich hab Durst/mir ist Ã¼bel/ich blute/ich bin infiziert" nervt irgendwann. Auch ist man meist trotz AusrÃ¼stung so stark verletzt von nur 1 oder 2 SchlÃ¤gen, die man einsteckt, dass man mehr Zeit mit Verbinden verbringt als mit KÃ¤mpfen. Im schlimmsten Fall verblutet man sogar wÃ¤hrend des Verbindens. Ich spiele viele Survival- oder Shooter-Games und Frustmomente hat man immer mal,  aber das hier ist schon sehr speziell (im negativen Sinne) und fÃ¼r meinen Geschmack oft too much. Ein Dauerbrenner wird das eher nicht. Man kann natÃ¼rlich viel ein/runterstellen, das macht es angenehmer im Spiel, aber ist halt auch nicht Sinn der Sache und wenn man bestimmte Spots (Bunker) einfach meidet, weil der Hauptboss unsterblich ist und die Chance, dort leben rauszukommen gering (und der Loot ist den Aufwand leider auch nicht wert), find ich das irgendwie schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068458302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 71, 'playtime_at_review': 2983, 'last_played': 1712429716}
review: Has the potential to be one to the best survival games around but horrible experience for new players. The zed/puppet spawns are just annoyingly difficult. Other than that, the game will probably be one of the most in-dept survival experiences out there. Looking forward to the puppets spawn system being fixed and the eventual release of this game.
developer_response: Hi OfflineGhost! We're sorry to see that the latest update was not to your liking and that it soured your time with the game. We'd like to reassure you that the team is aware that the puppets spawning system does not work as intended and that the team is actively working on a tweak for this, which is why we'd like to kindly ask you to keep an eye on our Steam announcements to see when we'll manage to get this sorted out and we'd also like to express our hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161404200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2164, 'playtime_at_review': 63726, 'last_played': 1712492594}
review:
Aggiornamento dopo aggiornamento il gioco diventa sempre piÃ¹ ingiocabile, lag generico, frame-lag che aumenta e diventa sempre piÃ¹ notevole ad ogni aggiornamento: ora non si riesce piÃ¹ a sparare perchÃ© quando miri lagga talmente tanto che ti ritrovi morto, l'omino smette di correre se premi tasto destro su un oggetto nell'inventario, durante i deathmatch le armi impiegano sempre piÃ¹ tempo ad essere equipaggiate dopo aver usato le granate, se siete sfortunati rimarrete con la granata buggata in mano e senza possibilitÃ  di prendere in mano l'arma. 
Sembra poi che gli sviluppatori stiano favorendo uno stile di gioco da "ratto", mi spiego subito in modo conciso e diretto: l'obiettivo del gioco sta diventando sempre piÃ¹ simile a quello di thesims, ovvero ti fai la base e non puoi lasciarla altrimenti laggi talmente tanto da dover abbassare grafica e render scale, ma a questo punto direi che giocare a minecraft sia un'esperienza decisamente migliore e da considerare prima di comprare questo gioco

author: {'steamid': '76561198032110380', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13315, 'last_played': 1709556651}
review: Puppets just gliding to my location and then agging... wow how fun. Fix this shit.
developer_response: Hi Darwinian! We're sorry to see that you we're experiencing issues like these with the game. This sounds like the server lagged (provided you were playing in multiplayer) or that there were some issues with your connection. Either way, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ and ask you to describe the issue that you have experienced, along with potential footage of the situation, so that we can confirm that there weren't any bugs present. We'd appreciate that greatly and we'd also like to express our hope that this did not discourage you from the game entirely and that you'll give it another chance eventually - at least when we manage to hit the 1.0 version and exit Early access.

developer_response: Hi DUKES! We're sorry to see that you find the game to be unrewarding. We acknowledge that there are still some things that are waiting to find their way into the game which should make the overall experience more rewarding, but we'd like to emphasize that we are still in Early access and that we aim to get to the full, 1.0 release, and that we'll be supporting the game with additional content after its release. That is why we hope you'll give the game another chance eventually and that you'll find the sense of reward with the game that you've lost over time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970384320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 349, 'playtime_at_review': 1802, 'last_played': 1711619138}
review: In diesem Spiel ist man auf "realistische" Weise dabei zu Ã¼berleben. Man muss gut auf seine Nahrungsaufnahme achten um nicht zuviel und auch nicht zu wenig zu Essen und zu Trinken. Die KÃ¤mpfe laufen recht fair ab ohne zu Ã¼berfordern. Man darf sie aber nicht auf die leichte Schulter nehmen. Man sollte die Gegner nicht zu viele auf einmal werden lassen gegen die man aktiv kÃ¤mpft, ansonsten ist man schneller tot als man glaubt. Im Singleplayer kann sich die Servereinstellungen nach dem eigenen Belieben anpassen, im Multiplayer ist man auf die Einstellungen des Serveradmins angewiesen. Dadurch lÃ¤sst sich das eigene Vorankommen ganz individuell anpassen. Das Crafting ist relativ gut umgesetzt. Man braucht fÃ¼r die unterschiedlichen Ausbaustufen die verschiedensten Materialien die alle unterschiedlich schwer zu beschaffen sind. Manche kann man selbst herstellen, andere muss man abbauen und bei manchen muss einem das LootglÃ¼ck helfen. Wenn man aber weiÃŸ wo man die Sachen finden kann, dann ist es nur eine Frage der Zeit bis man die benÃ¶tigten Ressourcen findet. Das SchlÃ¶sserknacken ist recht simpel wenn man einmal die Mechanik dahinter verstanden hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048004536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6897, 'last_played': 1709329238}
review: Has potential, a lot of it, but too slow and it's just awfully boring. Roughly 115 hours in the game and i honestly can say this was the most time, that i felt, I have wasted on games... ever. Basically running for hours (and i literally mean hours of IRL time running in-game to somewhere) to try and NOT find one item you need. Or when you finally get a car together after 10 hours of playing for it to be stolen by a cheater with esp. Who then admitted to cheating; then awkwardly explained/bragged about the cheats on the game (while robbing us blind from inside our base after splitting everyone's wig) which include, auto lock picking, auto bomb defuse, aimbot, radar, esp, fov enhancers, magic bullets (yes a cheat to trick the game to allow someone to shoot the same bullet a million times), and some others bullshit i cant remember. I really liked this game at first, really tried to give it a shot. But after the constant dick punching from the game, I have to give this game a thumbs down. Maybe in the future when the game is completely set in stone (and has improved), then ill change the review. 'Til then: THUMBS DOWN
developer_response: Hi Bush Wookie! We're sorry to see that you've had such a negative experience with a cheater, which ultimately ruined your time with SCUM. We'd like to point out that we are continuously improving our anti-cheat capabilities, which will enable us to remove these bad actors from the game almost instantaneously. That is why we'd like to kindly ask you to contact us with the information on your situation with the cheater via https://support.scumgame.com/ . There's a good chance the cheater was already removed, but we just want to make sure to be certain. As for the part with running to not find what you need, that is simply an issue of not looking in the right spot or that someone looted the places that you wanted to loot just before you got there. If you want to always find a lot of things, we recommend that you try out playing on private servers with modified loot settings. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll find enjoyment with it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421241439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 71374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71374, 'last_played': 1703109319}
review:
Even though the game has lots of bugs, desync, unfinished stuff, and other problems...its the best game I ever played.
The amount of memories and moments that I had in this game are priceless, I always played it with a couple buddies of mine, don't recommend playing it solo, you really need a squad of at least 3 players to have a really good SCUM experience.
But I would recommend this game 100%, great memories were made
The gameplay itself isn't that bad, I think when the 1.0 version comes out with a couple more tweaks and hotfixes it's gonna reach its prime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140432087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 40782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40782, 'last_played': 1687618802}
review: Best PvP survival game there is with awesome graphics and gameplay, but......it has a very guarded and niche community that are extremely soft when it comes to PvP and dont like being killed or raided at all, be prepared to watch the world chat or discord servers explode into days long episodes of everyone accusing EVERYONE of being a hacker or sit back and watch the developers spawning in raid equipment for streamers or reviving them live on stream....its a very special place for very special people and mama always told me i was the specialist as she was putting my helmet on every morning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836785209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6627, 'last_played': 1710027760}
review: bunker is too scary. why so many dead bodies and jumping zombies and crying zombies, not fun to go in. zombies can open doors and jump in from the windows, creepiest ever. can we have some excitement and relaxing moments as well.
developer_response: Hi Evanie! We're sorry to see that you cannot find a lot of chill moments in the game. However, if you are playing in singleplayer, you can opt to remove the puppets from your game altogether from the server settings in the main menu. If you are playing in multiplayer, there are private servers that can accommodate your playstyle, you just need to find them. As for the bunkers, they are designed to bring a bit of variety to the experience as we wanted to have this scary space with those special types of enemies, but they are completely optional and you do not have to go in there. Hope that these suggestions will be enough to get you back in the game and that you will find moments of relaxation in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847690837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1709234411}
review: My mouse cursor doesn't even line up with what I'm trying to select and I have no idea what to do to keep from starving. This game sucks in it's current state but does show promise. We'll see!
developer_response: Hi BillofRights257! There's an easy fix for the issue with the cursor. Just try switching between fullscreen and windowed modes ( and back again ) in the options panel. That alone should fix it. If that doesn't work, try switching the resolution and then reverting it back again. As for starving, you need to look for locations where it would be sensible to find food, such as supermarkets, shops, olive groves, vineyards, etc. There are even POI's like the dairy farm that have a lot of edible food there. If you are a newcomer, we suggest that you help yourself with the community-created SCUM map - https://scum-map.com/en/interactive_map which can help you find food. You can also try playing on private servers where the amount of loot is greatly increased which can also help you find food easier. Hope these help with the game and that you'll consider giving it another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804550893', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 14378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8567, 'playtime_at_review': 5284, 'last_played': 1712499270}
review:
Polski:
SCUM to brutalna i realistyczna gra survivalowa, ktÃ³rej celem jest przetrwanie w niebezpiecznym Å›wiecie, bÄ™dÄ…cym arenÄ… dla brutalnych walk o dominacjÄ™. Gra oferuje gÅ‚Ä™bokie mechaniki przetrwania, w tym zarzÄ…dzanie gÅ‚odem, pragnieniem i innymi parametrami fizjologicznymi, co sprawia, Å¼e doÅ›wiadczenie jest niezwykle immersyjne. Dodatkowo, SCUM oferuje takÅ¼e elementy rywalizacji, w tym moÅ¼liwoÅ›Ä‡ prowadzenia walki z innymi graczami i zdobywania prestiÅ¼u na arenie. Pomimo pewnych niedociÄ…gniÄ™Ä‡ technicznych, gra przyciÄ…ga fanÃ³w survivali, ktÃ³rzy szukajÄ… brutalnego wyzwania.

English:
SCUM is a brutal and realistic survival game where the goal is to survive in a dangerous world, serving as an arena for brutal fights for dominance. The game offers deep survival mechanics, including managing hunger, thirst, and other physiological parameters, making the experience incredibly immersive. Additionally, SCUM also offers competitive elements, including the ability to engage in combat with other players and gain prestige in the arena. Despite some technical shortcomings, the game attracts survival fans looking for a brutal challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198841474018', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 36111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35465, 'last_played': 1709492815}
review:
SCUM delivers a visceral and intense survival experience that pushes the genre to new heights. Set in a massive open world, players are dropped into a brutal environment where every decision matters. From managing hunger and hydration to navigating hostile encounters with other players and AI threats, SCUM demands both strategy and adaptability. 
The game's comprehensive character customization and progression systems allow for deep personalization, while its realistic physics and mechanics add an immersive layer of authenticity. Whether you're scavenging for resources, crafting tools, or engaging in intense firefights, SCUM keeps you on the edge of your seat with its relentless challenges and dynamic gameplay. With frequent updates and a passionate community, SCUM continues to evolve, making it a must-play for fans of the survival genre.

review: Game gud, but to respawn in this game cost money. So you build a base and you can't respawn at your base because you don't have money in game to respawn at your base.Devs have room temperature IQ.

Regardless, we hope that this does not discourage you from the game entirely and that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157239734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 611, 'playtime_at_review': 13019, 'last_played': 1711400529}
review: This Horde update has ruined the game for me. Some people might like it but I don't enjoy landing on top of a puppet and having it scream its whole fucking family to gang bang me in the woods. Please leave me alone puppets. I just want to make my shitty stone knife and run from Z0 to B3 to my teammate, who's also dying to your shitty cousins screaming.
developer_response: Hi Bearded Dragon! We're sorry to see that you are thoroughly disappointed with the game. You'll be pleased to know that the team is aware that this feature does not work properly and that we are actively working on tweaking this system so that puppets spawn more organically. As for you and your friend spawning on different sides of the map, the official servers do not support this feature at the moment, but if you want to start playing together from the get-go, you can try finding a private server where admins are willing to teleport you together. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving SCUM another chance and that you'll rejoin the game, especially after we manage to get to the 1.0 version.

author: {'steamid': '76561199090113104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1635390731}
developer_response: Hi Fungus! We're sorry to see that you've found the game to be disappointing and that it did not live up to your expectations. While we are unsure what specifically soured your time with it, we'd like to emphasize that SCUM is still in Early access and that we still have a lot of work to do with the game before we get to the full 1.0 version. That being said, we hope you'll consider giving the game another chance once we'll manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104598239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 25043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2253, 'playtime_at_review': 25043, 'last_played': 1712082368}
review:
Es un buen juego de supervivencia, grÃ¡ficos chulos, con mucho contenido, armas (fabuloso), vehÃ­culos, caza y pesca, construcciÃ³n de bases muy bueno, muchÃ­simos edificios con interiores, mapa variadÃ­simo con zonas espectaculares y con los sistemas de metabolismo, medicina, atributos y cocina mÃ¡s completos ke he visto hasta hoy, con amigos diversiÃ³n al 1000%.

Si te gustan estos juegos lo vas a disfrutar seguro, yo lo juego y lo seguirÃ© jugando pero no le puedo dar reseÃ±a positiva. DespuÃ©s de 6 aÃ±os en desarrollo sigue plagado de errores ke te pueden arruinar horas de juego en un momento. Tiene 8 DLCs ke son pura estÃ©tica y apoyo al desarrollo, espero ke cuando lo terminen no metan armas o contenido paytowin. Dicen ke le falta poco para salir de acceso anticipado y tambiÃ©n dicen ke lo van a cambiar al motor Unreal 5, ya veremos si esto Ãºltimo no rompe aÃºn mÃ¡s el juego.

Problemas en el PvE:
Cuando has jugado un tiempo y ya tienes de todo, dejas de jugar porke no hay ningÃºn reto y se vuelve repetitivo hasta la saciedad. En cuanto aprendes como lidiar con el entorno, animales depredadores, zombis y robots no son ninguna amenaza. Los lobos los oyes de lejos y se matan fÃ¡cilmente, los osos son de chiste para lo ke deberÃ­a de ser un oso, los zombis es raro que te maten (palante patras y listo), los robots los degradaron tanto ke ya tampoco son un desafÃ­o. NPCs ke atraviesan puertas y suelos, zonas donde atraviesas el suelo cuando vas en tu vehÃ­culo y lo pierdes todo. El mundo submarino, naufragios, cuevas, entorno, es inexplorable ya ke hay un tiburÃ³n inmortal ke aparece y adiÃ³s.

Problemas serios en el PvP: 
El sonido es malÃ­simo, no puedes ubicar disparos, en ocasiones no se oyen puertas ni pasos. 
El sistema de respawn es muy injusto para el ganador de un combate, haciendo ke el jugador derrotado pueda aparecer en cuestiÃ³n de 2-5 minutos en el Ã¡rea del combate, mientras ke el ganador necesita recuperarse de sus heridas, estando con movilidad muy reducida o nula mÃ¡s de 5 minutos, dado el complejo sistema de salud.

En conclusiÃ³n, si arreglan los problemas serios, lo abren de una vez a los modders y se ponen las pilas, serÃ¡ el mejor juego de supervivencia del mercado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198953105004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6010, 'last_played': 1709753558}
review:
Es la cuarta vez que el vehiculo en el que ando se cae del mapa infiniamente, haciendo que pierda todo, podrian ponerse a jugar un poco al juego que hacen ustedes, y darse cuenta de los 100000000000 bugs que tiene, que aunque este en beta se deberian resolver, porque son tipicos bugs predecibles, como quedarse trabado en un lugar random porque al juego le da la gana, o que simplemente vas por la ruta y te caes del mapa porque si. Por ahora todas las horas que le eh metido y son muchas, las eh disfrutado muy poco. Siempre termino yendome del juego porque se bugea o porque pasa algo que te arruina todo el fameo que venis haciendo.
Ponganse las pilas.

author: {'steamid': '76561199246394271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1710038115}
review: If you're looking for an extremely difficult zombie apocalypse survival game, this game might be for you. The world of SCUM is an immersive open world (a humongous open world!) filled with towns infested by vicious zombies that will make your experience miserable, secrets, and vast terrains of grass, forests, etc, for you to try and survive in peace! This game is guaranteed to make you feel emotions such as determination, entertainment, fear, frustration, frustration, and frustration (did I mention frustration?). Considering this game is still in early access, I would still rate it an easy 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198986399199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1708816595}
review: It's a fun game, playable in its current stage of development but does have various factors that make the fun of playing short-lived. Starting the game is especially difficult due to you being dropped in a random part of the map every single time you drop in, the completely unnecessary radiation, robots, "puppets" that randomly spawn next to you, or in buildings within your base after you place a banner, not being able to go to the trader to buy stuff until you hit a certain fame level (but you can sell to them). The tutorial also explains very basic concepts of the game with no real direction being given. Items rarely spawn to the point where you're looking for hours to find stuff of value. The game is fun to an extent but overly difficult to the point where its not enjoyable for long without playing with others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186410610', 'num_games_owned': 1851, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1708797775}
review: Complete garbage, its incredible how it became worse to be honest.
developer_response: Hi Marliun! We're sorry to see that the game left you thoroughly disappointed. We'd like to emphasize that we're still in Early access and that we are aware that the game still has some underlying issues that undermine the experience our players have with the game. That being said, we'd also like to provide some reassurance and state that the team is committed towards solving these issues and to making the best possible version of SCUM when we hit the 1.0 mark. We truly hope that you'll consider giving it another chance once we manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206948575', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8093, 'last_played': 1708716687}
review: This game has been out for 6 fucking years yet there is so many frustrating and literally game breaking bugs. within only a few days me and my buddies managed to somehow get our car stuck inside a telephone pole, lost the ability to use our mouse to select "respawn". I fell through the map 5+ times in one day one resulted in me being catapulted across the map into the ocean which cost me hours and hours worth of gear. This game is the definition of trash. The devs are clearly milking this shit out and have done nothing at all to fix these bugs that have existed since day 1. there is absolutely zero excuse for bugs this fucking big in a game thats almost at the global release stage. This game needs a lot of work and polishing. Could be fun if you enjoy wasting countless hours of your life just to get a 15 second straight lag that sends you rubber banding across the map. Or if you enjoy driving a car and textures just dont render so you end up slamming into a hay bale or rock that you literally couldnt see, resulting in you totaling your vehicle that took you ages to put together. I cannot stress enough how fucking retarded this game is. This game is a direct reflection of the lazy fucks that made it. Don't give these retards any more money.
developer_response: Hi bullgawd2679! We're sorry to see that you have experienced issues such as the ones you've mentioned. You are right to feel frustrated over this. We acknowledge that the game can be affected by such occurrences, especially on more populated servers. However, we'd like to provide at least some reassurance and state that the team is committed towards fixing these issues before we hit the 1.0 version of SCUM and that we'll have a dedicated optimization and bugfixing phase in order to make the game as polished as possible. We also understand and acknowledge the criticism regarding the long development time, but the end is on the horizon and we'll be hitting the 1.0 version in the foreseeable future. While the situations is far from ideal, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance - at least when we manage to get these things sorted out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372876228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1707083206}
review: Walking Simulator with no clear instructions on how to progress
developer_response: Hi The Tism! We're sorry to see that the game did not live up to your expectations! We acknowledge that the game has a steep learning curve and that some of the game's mechanics can be better communicated. However, there is an in-game manual that describes the mechanics of the game that is located when you press the 'Tab' button. As we'll be nearing the exit of our Early access run, we'll make sure to improve the new player experience to minimize situations such as the one you had. We respect your refund decision and we'd like to express our hope that you'll consider giving the game another try eventually once we manage to get to the 1.0 release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198767696167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1708749839}
review: Honestly the devs seem to have over-prioritized realism with this game, exhaustion is just a constant overbearing force that requires you to rest sometimes for multiple irl hours at a time, reloading is a pain requiring you to drag ammo to a magazine then to drag the magazine to the gun making firearms rarely useful, and I'm not personally a fan of inventory tetris. There are definitely positives to the game notably the nutrition system works quite well and real life medical problems with the exception of exhaustion flow very well within the game. It is also quite funny to have to remove your pants so as to prevent your character simply squatting and taking a deuce directly in your underwear, a misstep requiring many a rare bars of soap to clean.
developer_response:
Hi CopLegacy! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed in certain aspects. The exhaustion mechanic kicks in if you are bringing your character always to the brink of his/hers physical abilities, meaning that things such as prolonged sprinting sessions with weights on your back can bring your character down quickly. That is why sometimes it is a good idea to rest on chairs, beds, or simply lying on the ground so that your character doesn't get exhausted.

As for the reloading, you do not have to manually place a magazine into your weapon each time you want to reload. The only manual thing that you have to do is place bullets into the magazine. However, if you have a magazine in your inventory that has bullets in it, you can simply press 'R' to reload your weapon.

Also, we checked the situation with defecation and we have found that the character does not soil themselves if you pick the 'Poop' option through the Tab menu. You only do so if you do not manage to do that intentionally, which then results in your character relieving themselves with their clothes on.

Hope this clears it up for you and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually.

Die Zombies sind herausfordernd und in einem guten Team macht PVE sehr viel SpaÃŸ. Wer gerne mal etwas anderes ausprobieren will, als wie 0815 Survival Games, der ist hier gut bedient.

developer_response: Hi shirotoko! We're sorry to see that you are experiencing these issues and that they are souring your experience with SCUM. We'd like to kindly direct you to our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with this. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game entirely because of something that can be fixed, which is why we truly hope that you'll contact us so we can get to the bottom of it and so that you can continue playing SCUM.

developer_response: Hi Ticklez! We're sorry to see that you did not have a satisfying experience with SCUM. While the official PvP servers cater much more to squads, you can find official solo/duo server that focuses on sole survival of individual players in a PvP setting. You also have the option to enjoy the game in singleplayer. Also, there are private servers with all kinds of specific settings that are modified for various playstyles that you can partake in. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll find a mode of playing SCUM that caters to you the most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065798761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5064, 'last_played': 1709967433}
review:
It's not bad game, but it's missing something to get recommend.

I went in blind. In terms of single player it was over for me after fully looting bunker. Endgame then would be multiplayer and pvp. The problem with that is, that there is no way to store your items without being looted. If you ever had base in such game you know you get raided sooner than later and all your stuff you worked for and base you worked to build will be gone and destroyed because "game mechanic". It's not fun so I pass on that. Devs seem to have wrong idea about bases, they should add some small storage that cannot be looted, otherwise multiplayer is really really demoralising and unfun.

Otherwise it's cool survival game with a complex mechanics that will be appealing to very few specific people. And that's a lot of work.
developer_response: Hi sunny boy! We're sorry to see that you've lost interest in the game. We're currently focused on delivering a fully optimised, polished and bug-free experience as we'll be nearing the full 1.0 release of the game. We acknowledge the gripes that you've mentioned with the game and we'd like to reassure you that more content will be coming into SCUM before we exit Early access and that we'll be supporting the game after its release. We hope that you will give the game another chance eventually and that you will be able enjoy it enough to recommend it one day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996191797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 10332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10332, 'last_played': 1704403452}
review: SCUM is an unpolished mess of a game that fails to deliver on its promises. Using early access as a crutch for its numerous issues is a cop-out, and the constant push for DLC shows how the developers have become more focused on making money than fixing the core gameplay. The lack of optimization, bugs, and lackluster content make this a frustrating experience that ultimately feels like a cash grab. Save your money and wait for a more complete and competent game
developer_response: Hi Heretic! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We'd like to point out that being in Early access and the support we received from our fans with the DLC's has greatly helped with the development of the game - especially during the turmoil of the pandemic. However, we do acknowledge that the game still has some underlying issues even after such a long time in the oven, but we'd like to provide some reassurance that we will make sure to fix them and to further polish and optimize it in order to make the 1.0 experience as smooth as possible. That is why we'd like to express our hope that you will consider giving the game another chance once we manage to get these issues sorted out.

review:
Also nach 50 Spielstunden von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung vorne weg .
Selbst auf einen  Intel System mit 4 Kernen  ,32 GB  Arbeitspeicher und ner NVidia  1080 TI absolut flÃ¼ssig mit bis zu 120 FPS .
Kommen wir zum Spiel und da gehe ich vom Grundspiel aus  , man kann am Anfang zwischen  Mann und Frau auswÃ¤hlen ,deren Aussehen  kann man  verÃ¤ndern  und wer mehr will , den bieten  manche DLCÂ´s mehr Auswahl .
Dazu kommt noch die 5 Attribute  ,die man individuell einstellen kann .
Ist man damit fertig ,wird man  aus dem Flugzeug geworfen als verurteilter HÃ¤ftling .
Man landet per Fallschirm und einen implantierten Chip im Hinterkopf  auf einer Insel mit Zombies .
Sollte man die Insel verlassen wollen , wird der Chip  im Hinterkopf explodieren .
Deine Strafe verbÃ¼ÃŸt du auf der Insel  ,soviel zur Story .
Fast alles ist einstellbar in den Optionen ,wenn man keine Horden will ,kann man es abstellen ,wenn man mehr Loot will , geht dies auch .
Man fÃ¤ngt also an mit Steinen  und Holz sammeln wie in jeden  Survival  Spiel , aber dann nimmt es auch ganz schnell eigene ZÃ¼ge an .
Man baut daraus Pfeil und Bogen ,Speer und Messer , Rucksack und KÃ¶cher .
Dazu kommen irgendwann die Zombies dazu . 
Man trifft sie in StÃ¤dten  ,vereinzelt in WÃ¤lder  , MilitÃ¤r Bunker ,SchrottplÃ¤tze , MilitÃ¤rcamps und es gibt verschiedene Arten von denen .
Von explodierenden Zombies bis zu fast untÃ¶tbaren Zombies und Zombie Horden ist alles dabei ,dazu kommen noch die MechÂ´s , die einen den Gar aus machen , ruck zuck .
Ich bin ja nicht so der Freund vom looten  , aber Scum geht noch einen Schritt weiter .
Es gibt HÃ¤ndler ,wo man seinen Loot verkaufen kann ,man kann sich bei HÃ¤ndlern eindecken mit allen ,was man praktisch looten kann , abhÃ¤ngig von seinen Ruhm .
Je lÃ¤nger man lebt ,desto mehr Ruhmpunkte erhÃ¤lt man . 
Man muss auf seine Gesundheit achten , kann seine 5 Attribute verbessern durch  Crafting ,schiessen usw.
Bei kÃ¤mpfen mit Zombies kann man schwer verletzt werden , es gibt Antibiotika , Vitamin Pillen usw. um eine Infektion entsprechend zu behandeln .
Was kann man alles looten fragt ihr euch , es fÃ¤ngt an von Nahrung ,Schraubendrehern , Waffen , Munition , BÃ¼roklammern , und sogar Autos , FahrrÃ¤der .
Bei den Autos kÃ¶nnen Reifen ,Sitze ,TÃ¼ren , Lichtmaschiene und auch die Batterie fehlen .
Die findet man dann meistens an anderer Stelle oder baut sie von anderen herumstehenden Autos ab .
Scum bietet auch Base Building an mit vielen MÃ¶glichkeiten ,dieses Spiel hat einen Multiplayer ,da ist fÃ¼r jeden was dabei  von PVE bis PVP .
Selbst RolePlay ist bei diesen Spiel mÃ¶glich , das erinnert mich stark an meine Arma 3 / Altis Life  Zeit .
Scum geht aber eher in die Schiene PubG  mit Zombies .
Kommen wir zurÃ¼ck zum Spiel .
SpÃ¤testens wenn man sein erstes Auto gefunden hat ,will man die restlichen Teile looten , 
wenn es nicht schon komplett ist  .
Alles ist mÃ¶glich ,VerschleiÃŸ ist auch ein Thema , Autos ,KettensÃ¤gen ,Flammenwerfer ,alles muss betankt und auch irgendwann repariert werden ,selbst die Waffe kann kaputtgehen .
 Man kann  kochen ,man findet Gasflaschen  , in den HÃ¤usern gibt es Gaskocher und Gasherde ,die Gaskocher kann man ebenfalls looten .
Man arbeitet praktisch auf einer eigenen Base hin , immer im Hinterkopf ,jeden Moment kÃ¶nnte man auf eine Horde , Zombies treffen ..
Die Fahrzeuge im Spiel Ã¤hneln an bekannten Fahrzeugen der RealitÃ¤t  , da haben wir den bekannten VW Golf 2 ,der im Spiel  Ã¤hnlich heiÃŸt  , den Lada  , im Spiel  Laika genannt und den neu in Patch 0.95 hinzugekommenen Ranger Pickup .
Es gab mal eine Zeit lang den Traktor ,der soll wohl irgendwann vielleicht wieder kommen .
Ihr seht schon , ich kÃ¶nnte immer weiter schreiben ,so tiefgrÃ¼ndig ist das Spiel .
FÃ¼r Scum gibt es verschiedene DLCÂ´s , die brauch man nicht , ich fÃ¼r meinen Teil kaufe die DLCÂ´s  um die Entwickler zu unterstÃ¼tzen .
Die Entwickler hÃ¶ren sehr auf die Comunity und setzen auch vieles um .
Die DLCÂ´s geben neben 2  vorgefertigten Charakteren auch mehr Frisuren  fÃ¼r Mann und Frau ,mehr Waffen ,  Waffenaussehen  usw.
Ich hab dieses Game gekauft  fÃ¼r um die 26 Euro , jeden Cent gut investiert , klare Kaufempfehlung .

author: {'steamid': '76561198079963569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1710276931}
review:
Titel: Ein Meisterwerk des Survival-Genres: Eine umfassende Rezension von "SCUM"

Als passionierter Spieler von Survival-Spielen war ich auf der Suche nach einem Titel, der nicht nur die Ã¼blichen Elemente bietet, sondern auch eine immersive und tiefgehende Erfahrung liefert. SCUM hat meine Erwartungen nicht nur erfÃ¼llt, sondern Ã¼bertroffen. Dieses Spiel, entwickelt von Gamepires und Croteam, ist zweifellos ein Meisterwerk des Genres und bietet eine beeindruckende Vielfalt an Gameplay-Optionen, realistische Mechaniken und eine atemberaubende grafische PrÃ¤sentation.

Ein herausragendes Merkmal von SCUM ist seine authentische Darstellung des Ãœberlebenskampfes. Vom ersten Moment an wird der Spieler in eine gnadenlose Umgebung geworfen, in der Nahrung, Wasser und Schutz lebenswichtig sind. Doch SCUM geht Ã¼ber die Ã¼blichen Mechaniken hinaus, indem es den Spielern eine Vielzahl von BedÃ¼rfnissen prÃ¤sentiert, die sie erfÃ¼llen mÃ¼ssen, darunter auch die Verwaltung von Kalorien, Proteinen und Vitaminen. Dies zwingt die Spieler, ihre Entscheidungen sorgfÃ¤ltig zu Ã¼berdenken und ihre Ressourcen effektiv zu nutzen, um am Leben zu bleiben.

Ein weiterer HÃ¶hepunkt von SCUM ist seine unerreichte Vielseitigkeit. Das Spiel bietet eine riesige offene Welt, die erkundet werden will, von dichten WÃ¤ldern bis hin zu verlassenen StÃ¤dten. DarÃ¼ber hinaus gibt es eine FÃ¼lle von Crafting-MÃ¶glichkeiten, die es den Spielern ermÃ¶glichen, ihre Umgebung zu nutzen, um Waffen, Werkzeuge und UnterkÃ¼nfte zu bauen. Diese Freiheit fÃ¶rdert die KreativitÃ¤t und erlaubt es jedem Spieler, seinen eigenen Weg zu finden.

Die Grafik von SCUM ist ein weiterer Grund, warum es sich von anderen Spielen des Genres abhebt. Die detailreiche Welt ist atemberaubend gestaltet und bietet eine beeindruckende Vielfalt an Landschaften und Umgebungen. Die Charaktermodelle sind ebenfalls Ã¤uÃŸerst realistisch und tragen dazu bei, eine immersive Spielerfahrung zu schaffen.

Abgesehen von der Einzelspielererfahrung bietet SCUM auch ein umfangreiches Mehrspieler-Feature. Spieler kÃ¶nnen sich zusammenschlieÃŸen, um zu Ã¼berleben oder gegeneinander anzutreten, was zu dynamischen und spannenden Interaktionen fÃ¼hrt. Die Integration von PvP- und PvE-Elementen sorgt fÃ¼r eine stÃ¤ndig wechselnde Spielumgebung, die selbst nach Stunden des Spielens nicht langweilig wird.

Insgesamt ist SCUM ein herausragendes Beispiel fÃ¼r das Survival-Genre. Mit seiner realistischen Darstellung des Ãœberlebenskampfes, seiner beeindruckenden Vielseitigkeit und seiner atemberaubenden Grafik setzt es neue MaÃŸstÃ¤be fÃ¼r das Genre. Egal, ob Sie alleine spielen oder sich mit Freunden zusammenschlieÃŸen, SCUM bietet eine unvergleichliche Spielerfahrung, die Sie stundenlang in ihren Bann ziehen wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284496981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1708805624}
review:
SCUM est un bon jeu, il n'est pas parfait mais pas nul.
Je n'ai pas jouÃ© Ã  ce jeu des tonnes d'heures mais suffisamment pour souligner certains dÃ©fauts et certaines qualitÃ©s.

SCUM est complet comparÃ© Ã  son rival DayZ qui m'a laissÃ© un goÃ»t amer par son vide.
On ne peut le modder, du moins pas depuis le workshop Steam et pas que je sache. Cependant, le jeu est complet donc nul besoin de le modder.
Ce jeu se veut complexe et compliquÃ©, ce qu'il rÃ©ussit Ã  faire mÃªme s'il n'excelle pas dans ce domaine.
C'est un bon jeu de survie, comme il y en a des centaines qui ont copiÃ© la recette de DayZ ou 7 Days to Die pour la remanier Ã  leur sauce, Ã§a n'est pas une mauvaise sauce. Il se dÃ©marque sur certains points comme j'ai citÃ© en haut : la complexitÃ©. D'autres points Ã©galement comme l'ajout de robots qui protÃ¨gent les zones Ã  gros loot.
Bon, maintenant quels sont les points forts et moins forts :

Points forts :
Le gameplay que je trouve intÃ©ressant sur certaines facettes.
L'ambiance qui est plutÃ´t rÃ©ussie et sympathique.
Le solo, car oui, tout le monde n'est pas sociable donc tout le monde ne veut pas jouer en RP.
La complexitÃ©, c'est ce que je souligne depuis le dÃ©but, mais c'est LE point fort.
La satisfaction de tuer un joueur, oui, comme beaucoup de jeux de survie dans ce genre.

Points faibles :
Les serveurs, dites-vous que j'ai passÃ© une soirÃ©e entiÃ¨re Ã  chercher Ã  accÃ©der aux serveurs qui ne faisaient que de crasher.
La mauvaise optimisation, j'ai une config plutÃ´t sympathique pourtant lorsque je joue en multi, le jeu varie entre 120 et 20 fps, ce qui fait une grande diffÃ©rence. Cependant, en solo le jeu est stable.


Alors concluons cet avis, pourquoi acheter SCUM ? Je ne sais pas. C'est un jeu comme un autre, comme il en existe des tonnes. Mais, malgrÃ© qu'il en existe des tonnes, il reste meilleur (selon moi) que certains jeux comme DayZ (oui, je n'aime pas ce jeu qui vaut trop cher pour ce qu'il propose.) MalgrÃ© tout, en lisant les avis, le jeu regresse avec le temps, donc vaut-il le coÃ»t ? je ne sais pas.
Il est sympa et on peut y passer des heures sans se soucier du temps.
Il existe de meilleurs jeux dans ce genre, mais il s'en sort bien.
Seul vous pourrez fonder votre avis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260139231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 608, 'playtime_at_review': 5826, 'last_played': 1711416762}
review: This game needs enemy human NPCs that have a range of weapons and gear, quests for traders would be nice, but adding the enemy human NPCs to singleplayer at the very least would be a huge improvement if you don't want it in multiplayer servers, the world feels so empty in singleplayer and add co-op so people can play together in their world with their own rules and not be bothered by other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144300918', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1710964453}
review: the idea of the game is not so bad but the system is trash , Fame points system is so stupid once you die you lose sooo much huge amount which will reset you for older levels in game , and there are more than million reason to die , so much details are killing the game seriously , they want you to play the game 45 hours a day lol no recommended at all , here RUST take the win 100%
developer_response: Hi Cleveland Brown (RACISM)! We're sorry to see that the fame points system ruined your time with the game. SCUM is designed to be a hardcore survival game and the death of your character is something that cannot go without certain repercussions. However, we understand that this system is not to everyone's liking, which is why we've enabled adjustments for it for private servers, which is why we'd like to advise that you try and find a private server where the loss of fame points is modified so that you don't lose as much when you die. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and find a server that caters to your preferences.

We understand that some of these have been present for quite some time, but we'd like to emphasize that we still have a lot of work to do in this period before the release of the full 1.0 version of the game and that we'll focus on polishing, optimizing and bugfixing - in other words making SCUM the best possible version of itself. author: {'steamid': '76561198054256395', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 63719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5120, 'playtime_at_review': 51481, 'last_played': 1712481544}
review: Honestly the best survival game I have ever played. This game (at least for me) is everything I wanted DayZ to be. With that being said, it in its vanilla form is by no means easy. Also, it is still full of bugs. Non of these bugs are game breaking or even ruin the experience (at least for me). This game is 10/10 in environmental beauty, 10/10 in replay ability, and 10/10 when it comes to development being open and honest about issues and addressing them. This games is overwhelmingly ambitious for any developer, and the fact it has made it to where it is now is a feat in itself. If you are new to the game and wanting to take baby steps towards learning it or are looking for a more casual experience, then come join us at 40 HOUR WEEKS! Thatâ€™s right, I enjoy this game so much, and want to share my enjoyment of it, that I pay for a public server to share with you. Whether itâ€™s on my server or anyone elseâ€™s, do yourself a favor and give this game a try. It offers things you will never find in other open world survival titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975754961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 47, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1712020217}
review:
unable to get started.   1 step forward & 2 steps back.   Food is not available.  the puppets seem to spawn before you can get even a basic stone spear crafted-- and they spawn in crowds of 3-6 at a time.   1 or 2 i can handle.  but 4-6?  nope.
rinse & repeat until your out of money and have to recreate your character.
developer_response: Hi kittle! We're sorry to see that the current state of the game made you disappointed with it. While food can easily be found in a fair share of POI's, kitchens, supermarkets, etc., we acknowledge that there are issues with the puppets spawns. That is why we'd like to reassure you and confirm that the team is working on a fix for that system, which will make puppet spawns much more organic. That is why we'd like to invite you to keep an eye on our Steam announcements to see when the fix for this system will drop and express our hope that you will give SCUM another try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069662453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 99871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 127, 'playtime_at_review': 68785, 'last_played': 1711558009}
review: I can honestly say now with over 1000 hrs playing this game, that it is totally worth it. There are still bugs and glitches but in the grand scheme of things, these are minor nuisances given what the game has become. The Devs seem to be on top of it and really get the job done. There is literally something here for everyone. You can excel in pretty much any game-play style, be it loner, team player, PvE, PvP, crafter, base builder, chef, gearhead, you name it... I'm looking forward to another 1000+ hours to see what's next!

review: Raw shit. Still. A lot of bugs, poor on performance. You can spent a lot of hours of playing and then just cant connect to the server because of regular stupid errors. Enjoy new character. Network performance is awful. Don't recommend this game. Piece of crap.
developer_response: Hi stolker! There were some unexpected and unforeseen disturbances with the servers over the weekend, which created some issues for our players. We apologize for the inconvenience and we'd like to emphasize that the issues are present no more and that you can continue playing SCUM. We hope that this temporary occurrence did not detract you from playing the game altogether and that you'll consider giving it another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405739156', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 65455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62287, 'last_played': 1709757550}
review: Scum is a challenging survival game set in a vast open world. The graphics are great and the gameplay is intense, requiring quick thinking and skill to survive. Customization options for your character are extensive and leveling up skills adds depth to the game. Overall, Scum is a fun and competitive survival experience that will keep players hooked

review: I'll keep it short. This is a fun game. It's my favorite survival game. The graphics and gameplay outmatch other games in the genre. I embarrassingly admit that I held off purchasing this game for years due to the "complexity" of the health and equipment management systems. Well, I was wrong. It's fun and intuitive once you figure it out. The devs do a great job with updates. I'm still a noob with just over 30 hours in, but I don't have much negative to say. I'm looking forward to future updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018211540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 41167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41056, 'last_played': 1708118377}
review:
Time for a review.
1. A lot of cinematics and some pictures you can see here have nothing to do with the game.
2. The grind for stats, for resources, the amount needed to upgrade or even build your base. The fact that everything loses durability and quite fast. Some stuff should not lose durability at all..
3. Weird updates, no good stuff for the game. Slow progress. Bugs not being fixed. Wheelbarrow is broken for years and is annoying as you know what.
4. Lack of construction options and information.
5. Huge lack of QOL, like auto sorting options. If you like sorting thousands of items, endlessly.. Lack of basic information of stats, which you can only check in the game itself, but not when creating a character.
6. Lack of search filters for servers. Basically have to go into a dozen of servers, check everything yourself and research, ask, instead of having all the QOL option from the beginning.
7. Would never recommend anyone playing on vanilla servers (official), the drop rate and skill progression is so bad. And you don't get to keep stats switching servers.
8. Big lack of content, there are caves, diving areas, etc. Which have nothing. And nothing changed for years.
9. When you get to "late game" when you have a good base and most materials, there is nothing to do except pvp. There's only abandoned bunker with broken Brenor and nuclear power plant, which isn't even worth doing.
10. To put it all together, huge grind, so later you can pvp. Bugs, some that don't get fixed. Lack of QOL, features, building options. It's just boring grind with nothing to do in the endgame. Not polished. If you can, give it a try, but expect to spend many hours of grind. There's so many things i can list but, not going to post a wall of text.
developer_response: Hi blackborg! We'd like to thank you for this extensive review and we'd like to express our regret that the game did not live up to your expectations and that the lack of quality of life features is something that hinders your time with it. Some of these things are valid and would definitely elevate the experience of SCUM. We'd like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and there are still changes and improvements that will find their way into the game prior to its full 1.0 release. Apart from adding new content and improvements, we'll also be polishing, optimizing and bugfixing, in other words making the SCUM the best possible version of itself. After its initial release, we'll also make sure to further support the game with additional improvements, especially those concerning quality of life. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll consider returning to it, at lest when we manage to hit the 1.0 mark.

review: No item found! Thats all i know about the Game so far. Ah and Rags, a lot of rags..
developer_response: Hi ItsMeSnipe! We're sorry to see that the perceived lack of loot has ruined your time with the game. We've tweaked the loot system multiple times in order to modify the amount of loot on the server. It is important to note that SCUM was never designed to be a game that showers you with loot and that in order to find the best items in the game, you will need to brave the most challenging places in the game, which are abandoned bunkers, police stations, regular bunkers, and other points of interest. However, we recognize that some players prefer to play with greater loot spawns, which is why we've enabled private servers where server owners can modify a host of settings - loot included. That is why we'd like to advise that you try and find a server that caters to your preferences and express our hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561199283816737', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28472, 'last_played': 1708811674}
review: Its gonna be a great game at some point but right now its not... devs keeps doing randoms changes that are just not good or against the actual concept of the game which is suppose to be extra realistic... For example: can you give me one single good reason why you changed the bayonets damages! every bayonets use to kill puppets and razor one shot now its only the N9 for the M16  its completely unrealistic and unbalanced if the N9 one shots puppet then all bayonets should be able to (like it use to) ! All peoples I talked to in game are not in favour of this change its just dumb honestly... And right now the game feels more empty than ever because the puppet spawn are broken they either spawn right in front of you in bunkers or they never actually spawn in poi other then bunkers, if theres multiple players at the same place they wont spawn when you enter a city alone no puppets are gonna be there but after a 15min they are gonna start to spawn randomly in the city. the hordes system is broken too most of the time when a horde will spawn its gonna be literally one or two zombies... To be fair tho they are trying to repair the spawns and they are aware of the problem. The more you play the more you think that there's not enough clothing, guns, accessories for guns, melee weapons and vehicles. I played 475h and its a love and hate it at the same time type of game. The final project is really interesting, I would love to see it and play it as its meant to but am starting to think that's its not gonna happen after 5 years in early access... I hope so tho !
developer_response: Hi PunkTriggered! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed and we'd like to thank you for seeing past through some of the issues and that you've managed to find enjoyment with it. As you've said yourself, we're working on a fix for the puppet spawns, which should be completed sooner rather than later. As we'll be nearing the full, 1.0 release of the game, we'll make sure to look over all the items and their effects and will make sure to make necessary adjustments if a need for them will arise. We really hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance and that you'll find enjoyment with the game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043431847', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1061, 'playtime_at_review': 8952, 'last_played': 1712454433}
review:
SCUM: A Masterpiece of Survival Gaming

If you're searching for a gaming experience that pushes the boundaries of immersion, strategy, and raw survival instincts, look no further than SCUM. This game isn't just another run-of-the-mill survival title; it's a masterpiece that sets a new standard for the genre.

From the moment you step foot into its vast and unforgiving world, SCUM captivates you with its attention to detail and realism. The sheer scale of the environment is staggering, offering an expansive landscape teeming with dangers and opportunities. Whether you're scavenging for resources, engaging in intense firefights, or simply trying to stay alive against the elements, every moment in SCUM feels like a true test of your skills and adaptability.

One of the most impressive aspects of SCUM is its deep character customization and progression system. Gone are the days of generic avatars; in SCUM, you have unparalleled control over every aspect of your character's appearance, abilities, and even bodily functions. Yes, you read that right â€“ SCUM takes realism to a whole new level by incorporating detailed metabolism and physiology mechanics, forcing players to monitor everything from their nutrition and hydration to their heart rate and metabolism. It's an incredibly immersive feature that adds a new layer of challenge and complexity to the game.

But SCUM isn't just about surviving â€“ it's also about thriving. The game offers a plethora of activities and objectives to pursue, from building fortifications and crafting weapons to participating in intense PvP battles and forming alliances with other players. The freedom to play however you choose is one of SCUM's greatest strengths, allowing you to carve out your own path in this harsh and unforgiving world.

Visually, SCUM is stunning, with breathtaking landscapes, realistic weather effects, and meticulously detailed character models. The attention to detail is evident in every aspect of the game, from the way sunlight filters through the trees to the way your character's clothes become gradually dirtier and more worn over time. It's clear that the developers poured their hearts and souls into creating a world that feels alive and immersive in every way.

Furthermore, what truly sets SCUM apart is the unwavering dedication of its developers to delivering a top-tier gaming experience. The team behind SCUM is committed to perfection, evident in their constant stream of hotfixes and regular updates. They're not content with resting on their laurels; instead, they actively listen to the community, swiftly addressing issues, and implementing player feedback to continuously improve the game. This level of responsiveness and commitment ensures that SCUM remains fresh, exciting, and bug-free, providing players with an ever-evolving world to explore and conquer. In an industry where post-launch support can often be lacking, SCUM stands out as a shining example of how to do it right, cementing its status as a true gem in the gaming landscape.

In conclusion, SCUM is nothing short of a triumph. With each update, SCUM only gets better, promising an enduring and dynamic gaming experience for years to come. Whether you're a hardcore survival enthusiast or just looking for a unique and unforgettable gaming experience, SCUM delivers in spades. Don't miss out on what is undoubtedly one of the greatest survival games of all time.

developer_response: Hi SamBal! We're sorry to see that your time with the game was less than satisfying. SCUM was always intended as a hardcore survival experience that relies heavily on realism, and staying alive on the island is designed to be challenging. If you are playing on PvP servers and are alone, you will have a much harder time against established and populous squads that are geared up and armed to the teeth. If you are playing solo and are new to the game, we'd advise that you try out the PvE servers or singleplayer in order to get yourself acquainted with the game and its mechanics, and then try out either our official or private solo/duo servers. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance and try out a slightly different approach where you will find a setting where you can enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381755148', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 11747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11616, 'last_played': 1708097956}
review:
Summary:
SCUM, yes this is an abbreviation for "Survival Combat United Masses", thrusts players into a challenging and gritty open world survival experience. Developed by Gamepires and Croteam, this game takes the survival genre to a higher level with a highly detailed metabolic system, realistic environments, and intense combat mechanics.

Gameplay:
SCUM excels at offering a deep and immersive survival experience. From regulating a character's metabolism to scavenging for resources and crafting essential items, every action feels essential to survival. The metabolic system adds an extra layer of realism, requiring players to monitor their character's calorie intake, hydration levels, and even vitamin balance. The game's expansive open world map provides plenty of opportunities for exploration and discovery, with a variety of landmarks, cities, and military installations to plunder and conquer.

Graphics and Sound:
Visually, SCUM impresses with its detailed environments and realistic lighting effects. From dense forests to abandoned urban areas, each location feels different and immersive. The sound design further enhances the atmosphere, with ambient noise and environmental effects adding to the sense of immersion. However, occasional bugs and glitches can detract from the overall experience.

Combat and Interaction:
Combat in SCUM is intense and unforgiving. Whether engaged in close-quarters combat or long-range firefights, players must utilize cover, tactics, and skill to outmaneuver their opponents. The game's realistic ballistics system adds depth to gunplay, requiring players to consider factors such as bullet drop and weapon recoil. Additionally, SCUM has a strong interaction system, allowing players to communicate, trade, and form alliances with other survivors.

Community and Updates:
One of SCUM's greatest strengths is its active and dedicated community. With regular updates and fixes from the developer, the game continues to develop and improve over time. Player feedback is valued and implemented frequently, ensuring that SCUM remains a dynamic and engaging experience for both new and veteran players.

Conclusion:
In conclusion, SCUM sets a new standard for the survival genre with its complex gameplay mechanics, immersive world, and intense combat. While not without its flaws, the game offers a challenging and rewarding experience for those willing to take on the harsh post-apocalyptic landscape. With a dedicated community and continued support from the developers, SCUM remains a must-play title for survival game fans.

Request: 
Polish this game so that it becomes smoother and the gameplay is still a bit stiff
Add and upgrade several NPCs, both zombies and NPC figures (quest reward items) because the game feels lonely and empty
Add features and items to build a base, hold a massive zombie attack  when you have a base
Add some characters or bots that help in the grinding process (single player)
Increase vehicle spawn when we have difficulty looking for vehicles
Add various animals to hunt for food according to the climate and place

Recommended to play 5/5
developer_response: Hi ğ“šğ–†ğ–“ğ–™ğ–šğ–‘ğ•±ğ•®! We're sorry to see that the game left you with mixed feelings. We're aware that SCUM's been in Early access for quite some time and and that it still has some underlying issues, but we're confident that we'll iron those out and further improve the overall experience as we'll be nearing the full 1.0 release, which is almost upon us. We can see that you have found enjoyment with the game as it is, and we hope that you'll give it another chance and that you'll return to the game soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339267253', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7495, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1712497722}
review: OK I will admit that my early review was out of frustration of not knowing the games steep learning curve, but now, even with a game that has some issues, I am addicted. The harsh reality of every single thing wanting you dead makes me keep coming back for the challenge. There is no safety blanket like I had become accustom to over the years from other games that are trying to appeal to the broader market. this is a survival game, survive if you can or die like the rest. Cant wait for the next update.
developer_response:
Hi AphX! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed. The issue you are referring to and that is causing frustration is tied to the horde spawning system that is not currently working as intended. You'll be pleased to know that the team is well aware of the issue and that we are working on fix for it, which will make the hordes spawn much more organically.

Also, keep in mind that there are multiple factors that influence your efficiency at killing puppets. It can depend on the type of weapon you are carrying, how much points did you allocate into your STRENGHT attribute, the level of your MELEE WEAPONS skill proficiency and also on the type of puppet you are battling as the bulkier ones and better armored ones take more hits to get killed. 

We hope that, knowing this, you will consider giving the game another chance and that you will return to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077539676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1707865098}
review:
Extreme tedium.  With nice graphics.   And bugs in video settings.   And read-only Discord.   And 8+ tabs of key binds. 

If you're a fan of going house to house, room to room, searching cabinets and desks and boxes and trash... this is your game.
developer_response: Hi Graawk! We're sorry to see that the game did not live up to your expectations. SCUM was designed to be a hardcore survival game that leans heavily on realism, and thus it was designed to not shower the player with loot. We've made several modifications to loots spawning based on player feedback on our official servers, but we understand that some players enjoy having a lot of items at their disposal, which is why we enabled private servers that can modify a lot of settings (loot included), which is why we'd like to propose that you give these servers with increased loot a chance as they may cater better to your preferred playstyle. That being said, we hope that, knowing this, you'll give the game another chance and hopefully find enjoyment with it.

review: I love this game, Yes, it has some faults, like not an amazing inventory system, and the occasional bugs. But the game is in early access, how much are you gonna ask for? It has come a long way from where it was, and I am super excited to see where its at in time. I really like this game, its better than most survival pvp games. I do think they should adjust the price considering it is still in early access, but none the less, i don't think its a complete waste of money. I think this game really needs to be recognized and seen for how good it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065816742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1707762317}
review: I love survival games and especially DayZ, but this game is just a lot of work with little payoff. The hoard system is stupid, and all the mechanics are wonky and difficult to use. Just not worth putting in the hours for.
developer_response: Hi fire.fox.0511! We're sorry to see that you did not enjoy your time with the game. We'd like to emphasize that the team is well aware of the issues with the hordes and their spawning and that we're actively working on a fix for this system. That is why we'd like to invite you to keep an eye on our Steam announcements to see when the update that will get this sorted out goes live. Also, we'll be working on further balancing and  quality of life improvements as we'll be nearing the full 1.0 release, and will be further improving SCUM after we exit Early access. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561199387193873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1692131701}
review:
Bought this game for play with friends. And after purchase we found that the game doesn't support dedicated server (at least for now).
So we are waiting for dedicated server and cannot play like we want. It's sad and annoying
developer_response:
Hi simbolya! We're sorry to see that you could not start playing with your friend. While currently there's no way to start immediately next to one another, you can find private servers where admins are willing to teleport you to next to each other once you log in. 

We'd like to point out that the team is currently focused on delivering the final features for 1.0, as well as polishing and bugfixing. Once we manage to exit Early access, we'll be able to talk more about adding such features into the game. That being said, we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance once we manage to get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129429457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3465, 'last_played': 1708666241}
review: If you like survival/crafting like DayZ and And Rust's building and driving. This is for you. This team made some heavy overhauls since launch. They even have a solo mode where you can just play round with admin commands if you wanna rent a server. PvP is the same as DayZ. All in all a good PvPvE survival game really. 2 thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198850647606', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7983, 'last_played': 1711252896}
review: Game has been in development for years, yet still requires people to pay top dime for DLC and game. multiple times I've had my vehicles cause me to lose everything. They design is quality in the areas that you don't care about yet has design flaws in major mechanics of the game. I've been deeply disappointed in the overall performance of the game. The creators put on the log in screen that the game is still in development and you are prone to multiple deconstructions in the game like glitches,crashes, etc. Yet they still charge top dollar and will give some B.S reason it helps the development of the game. I believe they use this as an excuse to never actually take any responsibility for the crap design mechanics of specific portions of the game that cause people to be completely reset and lose all the grind they have achieved.
developer_response: Hi Preston! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the state of the game. We're aware that SCUM's been in development for quite some time now and that the game still has some underlying issues. We'd like to emphasize that we're very much aware of the situation and we're committed towards bringing the game to its full 1.0 release and to deliver a truly polished and optimized experience. We understand your frustration and we hope to alleviate it once we manage to get the issues that are plaguing the game sorted out and that you consider giving it another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073606145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 7964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7964, 'last_played': 1707547420}
review:
Awesome game. Its open world, sandbox. With PvE and PvP options. The world is giant. With too much discoveries to count. Lots of transportation modes. Lots of combat modes. Lots to build, farm, cook, hunt and fish. You have major stats and subskills you can improve to get an edge. 
Very good game to casually and competitively explore. I highly recommend playing with more people.

author: {'steamid': '76561199260050817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1707617776}
review: I really want to like this game... but I just can't ... you literally have to watch a 40 minute tutorial just to figure out how to wipe your own ass and after that good luck finding toilet paper. It sucks though because the concept is amazing and I truly love zombie games but to even be able to battle zombies is difficult enough on top of being swarmed instantly not being able to outrun them or fight them well... maybe I need to mess around with the starting skill points more because I really want to like this game but its making it difficult to enjoy. Unless that is what the're going for ... an absolutely difficult zombie game then they sure have done that.

If you are inclined to play with other players, make sure that you explore other options when it comes to either official or private servers. We hope that you'll manage to find something that suits you and that you'll give the game another chance.

review: Tengo algun tiempo jugando a este titulo puedo decir que he notado las actualizaciones a mejorado un monton y mas desde la ultima update donde mejoraron los tutoriales menu de crafteo y otros, era un cambio necesario que esperabamos todos, por otra parte sigue faltando optimizar los graficos ya que el juego consume muchos recursos y el juego a pasado de solicitar 10gb ram minimo a solicitar 16gb y seguimos teniendo problemas de rendimiento y algun bug, pero si buscas algo real del genero de supervivencia este es el mejor juego que podras conseguir y seguimos esperando que salga de manera oficial con la update 1.0

author: {'steamid': '76561199146840918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 778, 'playtime_at_review': 7088, 'last_played': 1712447203}
review:
This is an amazing game in a perpetually broken state.

If you close the game, it stills exists in the background for a very long time.
You can't kill it with task manager. You can't kill it with Alt+F4. You can't kill it by any means.
It just eats away at your resources until you just completely turn off your computer.

In it's current state, some players can't play for more then 20 minutes without mandatory restart required while running top of the line hardware.

The devs make things worse almost every update at this point...
They have been in development for 6 years and the game still crashes perpetually, and it's worse then it was last year with some of the same bugs from 3 years ago.
developer_response: Hi Taco! We're sorry to see that you find the current state of the game to be disappointing. We'd like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and that we're still working to bring it to its full, 1.0 version of the game. As we'll be nearing towards that, we'll make sure to polish, optimize, and make it as smooth as possible. That being said, we hope that you'll reconsider and give the game another chance as we'll be nearing the full, 1.0 version of SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005405388', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 106, 'playtime_at_review': 42506, 'last_played': 1712383693}
review:
I have watched this game evolve over the years and it has become amazing. There is so so much to do and its highly immersive. One strong suggestion is to play on servers with Admins who either host it for free or accept donations because they really care about reducing hackers and correcting major issues. 

Only thing I dislike is how overly important lockpicking mini game is. Its for sure taken a dominate role in late game play and I am simply not very good at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023334590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2407, 'last_played': 1707415872}
review:
Borring running simulator with no loot and no help on how to play. 
i tried my best with this game but, i get the feeling that the Devs are working their hardest to sabotage their own game.

I think they like the zombies more than the players they hoped to play this miserable empty calorie heartrate simulator

I do not recommend this game, itÂ´s way more fun to watch paint dry!
developer_response: Hi Finger! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you. We're aware that the game needs to do much more with communicating the game's mechanics organically through gameplay, like a dedicated tutorial. As we'll be exiting Early access, we'll make sure to improve this segment of the game in order to accommodate new players and make the learning curve for the game a bit less steep. As for the loot - SCUM is designed as a hardcore survival game, meaning that it will not shower you with loot and that you'll need to get through the more challenging part of the game (bunkers, killboxes, police stations, etc.) if you want to find powerful weapons and explosives. However, we understand that some players enjoy a more casual experience, which is why we enabled the creation of private servers where loot can be modified and significantly increased. All that being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance when we manage to get SCUM out of Early access and get it to the 1.0 version.
