author: {'steamid': '76561198024550923', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 204891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5095, 'playtime_at_review': 195338, 'last_played': 1712495260}
review: A big time sink.  It takes a long time to really develop your character.  However, due to the prevalence of hacking/cheating, your actual 'time' is stolen.  The developers will not address the issue on official servers.  After 3000 hours (can't say I didn't try), it's time to move on to another game that hasn't been in EA for six years.  Additionally, the game trailers are completely misleading.
developer_response:
Hi Silent! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review and for the many hours you played the game. 
We're sorry for the issues you've encountered with the game and we understand your frustration.
The hackers/cheaters are an issue we take extremely seriously and our team often works outside of their working hours to bring them down. 
We are still in early access, but we're getting closer to the inevitable release of 1.0. 
That means we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all features/mechanics that need fine-tuning and do our best to balance them out. 
That also includes updating the anti-cheat system. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561199085141248', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1711317518}
review:
This game is soooo slept on.... I think its the learning curve. 
Once you make it past that. Its sooooo dope! highly recommend!
They need to add a way to gamble with your money though. It give us a reason to keep grinding.
Maybe a blackjack table in the safe zone??? That'd be sweet!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963243408', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12451, 'last_played': 1706922152}
review:
Guys..... this game..... hands down, another ridiculous survival game! If you've been watching my twitch or kick streams recently you'll see a bunch of my base building, gardening and cooking, car upgrading, an assortment of gun upgrading and customization gameplay. If not be sure to alt-tab over and check out twitch.tv/dubido or kick.com/dubido to get a small glimpse at some of the new 9.5 updates (12/21/23) that "The Devs" have released. 
I first started playing this game back in 2019 when it was first released.. ish.. and loved it. Even though it was an early access game back then it felt like a full game. There was a huge map to explore, tons of cool and interesting crafting options, all kinds of neat gear to loot and find, vehicles to find and fix up and drive and fill up with all sorts of gear. Usually for me, in "zombie games" when they can run as fast as you and take multiple hits from your weapons unless your actually aiming for the head. I'm talking about the amazing end graphics and the realism and heart pounding moments when the zombies are on your ass. Usually in zombie games, for some reason I for real get scared lol. I know chicken right.. I'ts okay, I just tell my self I'm saving my real heat attack for when something like a zombie apocalypse like 28 Days Later or Dying Light happens.
 
Needless to say this game strives for realism. Down to the calories and vitamins your in taking affecting your stamina, constitution and all sorts of stats.. I'ts actually almost too in depth tbh. But I like it. You'll burn hours without even trying. The amount of zombies and the intensity was actually not too bad for me so I was able to put some time into the game. In the new update the zombies can now actually jump through windows and break down doors and that put my anxiety to the next level lol and I'm sure that's what the developers were looking to do for all those seasoned players out there. 
But anyways, back when I first started playing this game I was able to get up to a point where I had survived for so long, had a truck full of all the guns and gear I'd need to survive. I turned my back for a few minutes to kill a deer for some food I had left my truck too close to a supply drop. The supply drops give you a chance to get some awesome gear that you would not otherwise been able to get and give you a little more of and edge to survive. They have a countdown before they self destruct and explode and when this one that I had just cleared blew up it took my truck and everything in it :'(. I rage quit then and there. I managed to clip the moment on twitch so it would haunt me for ever because I was ready to never play again.. 

Now, 4 years later I decided to pick the game back up and play it with some friends and I'm having a blast. I'm not big into the  PVP aspects of these types of games because of raids and looting other players things, especially after you've put hours and hours into a game and then someone comes along, robs and destroys everything you have, one random day, while your offline and at work in real life trying to pay the bills JUST KILLS all of the enjoyment of the game for me. 
I was able to find a PVE public server with an awesome admin team and discord server and have managed at this point to put just over 207 hours into the game. Thanks to these friendly and super helpful people that I've met on this server I'm learning so much more about the game I either didn't get to experience or try or that has come out in updates since I first played.

So regardless if you are into PVP or PVE this game has huge potential and I can see why even after 5 years of being out its still under development. If you haven't played, I highly suggest it if you into survival game. It has a PUBG feel with regards to graphic and weapons. A Rust or ARK feel in the PVE and PVE aspect and is its own mutated zombie creature when it comes to crafting, food/ cooking/ metabolism and in my eyes #1 in a zombie survival game.

Thanks for reading if you made it this far,
I appreciate you taking the time.
Please leave a like and or a comment. Let me know what you think.
Also if you didn't already, check me out on twitch, Kick & YT.
Thanks guys!
Dub

author: {'steamid': '76561198093427334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1705975859}
review: I really have enjoyed this game till the recent update. An explosive puppet plus 6-7 other puppets spawned directly on top of me when i was in my inventory. This update delivered broken spawning mechanics with no motivation to continue when you die. Giving your audience no hope to get anywhere, broken zombie stamina, puppets and mechs have wall hax, so discouraging, arguably unplayble right now. I hope the devs see the recent outrage of the community and try to change it. its sad
developer_response:
Hi Tyrant! 

First of all, thank you for writing this review, for your support, and for your honest feedback!  
Yes, the team is aware of the horde spawning issues and is working diligently on producing a fix. 
Your voice and the voices of the community have been heard. Please be patient as we are a small team and still in early access, but we're working as hard as we can to improve the game as much as possible. We'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all the features in need of fine-tuning or rebalancing and address those issues.
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198304424467', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1704714269}
review:
If you're thinking this is a PVP game then you'll be slightly disappointed.  It does have dozens of PVP servers and the game has all the PVP elements but it is primarily a PVE game with PVP bolted on.

Most of your time will be spent looting.  Around 70% i'd say.  The rest will be spent travelling, base building, and trading unwanted stuff.

This game is more of a survival simulator.  It has punishing mechanics which'll kill you if you're not aware of them, and enough dangers to keep you on your toes.  Add in PVP and you WILL feel the lose of all your work.

I recommend this game because it is by far the most realistic survival game I've come across.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018552611', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 7835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7227, 'last_played': 1705023132}
review:
Game has it's flaw, but pretty solid. It's so close to be the ultimate survival game and should borrow some features from other game out there.

Played 120h on v095, PVE only with friends.  
Encountered some bugs like stuff falling under containers when equipping directly from it. Player corpse disappearing after death from time to time. Puppets spawning out of thin air in our face or inside room we just cleared.  Melee hitbox not registering quite often(mostly with knives). Battery vanishing from battery charger.
Got stuck in the floor in some area with sentinels (friends had to punch me to get me unstock lol)
 
Insane skill grinding.
Game is lacking PVE content a little bit and would love to see some kind of missions. Escort, fetch, rescue, doesn't need to be too complicated. 
Fighting non-puppet NPC would be so cool.

In PVE there is no point in upgrading the base and twig is fine. I think that need to change and an optional game mode similar to 7days to die with horde coming to you at night or something like that would be a good incentive to improve base defense. It could scale difficulty based on fame point.  

Weed growth in garden is insane and should be tuned down, or give a huge buff to weed repellant.  
I liked the cooking system, but it could use some QoL, dragging item one by one on a recipe of 10 ingredient is tedious. Merging stack like we do for bullets is a must or you get stuck with ton of 2/10 stack you can't use. Shift + click to transfer items over container to recipe should be bare minimum.

when switching firing mode on riffles, I couldn't see what mode I was on most of the time, the switch is outside the screen most of the time. It should show on the gun icon on the toolbar like it does when looking at the number of bullets.

Loot quality vs risk felt off quite often. Mostly in POI guarded with sentinel, giving the same loot as the police station while some other POI gave military stuff for free (the school and basket ball court in the big city near C3).  

Melee weapon damage felt off and could use a rework. We should see some kind of indicator. An axe taking 5-6 hits to kill a puppet and a cleaver taking only 2 hits. Chainsaw taking 5-6 hit, while a bayonet is one-shotting every puppet. 

More animals would be nice, we didn't bother once with the hunting minigame. I tried a few time and never found anything.
Wolf and bear were pretty cool, but encounters happened very rarely.

Vendor should sell screw drivers in PVE or at least be a setting easy to change in the server settings sell screw driver= true or false...

Water well need a buff... that thing was constantly dry just from the cooking recipe. 

Cleaning cloth was tedious and required wayyyy too much soap. We didn't even bother cleaning dirty piece of gear and just eat antibiotic instead to deal with infections.
This could be fixed by allowing us to wash cloth with water only (soap making it quicker), or using like 2 use of soap to clean 100% (I think it's currently 1 unit for 10%).

Painting vehicules would be awesome...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996056681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3396, 'last_played': 1705078993}
review: It has the makings of a great survival game, but the hoard system is killing it.  Guns are basically useless except for PvP at this point.  Any noise spawns more zombies than you can deal with with melee.  Firing a gun to defend yourself makes more of them.  Eventually i stopped caring about exploring because the stuff i'd want to find, i can't really use.  If they get rid of this mechanic, or modify it in a way that's more playable, i'll come back.
developer_response:
Hi Nighthawk! 

Thank you for your honest feedback and support!
The team is aware of the issues regarding the horde system and spawning. We are investigating them thoroughly and working on a fix. 
Please be patient; we are still in early access, but a fix is coming. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561199040901304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 40497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37832, 'last_played': 1706416918}
review:
UPDATE (still do not recommend): I continued to play for a bit assuming the backlash from the previous update would elicit some serious action by the devs. To the dev's credit a fraction of those bugs were resolved. But they have been replaced by new ones. Not only that but now I get fatal error crashes that did not previously happen. Does it sound like the game is getting better? 5 years in early access? Funny enough, 6 months ago I would have recommended this game when I was playing almost everyday.

Aside from the fact the game is barely playable at the moment, these fixes also tend to make QOL changes that remove enjoyable features like riding a bike. After the 30 seconds it takes to deplete stamina when riding a bike, you simple stop pedaling. My character can run for twice as long on foot with 45 kg of gear. I can run faster and farther on foot than on a bike. How does that make sense? Just remove the bike instead of making it useless. I'm actually irritated at how sloppy that change is. And finally this experience has helped cement the idea that if an EARLY ACCESS game has multiple DLCs beyond reasonable supporter packs, then the game is fair game for higher scrutiny. I don't mind supporting EA releases, but the ones I've played with DLCs give me a sickly suspicion that the devs are actually just ivy league MBAs figuring out how to milk their market rather than an artist or a storyteller.

This game, Scum, feels less and less like a passion project and more like the product of some corporate think-tank.

FIRST REVIEW (did not recommend): 
I loved this game and played basically non-stop since last summer. I feel the horde update is so jarringly different that it has spoiled the fun. Stealth and camouflage skills are absolutely useless now. The puppets spawn right on top of you, and even if not, there's always one that spawns in and no matter where or what happens this one puppet will find you even if you run through bushes. When it finds you, it triggers a horde. Doesn't matter if it's a silenced gun, bow/arrow, or melee. Once you kill it, it triggers a horde. And if you've managed to clear a POI, you only have a few seconds before the puppets start spawning in again. Bears, wolves, and boars also spawn right on top of you. 

This update brought about the worst bug so far too. Pulling items from a storage chest have a chance to despawn the items. Yes, bug reports will say the item goes under the storage chest and to move it. I do every time! I move the storage, see the item, and it falls through the ground before I can do anything.

I love the server that I'm on but this update has broken me out of the game. The devs focus on realism in really innovative ways but this update has basically undone that by giving it an arcade feel. Is it going to be *immersive survival horror* or another arma 3 copy? In the game's current state, being a solo player is impossible. Stealth tactics don't matter even with adv skills. So it's a team-oriented shoot em up game with a sprinkle of survival elements.
developer_response:
Hi Ioquillo jiu jackaloo! 

Thank you for taking the time to write this review and for the supportive words.
We are sorry this last update brought you dissatisfaction with the game.
Since we are still in early access, bugs, crashes and other issues are to be expected. Also the reason why we check player reviews and comments on a daily basis. We appreciate your feedback! 

Having said that, there are some issues with the horde spawning that the team is aware of and they are being thoroughly investigated. 
And yes, we are aware of the chest bug. It's just not that easy to reproduce it in our conditions, even with fake lag (I've tried it multiple times). But our team is on it and they'll get it done. 

The 0.95 was the last major update before 1.0. That means that we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon so we'll be revisiting all features that need fine-tuning, rebalancing and hashing them out. We are aware that the game needs a lot more work and we're ready for it.
That also includes making the game more user friendly for solo players. But keep in mind, there are officials solo/duo servers which you can try if you're so inclined. 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Thank you for keeping it respectful! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066258093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1704169407}
review:
It's so beyond me how anyone enjoys this game.  I can not find one redeeming thing about it. I think I bought it on a deep sale. I played single player only. 

On the technical side, I'm getting so much pop-in from flora textures, at varying distances too. Some of this is happening almost right next to me. I'm getting a decent amount of stuttering too. I've tried on different settings as well. I'm playing on a RTX 2070. So right off the bat you have this distracting shit happening that messes with my head and makes me anxious. 

The gameplay is immensely boring. Project Zomboid moves at a much better pace and that moves slow but it's fine. There is a steep learning curve that will involve doing actual work and research well beyond an average complex game. The game tells you little and you don't even get all the keybindings in the options so you have to look online for all the hotkeys. This is crazy and shows little respect for the player. 

There is no narrative whatsoever (this is probably obvious but still, there is zero, so more boring)

Combat is horrible but I didn't find any ammo yet. Melee combat is low tier jank, I can't imagine gun play being fun. 

Looting is horrible. I get it, there's scarcity, but you search soooooo many containers and usually get nothing and carryweight is very tough. Item size makes no sense sometimes. Small items can be way too big. So when you do find random materials and whatnot you're not carrying it anyway. I came across two bikes with no front tire. Wow, really making me work for that, huh? The map is huge, give me a break.  You also find stuff in random places, I assume scripted, to help create game flow but it feels artificial and unimmersive. Like ok, you played long enough and suffered so you can get a backpack now, or whatever. 

Enemy variety is weak. What's the deal with these giant mechs that guard what I assume are military bases? You can't really tell what they are, just large points of interest. They feel way too out of place. There was this random laughing guy that blows himself up on you. What the heck is that? Dumb. The zombies themselves have a low variety as well. Like shit man, if that's the main enemy make more clothing.  

Script spawning feels off. I'll look around an area, see and hear nothing, and then I'm in a house, crouching and being quite and then I have four zombies running towards me out of nowhere. They spawn randomly in the field too. I cleared a farm house and then another spawned within minutes right there, and then another. Bad scripted spawning is a game killer for me. Just like State of Decay 2.  

Map design is uninspiring and bland. Relating to loot, what happened to all the stuff?? Buildings are barren and feel so random. 

Crafting. I never got to craft anything and it's another game that has you chopping down trees. Crafting looks tedious and the menu navigation needs help.  

Skills. I didn't have much chance to use any skills. This system seems fine enough for a survival game. 

Sound design is serviceable. 

Even if you like the slow moving survival zombie genre, I can't understand enjoying this game.
developer_response:
Hi Bianculli Joseph! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review! 
We're sorry you're unsatisfied with the game. 
Let's dive in! 

1. The texture pop-in is waiting for us to move into the polishing phase so the level design team can optimize/replace textures all over the Island.
Also, try lowering the details to HIGH and setting streaming speed to high or very high. 
The 2070, although it has 8GB VRAM would struggle on 1440p. I don't know which resolution you're playing in but try working around some of the settings. 

2. The gameplay involves HC realism which is a main draw for many players, including myself. 
Yes, the learning curve is steep but we've added the tutorial codex in the 0.95 update which contains info on all the game mechanics and useful tips. I'm curious, what controls are you talking about, that are not listed in the controls menu? 

3. With the 1.0 release, we are planning to add missions and side quests, which will provide a certain narrative element. Also, armed NPC's patrolling the Island and points of interest. 

4. Melee combat is also waiting for it's rework in the polishing phase, we realize it's one of the weaker parts of the game. A shame that you didn't stick around to find a firearm, we actually have one of the most realistic ballistic simulations in our game, and the gunplay is on point. 

5. Looting has been rebalanced but it's still not perfect. Some people want more loot, others want less. Finding that balance is often tricky but we're doing our best.
In the meantime there are many private servers you can try out with increased loot/vehicles. 

6. We've added new enemy types in one of our last updates, so it's not only zombies who are a threat now. Also, referring to the 3rd point, we are adding armed human NPC's and more enemy types with 1.0. 

7. Yes, we are aware of some issues with the horde system spawning and our guys are investigating it thoroughly. 

8. The map is inspired by Croatian landscapes and terrain, it's very much how homes used to look in Croatia. 
Having said that, the level design team will add a lot more variety to houses/buildings along with new textures and various optimizations. 

9. The crafting menu got an extensive overhaul and I'm surprised to hear you didn't craft anything. Especially with the new UI, which helps tremendously. 
I'd say that 2 hours is not nearly enough to get the whole SCUM experience. It's a game that you need to invest time in to reap the rewards, and it's worth it. 

Like I've said, we will address most of the issues you mentioned during our polishing phase, but the game is tested every day, bugs are reported and fixed on a daily basis. We are determined to make SCUM the best it can possibly be. 

Thank you for reaching out to us. We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561199025906895', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1706547865}
review:
Drowned with a bag full of ammo and guns. 
Needless to say my keyboard is in pieces and my mouse is embedded inside my wall.
Would rather play minecraft with my nipples hooked up to a car battery.
developer_response:
Hi DildoBaggins! 

Thank you for your feedback, we regret you're unhappy with the game. 
There's a section in the tutorial codex about diving while overloaded. 
You will drown if your backpack is too heavy, but you can drop it in the water and swim out to the surface, return for it later. 
We sincerely hope you won't resort to hooking up your nipples to a car battery, but hey, who are we to judge? :D 
We hope you'll revisit the game and hopefully change your mind!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006314440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5296, 'last_played': 1704146481}
review: The game is dead. The developers have been messing with core features in an attempt to add more content to sell more games and instead broke the game. Since I've come back to the game in 0.95 I can't survive longer than 10 minutes. I'll clear out an area of puppets, start looting and suddenly be swarmed by 15 puppets that came from nowhere. It's ridiculous.
developer_response:
Hi BushWookieActual! 

We're sorry to see you're not satisfied with the game. 

I can assure you, the game is not dead and it's closer than ever to the inevitable 1.0 release. 
We have a roadmap that we're sticking to, and sometimes that means changes to the game that players might initially not like. The core mechanics you speak of have been balanced, reworked, and new ones have been added. 
Yes, we are aware of some issues with the horde spawns, but our team is investigating the matter thoroughly. 
As we're heading to the 1.0 release, we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon, which we'll use to revisit any/all features and mechanics that require fine-tuning and rebalancing. 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 

Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064985418', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1681929815}
review: A really cool survival RPG that aims for immersion without hindering the player experience. Whenever a game tries to be super realistic it often does so at the expense of enjoyment, but I think SCUM does an amazing job of making a fun, immersive, and realistic survival experience that doesn't compromise on fun in the process. Would suggest you grab it on sale if you like survival shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561199492499486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1703999085}
review: This game feels too unfinished for me to enjoy playing. Also seems they are trying to copy DayZ. I was personally not a fan. Might give it another chance later on but for now it obviously needs a lot more work. At least it was better than The Day Before...
developer_response:
Hi Misstrish!


Thank you for your honest feedback, we appreciate it. 
We are still in early access, so some bugs and strange issues are to be expected.
But, we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon and revisit all the features/mechanics that need rebalancing/fine-tuning and hash them all out. 
By the time 1.0 releases, the game will be in much better shape so we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 

Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996174421', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 209, 'playtime_at_review': 21971, 'last_played': 1712437158}
review: It is currently one of my favorite games. There are still some improvements that need to be implemented before it becomes a perfect zombie survival game, such as new base construction modules like an advanced electricity system (photovoltaic panels), bulbs or other lighting sources, new vehicles, and new buildings or cities. These are just a few examples. Overall, the game shows a lot of promise and in my opinion, it is currently the number one multiplayer zombie survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113816356', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1709720509}
review: Game is not gamer friendly....Its way to complicated...Hard for new players...There is so little loot...This game should have menu to pick how hard game will be...
developer_response:
Hi CRO_Sokol! 
Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it. 
The game DOES have a steep learning curve which is a draw for many players (myself included). But we've introduced the tutorial codex with 0.95 and it should make things a lot easier for new players.
 
There are many private servers with boosted loot settings so feel free to try out any of them, you're not limited to official vanilla servers only. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198285510804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 28430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14505, 'last_played': 1707462009}
review: i have been playing scum off and on now for awhile, is there still some bugs that need to be worked out yes there are, with that said this is one of the more advanced survival games out there its has the technical aspects of other games such as escape from tarkov especially when it comes to the gun play, then add in the zombies or puppets as the call them, this game has plenty to do in it pvp/pve/solo/team/role play. highly recommend even with its bugs

author: {'steamid': '76561198017280650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1704091518}
review: Two and a half hours to build a bed, only to find out that you don't respawn on said bed. Unless you use special in-game currency. How long do you think it will be before that is a microtransaction? Wasted potential. :(
developer_response:
Hi Tribantine! 

We're sorry to see you're unsatisfied with the game. 
Is there anything else that's troubling you with the game? 
It is a challenging game, with a steep learning curve and sometimes very unforgiving. But, that whole HC survival is what drew a lot of players to the game, myself included. 
Gold will no be a microtransactional resource, there are ways to get it. You just have to get a little creative :) 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072169262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 4455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1709104701}
review: Very overly tedious and frustrating. I lost my whole character because apparently the drop pods's explosions are as big as a nuclear explosion and the game doesn't tell you that. I wasted hours of my time just to get killed in a stupid bomb.
developer_response:
Hi Chin-Chin Chan! 

Thank you for your feedback. 
As with all mechanics in the game, we try to make them as realistic as possible while still being fun. 
In real life, the explosion and fatality radius is significantly larger than people think and that explosion from the cargo drop was reduced after initial testing because of its radius. 
We are still in early access so there's time to balance everything out and fairly soon we'll be entering the polishing phase to do just that - balance out every feature/mechanic that needs fine-tuning. 
We hope you'll be patient with us, revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

Com Scum foi diferente, por ser mais realista do que os demais, ter armas reais e ser um estilo de jogo Ãºnico, eu decidi aprender, a ideia Ã© essa, aprender o jogo estudar as maneiras de como vocÃª sobrevive e depois achar um servidor ativo. author: {'steamid': '76561198064443007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1704759165}
review:
Boobs and chainsaws- sometimes goats go brrr very gud.


Is what I would like to say, however. This game is hot garbage and not worth more than 3$ USD. Even then I could not condone playing this game for that price. The spawn system for zombies is absurd, enemy placement could have been thought out better by anyone other than the current devs its almost like they have literally never play tested this game. On top of that progression is about as logical as chewing on plastic explosive to cure cancer. An analogy that is as ludicrous as spending one more minute attempting to play this. Fix player bodies de-spawning, in literally every location imaginable, bunkers, outside, etc. Fix the scripts for enemy detection and spawning. Define entirely new parameters and you could consider this game "Pre-Alpha" Almost six years of development and this thing is about as a polished as a sea urchin in a sea of glass. I wanted to like this game but anything less than this much would be an understatement. Not a single mechanic past- â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, pissing and consuming food, reloading magazines- is anywhere near close to "intelligent design" as it would presumably like to be perceived as. It is most certainly a "Game" though. Great cash grab devs, rename it from SCUM to SCAM and you'll have at least been honest with your audience. Maybe in another 15 years this will be playable. PS I don't know how you managed to make unreal engine run like hot dog shit on a 3090 but you did. That alone is impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056366652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1706994602}
review: This game is currently unplayable with how often and how random puppets spawn. They spawn ON you, not at locations. Waste all your ammo on 10, and 10 more will spawn.
developer_response:
Hi Tyrael! Thank you for reaching out and writing this review. 
The team is aware of some issues with the hordes and unrealistic spawning, we are investigating the issues thoroughly. 
However, as we are still in early access, some issues and bugs are to be expected. 
We will also be revisiting every game mechanic in the polish phase, fine-tuning everything as much as we can to release 1.0 as the best version of the game it can be.
Thank you for your feedback, we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561199018998140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1703979627}
review: jiggle physics were good but everything else sucked (look in comments for genuine feedback)
developer_response:
Hi SSal! 
Could you go into a little more detail? We'd like to hear your feedback. 
It helps us to improve the game. 
We appreciate you enjoying the jiggle physics though, our team worked hard on that.
As for everything else, we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we will address all the features that need fine-tuning and hash them out, along with numerous bug fixes. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042883662', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1704061141}
review: Definitely  not recommended. The crafting system is stupid hard and tedious down to you need to craft a rope to make an ax which is bullshit if you have been a boy scout. The enemies are lack luster and offer no challenge. The biggest challenge in this game is finding food
developer_response:
Hi Halcyon! 

Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it. 
Could you go into a little more detail? After the last update and the crafting rework, the reception to crafting was stellar and people love it! 
I have to say, since the last update we've heard very few people say that enemies offer no challenge. Have you gone to a village/city and triggered the horde? 
Have you gone to an abandoned bunker and try to outwit Razors and Mr. Brenner? 
Higher the risk, higher the reward :) 
We'll be entering the polishing phase of the development process fairly soon, that's when we'll revisit every feature and tweak it/balance it out as much we can!
In any case, we hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198275068115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20786, 'last_played': 1708861761}
review: Bought this game when it came out. It had it's flaws, but like with DayZ I decided to wait. I had a great time on a rp-server few years ago, but always felt that it's way too easy for a survival game. You need the challenge to keep yourself interested, right? Anyway, came back to this since my bro got a pc and we can play together and bought this to him. Oh man I love the fact that the mutant puppets enter the buildings now! Haven't played the updated version a lot yet so I don't know what to say about the hordes, but the challenge is welcome. For people cursing them I heard that you just need enough distance to them and they will disappear (to keep the server smooth). Not sure if it works, but worth trying if you're stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819748114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1679216228}
review: game has a lot of amazing features but don't expect to get them right away. its a little too daunting. You can load in solo and use cheat codes/spawn any items in the game which is honestly what I would recommend doing for a while. get yourself acquainted with all the mechanics. I like in depth and challenging but I would also like to be told what to do with what. All in all I will eventually get into this game again but everytime I turn it on I am reminded how much bs there is to learn and how much bs there is just to get to actually playing and enjoying the game. as a guy who likes rifles and ghillie suits I know I will be thrilled with my purchase eventually but right now it is just too much. I do recommend this product I just want people to know what they are getting into lol

review: Whoever reviewed saying the car jack was the best weapon hands down, GG. i found a car jack and confidently crept up to a zombie. With this god tier weapon i attempted my first strike to the back of its head. Much to my surprise, my left click dropped the car jack and lightly punched the zombie. I was very soon after getting absolutely mauled by a massive hoard out of nowhere as i alerted a pack apparently. Well done sir, you got me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372682156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1707520155}
review:
Dopo 50 ore di gioco posso dare la mia piccola impressione riguardo questo titolo:
SCUM Ã¨ il connubio piÃ¹ malsano fra simulazione e sopravvivenza in un mondo pervaso dagli zombi. di per se la cosa non mi spiace affatto, anzi mi ha intrigato sin dal principio molto. infatti per un bel po ho testato le varie dinamiche che intersecano tutto il gameplay di gioco.
DETTO QUESTO.  PERCHE LA VALUTAZIONE E' NEGATIVA?
L'opzione delle Horde e la peculiaritÃ  dei Mecha, unito alla situazione inerente a fama e punti necessari per interagire col negozio. TUTTO CIO' ha reso la mia vita frustrante. 
Per fare un esempio. immagina di essere un marine ben addestrato, stai per entrare in una stanza, controlli con la coda dell'occhio angoli, mobili,  vie di ingresso e di uscita, ti prepari ad ingaggiare e dopo aver fatto tre passi nella stanza, sbatti le ciglia e ti ritrovi circondato da 4 ostili, in una stanza cosparsa di C4 e dove non ci sono piu ne porte ne finestre per uscire, BEH QUESTA E' L'ORDA PER COME L HO VISSUTA IO. Spawn randomici di non morti che ti portano continuamente a dubitare di ogni singolo e fottuto passo che fai, stanza che pulisci, o porta che chiudi.
A voi la possibilita di provarlo ma onestamente allo stato attuale per me Ã¨ un NO!
Lo dico con forte dispiaciere ma difficilmente arrivo ad arrabbiarmi per un gioco se non quando questo si inventa delle regole dopo essersi dato un tono

author: {'steamid': '76561198097701037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1614, 'playtime_at_review': 74016, 'last_played': 1711991436}
review:
Ich hatte damals im August 2019 das Spiel als Early Access erworben, mit dem Gedanken, dass es im Laufe der Zeit schon erhebliche Fortschritte geben wird. Leider ist das Survival-Prinzip im Laufe der Zeit vÃ¶llig in den Hintergrund geraden und es blieb in meinen Augen im Single-Player vÃ¶llig langweilig. Es gibt da kaum sinnvolle Herausforderungen, da es kein wirkliches Ziel gibt. Bis heute (Ende 2023) wurde nicht ein Weg vorgesehen, die Insel verlassen kÃ¶nnen, den BCU zu entfernen (ohne den Kopf dabei zu verlieren) oder Ã¤hnliches. Man rennt seit 2018 bis heute (Ende2023) im Early Access eigentlich dumm auf der Insel rum, fÃ¼llt tonnenweise Kisten mit allerlei nutzlosen Kram, hordet Dinge, die man zum Ãœberleben nicht wirklich braucht und kann Dinge im Singleplayer craften, die keine Sinn ergeben. Kein Puppet durchbricht die dÃ¼nnsten WÃ¤nde einer Base oder zerstÃ¶rt billige HolztÃ¼ren oder Fahrzeuge. Welchen Grund sollte man da also haben, WÃ¤nde, TÃ¼ren und SchlÃ¶sser aufzurÃ¼sten oder Ã¼berhaupt  eine mÃ¤chtige Base zu bauen, wenn man seine Kisten auch einfach in einer Scheune deponieren kann. 
Ein weiterer massiver Schwachpunkt ist es, dass anfangs das Game unheimlich schwierig zu bewÃ¤ltigen sein kann und nach recht kurzer Spielzeit einfach viel zu einfach wird, da es keinerlei Ausgewogenheit im Spiel gibt, was die Puppets betrifft. Anfangs steht man mit einem simplen Speer, einer Steinaxt oder einem einfachen sehr schwachen Bogen schnellen und schlagkrÃ¤ftigen Puppets mit Panzerung oder SprengsgÃ¼rtel gegenÃ¼ber, denen man schlicht durch rennen auch nicht entkommen kann.
Ãœberlebt man die ersten Stunden und hat mit etwas GlÃ¼ck die passenden Waffen gefunden, wird's gegenÃ¼ber den Puppets plÃ¶tzlich viel zu einfach.
Nach so langer Entwicklungs-Zeit hat sich vom Spielablauf und den Herausforderungen nicht wirklich viel getan, was Survival-Fans glÃ¼cklich machen kÃ¶nnte. 
Am Ende ist es ein sinnfreies Umherfahrenl/laufen an verschiedene Lootspots, um sich die Xte taktische Weste oder AK in die Kisten zu rÃ¤umen, da es sonst nix gibt, was man auf der Insel sonst machen kann. Einen Weg davon runter ist ja bisher nicht vorgesehen. 

Im Multiplayer haben EinzelkÃ¤mpfer keine Chance gegen Teams, da man in allem unterlegen ist. Bunker allein zu looten ist ineffizient, da man entweder nicht alles schleppen kann, was sinnvoll ist oder weil man schlicht nicht das findet, was einem eine Chance ermÃ¶glicht gegen mehrere Gegner Ã¼berhaupt eine Chance zu haben. Gerade wenn diese nachts bereits Ã¼ber NachtsichtgerÃ¤te verfÃ¼gen, wo man selbst quasi noch im Dunkeln gelassen wird. Motivation findet man als EinzelkÃ¤mpfer auch auf Multiplayer Servern nicht, da man da stÃ¤ndig komplett geplÃ¼ndert wird und man auch nie in der Lage ist, sich eine bestÃ¤ndige Base zu bauen, da man alleine nie zeitnah die nÃ¶tigen Ressourcen zusammentragen kann, bevor diese ebenfalls geplÃ¼ndert oder zerstÃ¶rt werden. Wer keine Lust hat auf Teams, der ist bei dem Spiel im Single-Player schnell gelangweilt und im Multiplayer eigentlich nur in orangenen Dress unterwegs, da man auf gut besuchten PVP-Server keine 30min Ãœberlebenschance hat.

Our team takes hackers/cheaters very seriously and our guys often work outside their working hours to bring them down. But we cannot ban people without sufficient evidence. author: {'steamid': '76561198027914232', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1707155930}
review:
I find this game to be as accurate and as brutal as Project Zomboid, but immersive as a beautifully designed and crafted third person 3d game.
The crafting system is a jewel, combat is realistic and fun. Survival aspects are brilliant, and the whole aspect of metabolism is unbelievably realistic.
I am enjoying every hour of this game.
Find yourself a good ad healthy server and play there!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198400446141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1705680842}
review: If you like survival games, yes this is early access but it's pretty intense. Your diet becomes very important and you really have to move slow around zombies or "puppets" but if you have a friend to play with it makes it really fun. Just know, it's a pretty significant commitment in terms of time and patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990434439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8704, 'last_played': 1703882609}
review:
My friends and I were enjoying this game for years with a simple concept; Spawn, loot, find each other, loot, find a place for a base, build it and loot some more until you die.

Now, the reason I cannot recommend this game (anymore) is because of the Horde mechanic/ new uodate.
In the past we were clearing a town before we would loot it. Of course there were "puppet" spawns every now and then, but nothing crazy, you would feel a little bit safe. Now they spawn in crazy numbers, can jump tall buildings, breach through doors and much more.

I used to play DayZ but found this game way more attracting because of the fact that the true enemy is not a puppet, but the environment and other players.

Now, I wouldn't mind "hordes" as the next guy, just make it so we can see them, not some stupid event where they suddenly come from everywhere.
developer_response:
Hi there =WFT= Eagle!  
First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
Thank you for being so supportive over the years! 
We are aware of some issues with the hordes and are investigating them thoroughly. As you know, we are still in early access and depend on player feedback to balance out the game as much as we can. So please be patient, we're working on it and hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009915492', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1680439040}
review: the game is fun when you have a group of friends or people that you can ally with in game. However it will take you anywhere from two to 50 hours to learn the game play. You need to take the time and learn all of the character/game mechanics. So i'd suggest that you watch some game play on youtube, or guides on how things work if you are having trouble. Just remember that you can't trust anyone in game that wants to team up on a raid, because they will most likely plan an ambush with their friends, and they will catch you when you guys leave the area. Also there are people who hold a grudge and won't stop making things difficult for your when you are online playing. Lol, people will literally camp and wait until you come online to kill you. even when you have nothing for them to loot and they are geared out. Just remember to utilize your environment when you have a raging little man syndrome mosquito pestering you. Run to a large clans base or use the NPCs to kill them, and watch them rage out even more, lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032974814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1705455140}
review:
So seems I purchased this right as they updated to a version that makes the game unplayable.  You can not survive for more than 24 hours as a horde of puppets (zombies) will spawn surrounding you.  Every hit stuns you briefly, and as you will be surrounded and being pounded you will have no chance to attack or even run.  

Guns are overly complicated, you have to go into inventory to reload, manually dragging bullets to a clip and dragging clips to the weapon.  This makes reloading in combat a death sentence.  Hitting R just unloads the current clip to your inventory.  I had to go online to find out how to load, check to see i you have any bullets in your gun, switch fire modes for the gun, aim.  This is not intuitive or explained anywhere in the menus.

I only "found" a gun because of the Christmas event going on in game that, rarely, spawns a ghost Santa that gives you a present while looting a random thing, food plants for me.  Not that it did me any good.

I want to like this game, it has alot of potential, but the horde spawning in and mobbing you to death makes it pointless to play.
developer_response:
Hello TimeDisplacedSoul! 
We appreciate you taking the time to write this review! 
As you are aware, the game is still in early access so issues, and bugs are still expected. 
That's why in the polishing phase we will revisit every and any game mechanic and further tweak it out, make it balanced. That's why player feedback is very important to us!
As for the guns being complicated, how so? 
You have to fill the magazines manually, this is the way it's been since the beginning. Just take the appropriate ammunition, drag it into the empty magazine in the inventory/in hands, and wait for the animation to complete. If you have multiple filled magazines, pressing R will just load the next filled magazine. If you don't have a magazine but have bullets, you're just going to chamber one round.
The game was always challenging, and while we do agree on the hordes that need to be tweaked, the realistic gun mechanics are one of the main draws for players. 
Thank you again for reaching out to us, we hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198140375567', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 6776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1023, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1712499806}
review:
"Croatian DayZ" is an understatement for this game.
"3D Project Zombiod" is almost correct but not really.
"Tarkov with Zombies and mechs" is just silly way of saying that this game is a tarkov clone for zombie survival fans.
"Rust with extra steps" is like saying like you're new to survival games and you play it for PvP raids.
in reality..this game will break you like project zombiod, this game will make you want to quit life like DayZ because its as depressive if not more, only features missing in this one is mod support so if you like modding your game go play dayz and make it easier than what it's mean to be, i know you are scared of real gaming...also this game is like Tarkov, this game will make you regret getting into it and will be a waste of time and it will essentially become apart of your second life where you loot to get better gears...and if you are avid Rust player, please keep away from this game there's way too many toxicity in PvP as it is and noone will help you heal a gunshot from a mech you found in military base, expect if you plan playing PvE and hunting down mechs like a real chad.

In reality this ...game?, no no wait this is not a game, its a true supermax survival zombie apocalypse life simulator , and it will cure all your depressive toughts and will improve your understanding of what a good survival simulator expirience is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344307004', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2751, 'last_played': 1705136998}
review:
I've recently come back to the game after a long hiatus and I've found that the recent updates have been mostly positive. I have absolutely no complaints from the survival aspect, a lot of the effects and crafting options make as much sense as they can within a game.Generally I love the direction that Scum is heading in, although I do have some concerns that I hope get addressed.

The first issue is with the "puppets" (zombies.) The new horde mechanic is generally a welcome addition, although I think there needs to be some further troubleshooting to prevent them from spawning everywhere around the player. It can be easy to get completely surrounded and whilst yes, it does make you have to think about things, sometimes an area can go from being totally safe to a total nightmare in a matter of seconds which does seem a bit silly.

The second issue, for me at least, is to do with PvP servers. I know the developers aren't responsible for the actions of players in game, but right now the game actually rewards griefers and trolls. PvP is too difficult for new players to get into when they're playing solo. PvE is great but can get a little boring if there's nobody really communicating. I wonder if there should be a mechanic whereby you're given grief points or something when killing other players, and when it reaches a certain threshold their location appears on the map for others to see. It might help prevent one or two players absolutely dominating with the best equipment.

Additionally I wonder if player factions might help the situation, so as a for instance, when you create a character you either select or get thrown into a team. The map could then be divided in half and then players could fight over or capture territory from the other team? 

Just a few ideas. But generally I'm happy with the progress that has been made. Hope that V.1 gets released soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990804132', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1703814666}
review: Overall, pretty graphics, interesting theme, but did not feel fun in single player. You can't really play it blind. Too much unnecessary complexity. I found an onion, a shirt and a cooking pot within an hour of gameplay after visiting like 10+ small buildings. Yawn
developer_response:
Hi GR4V3 MIST4K3!

Thank you for your feedback! 
True, the game is complex with a steep learning curve but there's no reason to play it blind when we added the tutorial with the last update, 0.95. 
That should more than help you with getting started!
We will be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all features/mechanics and rebalance/fine-tune them as best we can. 
That also includes major bugfixes and quality of life changes. 
We hope you'll give the game another chance and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198295184545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1035, 'playtime_at_review': 3480, 'last_played': 1711666709}
review:
*EDIT*

I played for an additional 14 hours after posting this review to give this game it's absolute best chance. I can't do it. The hit registration for melee in this game is ABHORRENT. I DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING THIS GAME IN THIS STATE.

There should never be a situation where you are armed with a melee weapon, knife, sword, axe, or bat (I have tried them all) and your swings go right through the zombie eating your face.

It's not even something just happens "every now and then". It literally happened AGAIN just now 5 swings in a row, no audio cue, no stumble animation from the zombie, no registration what-so-ever. The whole time my arm and weapon is going through the zombie, they are freely hitting me and every single one of their hits register.

DO NO BUY THIS GAME. THE MELEE IS SH*T. IT'S A ZOMBIE GAME YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO BE ABLE TO MELEE ZOMBIES.

For crying out loud the melee in Dead Rising (release year 2006) worked better than this game in 2023.

------------------------------------------------
One of the worst games I have played years after it's been updated from it's Alpha Release.

The melee is as bad as early 7 Days to Die. You swing at a zombie that is right up against you and the first 2 hits connect, you get the audio cue and they stumble. 3rd hit you get an audio cue and they act like nothing happened. 4th, 5th, and 6th hits your arm goes right through them, no audio cue, and no stumble animation.

Server hosting settings? They make no f*cking sense. You need a translation for the translations I have found on Wiki and Steam discussions. Then most of the settings in the Wiki are outdated and not even available in the server files. Good luck figuring out what:

scum.EncounterCharacterRespawnBatchSizeMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterCharacterAggressiveSpawnChanceOverride=-1.000000
scum.EncounterCharacterAINoiseResponseRadiusMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeGroupBaseCharacterAmountMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeGroupExtraCharacterPerPlayerMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeGroupExtraCharacterPlayerCapMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeBaseCharacterAmountMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeExtraCharacterPerPlayerMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeExtraCharacterPlayerCapMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeActivationChanceMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeNoiseCheckCooldownMultiplier=1.000000
scum.EncounterHordeSpawnDistanceMultiplier=1.000000

any of that means. Some of it makes a little sense, but when tweaked it seems like absolutely nothing changes.

Zombie health is totally inconsistent. 1 zombie may take 3 hits to die, the next 5 or 6. Then you can immediately find yourself stabbing a zombie 30 times with the broken melee registration.

I was hoping that the game would have gotten better, but it seems like it's no different than original Alpha Release. At least other games like 7 Days to Die actually improved before releasing tons of content.

OH before I finish this review. THE HEALING HAS NO GOD D*MN EXPLANATION. They change the healing mechanic and then neglect to have a UI that is clear to understand when you're suffering from 2 or 3 C2 bleeds and you're trying to figure out why the rags in your inventory aren't working when you right click and choose "Treat".

The game is dumb. Maybe after the 1.0 I will revisit this game, but as of now it's not worth it.
developer_response:
Hi Torlokt! 

First of all we want to thank you for taking the time to write this review! 
We appreciate your feedback and we're sorry about your negative experience with the game and its melee system. 

Melee combat is something that's going to be addressed in the polish phase, that's when we'll dive into all the features and balance everything out as much as we can. 
We are FULLY aware of the issues in the melee system and it's one of our TOP priorities as we're heading towards the inevitable release of 1.0. 

Regarding these server settings, did you try them out in single-player? Hovering over each setting in the in-game server settings menu pops-up a rectangular text box with a explanation of what the setting does. 

Zombie health varies on the type of zombie. The skinny ones have the least health, obviously, but if you encounter a overweight zombie or a army zombie, wearing a helmet and full body armor, we believe it's only natural they have increased health and are not as easy to take down as the skinny ones. 

I'm not sure what exactly you mean by the healing change. If you right-click on the rag, click "treat" , it takes you to the health screen where your injuries are. Select the rags in your inventory or vicinity by clicking on them and click the "treat" icon. Please feel free to go into a little more detail. 

We are going to be entering the polish phase before releasing 1.0, and we'll iron out most of the issues so please be patient. 
We certainly appreciate your feedback and hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198879066149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11378, 'last_played': 1708282927}
review:
POS: one of the best survival pvp pve games (and ive played quite a few) based on content and play style choice.  survive alone, build, loot, fish, hunt, sell loot to traders and make a life in a forest if you want with impressive crafting options. or kill and raid in pvp. impressive realism when it comes to gunplay mechanics and crafting.  game is beautiful and runs great with new optimizations and graphics options.  (8700k 4.8 all core o.c. and 6700xt ave 120 fps on high) 

NEG: still a little buggy when it comes to loot transfers disappearing (not often) ie. storage chest to player inventory sometimes is an issue.  as well as some new features added that are buggy like battery chargers and cooking are an issue which will be fixed.  generally sorts itself out with a server restart or game restart.  again not often but still a little annoying.  
SERVER CHOICE IS HJGE BASED ON YOUR PLAY STYLE, IT CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE IN YOUR OPINION OF  THE GAME! overall great after .95!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002099181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4467, 'last_played': 1705732713}
review: When I had this game suggested and explained to me how this game works, I was pretty intimidated. It was a bit of a learning curve with crafting, health, injuries, infections, etc. This game is very in depth and is a pretty hardcore survival game. If it was not for some friends to help me along, I probably would not have spent this much time in the game. Hands down this is a great game with flaws obviously. A solid 8/10 for how the game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198949959777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1704184538}
review:
I am not 100% convinced the devs known how to program games.

I shouldn't have to modify my PC in 2023 to allow it to run a new game in compatibility mode.

After 1.5 hours trolling the internet trying to find a fix just to get past the main menu I give up. WTF and I expected to look for boot options for this?

If it was a brand new car....would you be happy to look for reasons why the bloody engine wouldn't start and chat to other people with engine problems to try and get your new drive out of the driveway?

If I could get my money back I would and that saying something as I got this game on 50% off special.

Money I would have been better off donating to Unicef because maybe someone would have gotten something out of it,.
developer_response:
Hi Darklordash73!

Thank you for taking the time to write this review! 
Would you mind going into a little more detail? Modify your PC in what way? 
Does your PC meet the minimum requirements? 
We understand your frustration and we're sorry this has caused you be dissatisfied with the game. 
However, we are still in early access and certain issues are to be expected. That's why we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon. During that phase we'll revisit all the features that need fine-tuning and balance them out, along with MAJOR bugfixes! That's all going to happen before the inevitable 1.0 release so you're bound to see some big changes.
We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

review:
rubbish can not make your own server have to rely on others to host and pay and the game is a joke.

in reply to DariusGOD2007 

yes i have a list of things

we played for hours only to keep dieing and not able to spawn atleast make it so that we can spawn and live in one location not spend the whole dam game spawning all over the map how can we as a group live and work if we have to spend 4 hours across a map to join each other.

or we put a bed down and flag only to find we need gold to spawn again and again , boring game.

come on how hard would it be to make changes like that we can start a base build on the community and our team can upgrade and grow.

so yes thats a start.
why not add us and see talk to us make a better game until then its a bin job.
developer_response:
Hi W1ZardSM1! 


We're sorry you're unhappy with the game BUT there are many private servers that you can join which might have server settings that work for you! 
You're not limited to only official vanilla servers. 
Is there anything else that's souring your game experience? We'd love the feedback! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991625014', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1705155115}
review: I love survival games especially with an element of PvP. This is a great DayZ replacement, at least for me. You have lots of crafting that is more intuitive than DayZ, the world seems to be more populated, server settings and single player is easier to set up, in my opinion it simply is the superior game in this genre. I still wouldn't choose this over something as flushed out as Rust however I believe I found the perfect way to play SCUM. In short bursts, go to a populated server, head to a red zone, get geared out in military equipment and get a gun, and just PvP. While progression feels janky, I'd rather spend my time shooting people than trying to survive. Great game if found at a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003272326', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 104691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104691, 'last_played': 1694224668}
review: i have run servers played on several and waited patiently this game to get back to what it was before the sold out. now it is a disappointment in so many ways to see them ask money for something that all other games gives away or at worst makes you earn is deplorable. asking for money for hair and dances is just ignorant and shows you have no love or even a bit of respect for your community. i have purchased and played since day 1. at this point even if you finished half of what was promised already i would not play or ever recommend this game to anyone.
developer_response:
Hi Plomak! 

Thank you for taking the time to write this review and for your honest feedback! 
We're sorry to hear your dissapointment with the game after so many hours you've played. 
Unfortunately, sometimes situations arise in game dev that complicate development, create new issues and ultimately dissapoint the players. We always try to fix any new issues at once. 

The DLC's are purely cosmetic and 100% players choice if he wants them or not. It doesn't affect gameplay at all. 

We have a roadmap that we're sticking to and it's been going well but we are a SMALL team, and sometimes things need to get shuffled, reprioritized in order to make maximum use of our people. This is a hugely ambitious game and we still got a ways to go before it's done, but with us entering the polishing phase fairly soon, a LOT of issues are going to get fixed, mechanics will be rebalanced and a whole lot more. 

We sincerely hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 

Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056855623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14883, 'last_played': 1703731844}
review:
If you want to go into negative $$$ every time you die because you're just starting and you have no gear, this is the game for you. 
If you want to travel for 3 hours straight in the largest map in existence to get back to your base because you have no option to respawn close to your base, due to lack of funds, then this is the game for you. 
If you want to then die just outside of your base because you have to swim in a river to get there, and your character doesn't know how to swim even though his stamina is at full and you've dropped all of your gear in the river in a panic, then oh boy, this is the game for you. 

This game looked so good before it came out. I was stoked for a hardcore realistic survival pvp game. I love difficult games. It makes the game last longer and it builds on your skills. My friends hate it, lmao. 
I give this game a shot every now and then, a good healthy shot as you can see from my hours, but every time I'm slapped in the face with horrible and buggy mechanics. (Usually results in me rage quitting from losing everything due to bugs)
It's such a shame. This game has such potential to be good, but I just can't stick with it with the direction it's going. Wasting an entire day on this game just to have all of the efforts ripped away by a broken mechanic is just not worth it. And the money system they're using currently just doesn't work. I'm sure it's pushing new players away. You just can't get anywhere anymore. Starting a game on a new server and starting up a base was hard enough before I had to pay for everything I did. (Fame wasn't perfected either though...)

Like I've said, I've given this game a fair shot, but honestly, most of the hours spent in this game was just me TRYING to establish myself and then losing it all. I unfortunately can't recommend this game in it's current state. I really hope it gets better. It could be really cool. Even the option to have Dedicated Servers with custom options would be huge for everyone. Oh well. No one is going to read this. Wubba lubba dub dub. Squirrels and Potatoes.
developer_response:
Hi Trendus!
 
First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
The game has a steep learning curve and hardcore realism which is the main draw for a lot of players. That's what drew me to the game, as a gamer first. 
I do understand where your frustration is coming from and we are aware of some issues causing players to lose progress because of bugs.

Unfortunately, those kinds of bugs are VERY hard to reproduce in our conditions but we've made significant progress and already eliminated a lot of them. We take this very seriously and want our players to have pleasant and fun gaming sessions. 
That's why we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon. That's when we'll revisit ALL the mechanics, balance them out and fix any remaining bugs.
That's what we'll be doing until 1.0 releases.
 
Actually, we read, analyze and discuss player reviews on a daily basis and your voice has been heard. 
Thank you for your support and honest feedback, we really appreciate it.
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind!
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063690448', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 39174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39174, 'last_played': 1703724675}
review:
[b]Update: 
It appears that the development team for this project is running out of funds. It is likely that the game will be dead in the near future and development will be halted.
After several updates, the developers have damaged the game mechanics more than they have implemented positive changes. Considering that they are not fixing these issues but instead releasing new updates that only include new paid DLCs, these are clear signs that funding for this project has been cut off.

Under no circumstances should you currently purchase this game. Due to the AI enemies spawning arbitrarily and not being fixed for months, it is unplayable and will likely be discontinued sooner rather than later.[/b]




Scum has started with a wonderful development, a real interest of the developers in their players and in regular intervals, new great content and very fast bug fixes. 

At the moment, and unfortunately for ever, a purchase is absolutely not advisable, as the game is currently not playable. 


At the time, it was probably the most realistic survival game on the market (vitamin requirements, balanced eating/drinking habits, different types of food). Disease and impairment systems...) is developing more and more into a mixture of Left4Dead2 and an online MMORPG. 

The bunker update, which brought a new OP puppet/mech with integrated god mode, was questionable, but didn't have much impact on the game experience, as everyone was free to use and raid these bunkers or leave them out of their game experience. 

I also remember very well when, in my early hours of SCUM, I fled into a house from the Puppets, left the house and not a minute later became the delicious lunch of a hungry wolf.... well, but that was once upon a time, because a very over-motivated developer was probably of the opinion that wild animals are surreal in a world and can only be tracked down by "actively accepting missions". 

With the new update, where puppets (zombies) spawn around you randomly and by random generation, sometimes every second (imagine you clean an area and a few seconds later, garbage appears again in the area you just cleaned) and a "horde function", which can be quite nice and adds excitement, this game title is more like a budding Left4Dead2 or 7DaysToDie. If the developers' goal is to reach this level, then they are well on their way. 

Unfortunately, due to these changes and innovations, the game is anything but worthy of its hype at the time and a purchase is definitely not recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982073199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3828, 'last_played': 1711061997}
review: Used to be a good game but now they've made it all about buying micro transactions to be able to play...removed from my steam.
developer_response:
Hi Sid! 

We're sorry DLC's made you lose interest in the game, but I have to address this claim. 
DLC's are purely cosmetic and totally OPTIONAL. You don't have to buy them, they don't change the gameplay and don't provide any kind of advantage over other players. 

Our game is about survival, puppets, weapons, vehicles, a huge map and having a good team by your side. 
That's what were all about and what the game is. 
We sincerely hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!
