author: {'steamid': '76561198089477182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1703716581}
review: Spend hours building your character up just to have some screamer spawn 20 of his buddies and ruin your day. After 4 attempts and same thing happened I do not recommend a game that basically s@#$s you right when it is starting to get somewhere.
developer_response: Hi wolfgar7474! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there were certain issues with the hordes spawning and therefore made tweaks to this system which should make the hordes spawn further away from the player. Also, we buffed the amount of damage melee weapons do to puppets which should give our players a better fighting chance in the early game. We also understand that further tweaks will possibly be necessary, which is why your feedback is important to us and why the game is still in Early access. We're still balancing things out and we're confident that by the full 1.0 release, we'll have something that is truly enjoyable for our players. While you've had a negative experience now, we hope you'll give us another chance eventually once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280956243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 14611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13452, 'last_played': 1710674040}
review:
Ganz ehrlich, ich mag eigentlich gar nichts mehr schreiben. Habe nach ca. einem Jahr es mal wieder probiert. Das Spiel wird immer unspielbarer. Das KÃ¤mpfen wird immer schlimmer. WÃ¤hrend ich letztes Jahr mich noch mit einer schaufel oder Pickaxt wehren konnte geht das heute nicht mehr. Sofort aus allen lÃ¶cher am Bluten, das verbinden hat nicht mehr geklappt. Genug Zeit, aber keine Ahnung wie das jetzt geht.  Warum einfach, wenn es auch kompliziert geht.  

Irgenwie ist das ein KÃ¶rpersimmulator geworden. Nicht sehr realistisch, dafÃ¼r aber unnÃ¼tz. GroÃŸer Mist. 

Nachtrag (10.01.24): Da will wirklich einer, das man auf gar keinen Fall SpaÃŸ. Hat, Heute erst Schubkarre gefunden, dann sogar ein Fahrrad. StÃ¤dle mit Schubkarre gelootet und in mein Camp gefahren. Meine Tasche auch noch schnell in die Karre geleert. Also loot vom ganzen Dorf. Dann zurÃ¼ck ins StÃ¤dle, aufs Fahrrad umd die KÃ¼stenstraÃŸe lang ins nÃ¤chste. 

Angefangen zu looten und dann neben dem Fahrrad ausgelogged zum Essen. Nach dem Essen wieder rein. Fahrrad nicht mehr da!. Gut. Die Taschen noch voll und ZufuÃŸ wieder den wirklich langen Weg wieder zurÃ¼ck. Hunger, Durst, auf Boden setzen und der ganz normale Scum-SpaÃŸ-Bremsen-SchikanenKram fÃ¼r devote Halbstarke.

Und natÃ¼rlich war dann auch die Schubkarre mit dem ganzen Loot vom Vormittag auch weg.
Bei Scum bin ich echt im falschen Film. Modulare Fahrzeuge. Die Leute feiern diesen Mist, der die benutzten Fahrzeuge auf den Servern verringern soll als Feature. Dabei soll er nur die Serverlast drÃ¼cken, weil sie die permanenten Lags nicht in den Griff bekommen.

Das ist Verarsche. Wer so ein feature im Ernst einbauen will, der muÃŸ auch alles bringen. Inclusive der ganzen doppelten und dreifachen Ersatzteilen, die dafÃ¼r benÃ¶tigt werden, damit es zufriedenstellend benutzbar ist. Aber wer die ersten fÃ¼nf Stunden mal ein Spiel angefangen hat, wird sehr schnell feststellen, das nun zwar sehr viele Chassis fÃ¼r Autos zu finden sind, aber die nÃ¶tigen Teile in einem akzeptablen rahmen und machbaren Radius nicht zu finden sind, wenn kein Clanboy mit Ersatzauto ist. Alleine ist man aufgeschmissen.

Immer wenn irgend etwas Spass bringt, kommt garantiert mit einem Update die Bremse. Zuerst ein Flugzeug oder zwei, dann wird es so gestellt, das man es erst von Mechs befreien muss. Eine ganze Zeit war es noch mÃ¶gich in Bunkern gescheite Waffen zu bekommen. Nun tropfen in Alien-Stil kurz hinter der BukertÃ¼r Alien-Terminatoren von der Decke und befÃ¶rdern dich ins Nirvana, damit du ja keine Gegenwehr mehr gegen eigentlich nur nervende Zombies leisten kannst. 

Ob hell oder dunkel, kommen sie nun aus bis zu 400 Metern in einem Affenzahn alleine oder zu zweit auf dich zugerannt. Irgend einer wird schon einen GlÃ¼ckstreffer landen und mit einem Hit bis zu 7 blutende Wunden durch die Kleidung, die nur manchmal beschÃ¤digt ist, du aber eine tief klaffende Wunde hast, die dich dann in wenigen Minuten ausbluten lÃ¤sst.

Man hat nicht immer den Platz bis zu zehn groÃŸe Lumpen, dazu am besten sauber und desinfiziert. immer dabei zu haben. Aber was will man von einem Entwickler halten, der einen Godmode zulÃ¤sst, allerdings nur fÃ¼rs Bauen. Blueprint hinstellen und Fertig-cheaten finden sie OK. Aber mal durch die Luft fliegen oder vor den wirklich schlecht balanzierten Gegnern
in Sicherheit zu bringen ist wohl nur etwas fÃ¼r Looser. 

Da hat wohl ein 14jÃ¤hriger Spieler das Ruder der Entwicklung Ã¼bernommen. Es ist Survival und das darf keinen SpaÃŸ machen. ZusÃ¤tzlich vermute ich eine sehr schwere Kindheit. Und besonders wenige Geschenke zu den Ã¼blichen AnlÃ¤ssen. Vermute ich bei der Normaleinstellung fÃ¼r Loot.

Zum GlÃ¼ck wissen gute Entwickler, das viel und gutes Loot zum Spass eines Spieles Beitragen. Sowie angemessener Fortschritt und Updates ohne das hinterher jedesmal ein paar mal nachgepatched werden muÃŸ. Gab es eigendlich schon ein Update ohne das hinterher etwas andere nicht ging. Ich glaube nicht. 

Man. So eine schÃ¶ne Map. Die AtmosphÃ¤re ist brilliant. Ohne mich verbiegen zu mÃ¼sse. Es ist der beste Walkingsimulator everever. Aber ein Spiel, was wirklich SpaÃŸ macht, bekommt ihr scheinbar nicht gebacken. Ich habe sogar den Eidruck ihr wollt oder kÃ¶nnt das gar nicht.

Wer Probleme damit hat, den Spielern Ã¼ber einen Gottmodus etwas zu erlauben, weil er das selber nicht will oder verstehen will, der hat vielleicht ein Problem. DarÃ¼ber sollte er mal mit jemanden sprechen, der kein Problem damit hat einen richtigen Gottmodus anzubieten, weil er sich einfach sagt, wenn der Spieler damit Spass hat sich zum Beispiel unverwundbar zu machen, warum sollte ich ihm verbieten diesen Spass zu haben, Das ist doch dumm. Ich will ja das er Spass hat und will ihn ja nicht ersziehen.

My teammate quit the game due to issues with vehicles penetrating building models. He has had the same problem 3 times, each time causing him to lose the supplies in the vehicle and have to walk to find another vehicle.
He is using a 1060 graphics card, which may be too old.
But even I have encountered problems with penetration into building models, however I was using a 3060 graphics card.
Another teammate took out a backpack filled with screwdrivers from the cabinet, but the backpack disappeared and the teammate exited the game.

SCUM is more difficult than other survival games, and failure will cause a heavy sense of frustration, especially when the failure is caused by game bugs.
So far, three teammates have left me. They all chose to quit because they couldn't stand the various loopholes.
SCUM is a good game, and although it has a lot of problems now, I believe it will get better, and I hope I won't lose teammates because of the game's bugs again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027404722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1671050514}
review:
If you enjoy the idea of ARMA but want a complex survival mechanic on top of it. This game is perfect for you. 

Being shot at when you are armed with a rock and a few sticks is actually not very fun. 

In fact, I think thats fucking stupid.
developer_response:
Hello HELLO:^) 
Thank you for your feedback. 
Would you mind going into a little more detail? 
We have added a tutorial to the 0.95 update which addresses all of the game's features and provides assistance. 

The game is admittedly hard and has a steep learning curve. Requires a careful approach if you wanna thrive, not just survive.

I would recommend crafting a stone axe and an improvised bag out of materials you can find ANYWHERE on the Island. 
Also, try playing on a private server with loot boosted to get the hang of the game before going on an official server. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063432201', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4970, 'last_played': 1703924483}
review:
SCUM hat die Messlatte fÃ¼r Survival-Spiele auf ein neues Niveau gehoben und stellt eine beeindruckende Kombination aus Realismus, Tiefe und SpielspaÃŸ dar. Entwickelt von Gamepires und verÃ¶ffentlicht von Devolver Digital, hat SCUM seit seinem Release eine treue Fangemeinde gewonnen, und das aus gutem Grund.

Die realistische Darstellung des menschlichen KÃ¶rpers und seiner BedÃ¼rfnisse in SCUM ist beeindruckend. Der Hunger, der Stoffwechsel, die Fitness und die KrankheitsanfÃ¤lligkeit sind allesamt Faktoren, die berÃ¼cksichtigt werden mÃ¼ssen, um im Spiel zu Ã¼berleben. Dieser Grad an Detailtreue trÃ¤gt dazu bei, eine fesselnde und immersive Spielerfahrung zu schaffen.

Die offene Welt von SCUM ist atemberaubend gestaltet und bietet eine Vielzahl von Umgebungen, von dichten WÃ¤ldern Ã¼ber stÃ¤dtische Gebiete bis hin zu militÃ¤rischen Einrichtungen. Die grafische PrÃ¤sentation ist beeindruckend, und die Liebe zum Detail ist in jedem Winkel der Karte spÃ¼rbar.

Ein weiterer HÃ¶hepunkt von SCUM ist das ausgefeilte Crafting-System. Spieler kÃ¶nnen nicht nur GegenstÃ¤nde sammeln, sondern auch ihre FÃ¤higkeiten verbessern, um fortschrittlichere Werkzeuge und Waffen herzustellen. Dies fÃ¶rdert die Zusammenarbeit und den Wettbewerb zwischen den Spielern und trÃ¤gt zur Tiefe des Spiels bei.

Der Mehrspieleraspekt von SCUM ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil des Spielerlebnisses. Von PvP-KÃ¤mpfen bis hin zu Koop-Abenteuern bietet das Spiel eine Vielzahl von InteraktionsmÃ¶glichkeiten mit anderen Spielern. Die Integration von Teamarbeit und strategischer Planung verleiht dem Spiel eine soziale Dimension, die weit Ã¼ber das hinausgeht, was viele andere Survival-Spiele bieten.

Einige kÃ¶nnten argumentieren, dass die Lernkurve von SCUM steil ist, aber genau das macht das Spiel so lohnenswert. Durch das Ãœberwinden von Herausforderungen und das Meistern der zahlreichen Aspekte des Spiels fÃ¼hlt sich der Erfolg umso sÃ¼ÃŸer an.

Insgesamt ist SCUM ein herausragendes Beispiel fÃ¼r ein Survival-Spiel, das Realismus, KreativitÃ¤t und soziale Interaktion perfekt vereint. Die Entwickler haben ganze Arbeit geleistet, um eine immersive und fesselnde Welt zu schaffen, die sowohl erfahrene Survival-Spieler als auch Neulinge begeistern wird. SCUM ist zweifellos ein Meisterwerk und ein Muss fÃ¼r Fans des Genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019266463', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 29927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29927, 'last_played': 1702710157}
review: I really enjoyed the game, played it for almost 500 hours, even with the myriad of game-breaking bugs present. But then came version 0.95. And i felt the need to write this review because they messed the game up so much that i can tell you with all my heart please give this game a HARD PASS. Maybe wait a couple years and check back, see if the devs actually fixed all the bugs PLUS all the new ones they added with the last update. There's a bunch of old game-breaking bugs present from year 1 of the game, and with the passing months they just keep piling up along the new bugs. Do yourself a favor and don't play this mess.
developer_response:
Hi Maloiik!

Thank you for taking the time to write this review and for the many hours you sunk into the game. 
We're sorry to hear you're unsatisfied with the game as of the latest big update. 
The team is aware of the issue in the horde system and is investigating them thoroughly.

Yes, some bugs have been lingering for a while, but now that we're approaching the inevitable 1.0 release, we'll be entering the polishing phase where we'll revisit every mechanic not functioning as intended and balance it out as much as possible. 
Some of those lingering bugs could not have been fixed before adding all the content to the game. Also, keep in mind that we are a small studio and we're doing our best to make SCUM the best game that it can be. 

Thank you again for your feedback, we hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198334919748', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 84903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78692, 'last_played': 1709585454}
review:
It's a great survival game! 
I can already say this game will have mod support in the future later down the road after it gets fully released!
Community servers have been a thing for a while now. Developers have added new features for server owners to tweak the game settings for their servers, including loot!

- Great server customization
- Plenty of variety of server types, including PvP, PvE, RP, and even some mixed together!
- Weapon variety
- Single-player mode
- Many different vehicle types
- Game has a tutorial/manual on how to play for new players! 

The game has great developers! They are very active and they are very open to new ideas and feedback from the players. 


I've had experience playing DayZ, and this in my opinion is far better and has more potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561199373069647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30047, 'last_played': 1703622620}
developer_response: Hi mopro! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. While we don't know what specific bugs that you've encountered made you dissatisfied with it, we'd like to emphasize that we still have a lot of work ahead of us with content additions and feature improvements, as well as with polishing, optimizing and bugfixing it as we're nearing its full release. The team is committed to making the best possible hardcore survival game and we hope that you'll give it another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023175271', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 6471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3885, 'last_played': 1704825440}
review:
Coming from dayz I decided to try scum again after a few years of updates so coming in to it in late 2023 was a good surprise and how addicted I have become ( now Most of this could be the server I happen to join which was amazing Great community even help each other out it is mostly PvE but it dose have PvP in it )

 anyway the hole game has me hooked trying to re learn everything from scratch the craft system etc is pretty good but I do wish the base building was alot more easier for placing instead having place then build etc ( this is only the main base walls etc don't apply to this ) 

There is one thing I wish they would add and I really really hope this dose get added or something if you in your base proximity it should allow you to have access to all boxes for crafting building etc cutting down trees in that area should also save time with building walls from any planks sticks etc in the zone yeah they added you can pack and bundle all the stuff together like a bundle of sticks and a bundle of wood etc but it gets tedious quick 


 either way it's not the worse the gameplay feels pretty good once you get used to it basically dayz but with some enhanments in many ways like traders ( mods usually do this anyway on dayz just here is built into the game ) it feels really good with having risk for better loot in hopes to find to sell or keep then to head to trader sell and get better stuff

 there also bunkers underground with plenty loot t

he issue I have current version of this game is the map it doesn't show which direction you are going making it more tricky not only that can't zoom into the map which they should hopefully change 

The fame points are supsoe to be used not sure how but for my server if you respawn at base cost nothing which is making the game 100 time better in my opinion as the fame points stop you from having to run miles on foot 

Another thing I love is if you do die and don't have a base you can at least spawn in any grid area it will be random where you spawn  in there from the sky but at least it save you spawning at the bottom the map and running for 100miles to die yeah you probably still got slot of running to do but it's way better going from bottom olog the map to the top like in dayz as it's just random


The only other issue is the matabalsim section is pretty complex

And healing is a bit of a chore click the womb then look for the rag or what eve you using to heal you need to then click that then click treat instead of it automatically suggested the best option or just you clicking treat and applying automatically nope you need to hit click the health section click the cut click the rag click the treat then repeat if it's infected you then have to click the alcohol or what ever you use to disinfect click the rag then bring up the health menu click the cut click apply and repeat PLEASE FIX THAT

author: {'steamid': '76561198306963318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5682, 'last_played': 1692089173}
review:
id play scum if there was like actual future tec weapons you can use or mechs to wear so to me it kinda feels like a asset flip that's too basic.
there is nothing exiting other than the giant mechs that just shit on you.
like i wanna sneak up behind and disarm a giant mech jump inside and rampage they are a pointless nuisance and that's it
nothing worth finding.
maybe someday soon but until then I don't recommend.

PS; I do love this game but atm its too empty.
developer_response: Hi Kayo! We're sorry to see that you did not find adequate enjoyment with the game. We're still in Early access and we still have loads of new content that will further enhance the experience of the game and make moment-to-moment gameplay more enjoyable. If you have a strong dislike for the Sentries, we advise that you find a private server where they are removed from the game. You may also find some settings such as greater loot spawns to improve your experience of SCUM. Regardless which option you pick, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another shot as we'd hate to see you discouraged from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199138628034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1705984508}
review: The game is a great survival game for the purist and casual game play, I love the healing system and the crafting system, the devs have gone into great detail about the mechanics of everything. Definitely would recommend this game to anyone in the future!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198837435496', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1703574735}
review: This game has SO MUCH potential. Early access for 37 years kinda tells you where it's at, and where it's going though.
developer_response: Hi KevieChase! We're sorry to see that the length of our Early access phase made you discouraged with the game. We acknowledge that we've been in this phase for a significant period of time, but a lot has happened in the meantime and there were a lot of changes and circumstances that we had to endure and overcome. The game is truly ambitious and a lot of passion and elbow grease is has been invested to deliver it to the place it currently is. We've been continuously updating the game over the course of this year with patches 0.85, 0.9, 0.95 and we're just shy of getting to that coveted 1.0 version and the full release of the game. We're very motivated and want to get there as much as our fans and we're confident that we'll indeed get over the finish line and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237412102', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1703889932}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995539546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1691707063}
review: Very cool concept with a lot of impressive detail and effort put into development. Great visuals and creative game play but from my perspective as someone who occasionally picks up the game, SCUM has a major drawback. After 10 minutes, items de-spawn. While I'm sure some degree of de-spawn time is necessary for server stability over time, I rather not have to start almost completely from scratch after leaving the game for a week or two. Once an update is made to allow adjustment of the item de-spawn time so it can be set to infinity on my server, I'll be back playing.
developer_response: Hi Hel1! We're sorry to see that you've experienced this bug and that it has diminished your time with the game. This is something that we know is present and we'd like you to know that we're working hard to fix it as soon as possible. As we're nearing our 1.0 release, we'll be dedicating significant effort to polish and optimize the game so that our players can enjoy the game without experiencing issues such as these. Once again, we're really sorry that this happened to you and we hope that you'll be so kind to give the game another chance once we manage to exit Early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561199152924579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9361, 'last_played': 1705425938}
review: Started playing a year or so ago and quit, recently came back to so much added content, there are a couple of things i think would help improve the quality of life for the game, but all in all i love the support the game gets and how much these devs care about their game. Best immersive survival sim out there. If you play DayZ this will make you switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006535933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40200, 'last_played': 1703916088}
review:
I want to recommend this game, I really do. However, I just cannot at this time. The concept is something great but the execution is just not there. One thing to keep in mind is that it isn't finished. They are still working out a lot of the issues but sometimes for better and sometimes for worse. A couple of pros and cons:

Cons first - Almost every major update has me asking WTF did they do that for?!?
                - All the major updates are followed immediately with hotfixes almost like they didn't even bother 
                   to test the update for shipping it
                - The game has gotten more and more painful to play. (i.e. You need to go into abandoned bunkers 
                   to get good firepower, but without already having great gear and good firepower the abandoned 
                   bunkers are almost guaranteed death. Which out of 25 ish bunkers in the game they made 17 of 
                   them abandoned.)
                - It feels like the devs wake up each morning and ask themselves how they can make it even 
                   harder to survive, taking mechanics that were challenging but good and making them insanely 
                   difficult 

Now to give some of the good points and why I still play and have hope that it will be great when it's finished:

        Pros - The concept. The PvPvE inmates vs other inmates vs puppets (zombies) in a contained zone 
                   fighting over survival gear, weapons, food, vehicles, and for fame is pretty interesting.
                - Map. The map is very large and with different biomes, weather and themes.
                - Setting adjustments. In single player and on private servers the setting can be adjusted to create 
                   a play experience the way you like. This is a pro but the limited ability and confusing explanations 
                   for some settings is a definite con.

Final thoughts:

This game has a ton of potential. In its current state I cannot recommend it for everyone or even the casual survival game player. If you are the kind of player who likes to build yourself up only to lose everything because a bomb wearing "beeper" spawns behind you 10 seconds after clearing the room. And you can get it on sale, then by all means go for it.
developer_response: Hi Cr0ssh4ir! Thank you for writing such an extensive review and we'd like to express our regret that you did not find the last update to be enjoyable. SCUM was always designed to be a hardcore survival game and ramping up challenge while maintaining fairness was always our core tenet. We acknowledge that some of the functioning of the new hordes can be better tweaked and balanced (which is something that we've already done by making the hordes spawn further away from the players and buffing the damage melee weapons do to puppets). That is why we value the feedback we receive from our community, which is important for Early access games such as SCUM. What we'd like you to take away from this is that the team is committed to bringing the game to its full 1.0 release or, in other words, delivering all the promised content and rolling out the necessary improvements and fixes that will bring the experience of SCUM onto another level. That being said, we hope that this experience will not discourage you from the game and that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

review:
Pretty much complitely rip-off. Makers doesnt really fix anything, they just release new dlc:s. 
Stuff keeps gettin disapearing when takin them out of closer or anywhere, weapons keep on breaking complitely after few clips. 

This game would be a great game, if some company really would make it to work. In my honest opinion: Do not buy this. You just lost your money. 

I know there is hardcore fans who keep defending the game and its devs, but reality check: game that has been so long as a early access, its just an excuse to do things badly. How on earth you devs dont fix real problems - and no, i dont need to hear about plans, nor new DLC:s for hairs, how about fix problems what community has sayed and stop playing around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987031715', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2461, 'last_played': 1703574191}
review: Overall I would recommend this game if you like survival/crafting in a PVP/PVE open world. I've played a lot of DayZ and although there are similarities there are also a lot of differences. The puppets(zeds) are tougher, there are a lot more crafting options and the gun play is a lot different. However, when you die you start with nothing and go through the gear up cycle. which is similar, and involves more crating. The map is large with a lot of POI's and there are many active servers. Worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158465560', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1928, 'playtime_at_review': 60248, 'last_played': 1712365432}
review:
edit 2/29/24 : FIXXX THE ZOMBIE HORDE . i killed zombie with a bow but it keeps calling horde ? are you kidding me . what is that? that is an issue from 2 months ago. can we get that fixed atleast please.

Edit: i've been playing this game for almost 2k hours. its not that frustrating anymore . bugs do exist stutters are still there. but atleast its playable now to the point you can enjoy the game. I cannot recommend the game yet. you might quit when playing at the  moment. hopefully it gets changed upon the time they start doing fixing the game after full release

_________________________________________________________________
I was so hyped to play the new horde update. 
but it failed. it doesn't make any sense. if u see one zombie, even if u kill it , it doesn't stop the scream to call horde,
those 5-6 puppets that will be summoned. it can do another scream. it doesn't really stop. 

I understood that eventually the puppets can get in the doors. BUT they can flawlessly jump from WINDOWS !! ? WHAT !!?
What zombie movie have they watched that made zombies like a god damn smooth criminal. Zombies crawl in windows not jump. your character will need to vault in the windows its like 2 seconds. but the zombie  can just jump for 1 sec. HAHAHAHAHAHAHA my brain exploded. I have never seen a zombie movie with a zombie that can jump kick like a ninja in a window HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA
developer_response: Hi Grim! We're sorry to see that the new update disappointed you. The idea behind this update for the puppets was to create a greater challenge and further enhance the moment-to-moment gameplay. We acknowledge that some of their functioning might not be as satisfying for all players, but we wanted to increase their threat, especially with their entry into buildings. The agility of puppets is also something that is specific to the lore of the game, meaning that they are not monstrous, decaying creatures like in other media, but retain virtually the same functioning as the living because of the BCU's controlled by TEC1. Also, the other reason this was introduced is because the threat of puppets was easily mitigated by entering buildings and now this is not an option as hey can open doors and enter through windows. Regardless, the game's in Early access and we're gathering feedback from our players on these matters and we'll be making necessary tweaks if the need arises. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance, at least once we fully release the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400573871', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1704462888}
review:
first i bought DAYZ, but after it randomly crashing several times in first 30 minutes, i instantly refunded it and bought SCUM. from the users perspective who played neither of these 2 games before and only watched youtube gameplays - SCUM feels good to me, it's more polished, no crashes so far and all in all - i wish i bought scum first so i didn't have to wait dayz refund pending. 

as for gameplay loop it's addictive - u loot and upgrade your gear, kill zombies and eventually run into other players, pvp isn't as fast paced and shooter-like as in rust, which to some might be a downside but for me it's huge upside, best thing about it, even if it didn't had pvp, it has so much content u will have tons of fun in a single player.

review:
Gra mnie irytuje.

PoczÄ…wszy od wyskalowania gry, tak by komfort gry byÅ‚ przyjemny poprzez generowanie postaci. Jest coÅ› takiego w tej grze, Å¼e mnie zniechÄ™ca i trudno to mi zdefiniowaÄ‡.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016389129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1703507326}
review:
Anfangs war es ein Spiel mit einer Idee. Jetzt ist es eine Idee die sich selbst im Weg steht.

Statt sich darum zu kÃ¼mmern dass das Spiel feritg wird, kommen immer neue Features rein nur um dann wieder entfernt zu werden, es wird in einer Tour am Loot rumgefummelt dass es mittlerweile so ist das 90% der Lootstelken leer sind. So habe ich in der letzten Session selbst nach 3 Stunden nicht eine Waffe gefunden (nicht mal in den 2 MilitÃ¤rbasen in denen ich war und auch keine auf dem Flugplatz), kein Essen, fast keine Kleidung ausser einem Beanie bei einem Zombi. Naja immerhin die kann man jetzt ordentlich melken. Rein ins DÃ¶rfchen, Zombies umhauen, raus aus dem DÃ¶rfchen-Zombies alle wieder da. Oder neulich an der Tanke: 4 Zombies dicklicher Gestalt halten eine Tanke im Griff der toten Klauen, ich dreh mich kurz um, weil ich etwas hÃ¶re -nix, dreh mich wieder zurÃ¼ck - Zombies alle weg. So geht's auch.

Auch macht sich das Team wohl mehr Gedanken drum, welche Farbe die Kampfroboter haben sollen und was aus dem Gamplay man schon vorab als teuren DLC an den Mann und die Frau bringen kann.

Haarpack fÃ¼r 5 Euro? CHECK!
Charaterpack fÃ¼r 15 Euro? CHECK!

Gut bei Ark gelernt. Das Game lauft bis heute auch nicht rund obwohl es "fertig" ist wird aber schonmal geremastert und ist wieder nicht fertig. Das wird hier wohl ganz Ã¤hnlich laufen. Man merkt immer mehr dass das Team keinem Plan mehr folgt sondern nur noch alles weiter planlos kaputt patcht. 

Am Ende heisst das Spiel dann vermutlich Scum vs. Predator oder so. War ja mal ne zeitlang hip als Filmtitel.

So wie es seit 3-4 Patches lÃ¤uft ist das Game ein klarer Fehlkauf fÃ¼r mich und ich fÃ¼rchte dass die Entwickler die Kurve auch nicht mehr kriegen. 

Daher wÃ¼rde Interessenten dringend abraten zu kaufen, sondern erstmal zu sehen ob das Ganze ein Dauer-Early Access wird oder doch mal fertig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365155854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15996, 'last_played': 1703461927}
review: As 0.95 the game is not good. The new PVE system is really bad, there is no safe zone for encounters, so sometimes puppets spawn right in your head, i was trying to get used but when a suicide puppet spawn right in you back several times it start to get in you nerves. the hordes do Have a distance for spawning and are more manageble depending on server settings.
developer_response: Hi Snake's Tiger! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game and with the changes introduced in the new patch. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to get a gun which will greatly help you with dispatching them with ease. You should also consider running away and retreating from a situation that might be too dangerous to face head on. Regardless, the team is looking into ways to further tweak various systems that should greatly improve the experience for our players and we hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884510794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1703461350}
review:
ok, this game isnt that good.
i know i didnt play much, so take this with a grain of salt.
first off, i hate the long loading times.
and second, its way too hard.
this was a bit short of a review.
developer_response: Hi Brainharmer! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. The loading times are usually not an issue and mostly depend on the quality of your internet connection as well as your system configuration. If you think that this is not the case, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ and explain in the issue with loading you are experiencing. As for the difficulty, the game is designed to be a hardcore survival experience that leans heavily on realism, which means that is is designed to be challenging. However, we understand that some of our players want a more casual time with SCUM, which is why we've enabled private servers where settings can be modified in a way where things like puppets are removed, loot is more available, etc.  That is why we advise that, if this is your preference and willing to give the game another chance, you try out the game on one of those.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977550329', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1081, 'playtime_at_review': 6718, 'last_played': 1712409778}
review: i found the game too difficult as you start with nothing and immediately are attacked by zeds, someone has locked all the garages and most of the building doors around the town at B4 making it impossible to collect anything to sell or find food and drink.  the night times are to long and you cannot get to see anything that will attack you. as i died so many times by hunger, thirst or zeds i was minus 2500 in coin which you have to pay off even before i could buy anything to help,
developer_response: Hi [Red Control] Smegga! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment in the game. SCUM can have a steeper learning curve and can be a bit daunting for new players, which is why we would advise that you acquaint yourself with the game's mechanics in singleplayer so you don't find yourself stumbling upon a town that someone locked up and thus disabled you from looting it. Regardless, the team will make sure to bring about a lot of balancing and polishing as we'll be nearing the full release of the game and we hope that you'll give it one more chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199241458629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 65310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 304, 'playtime_at_review': 60120, 'last_played': 1712364145}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989945752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1703453216}
review: Crafting and inventorymanagement are way overcomplicated
developer_response: Hi Galba89! We're sorry to see that you were not fond of the game and its mechanics. We understand that the game can have a steeper learning curve and that a tutorial would be greatly beneficial for new players. The game is still in Early access and there are still a lot of features that need to find their way into it. While the in-game manual that you can access by pressing TAB provides explanation for all of its mechanics, we acknowledge that a tutorial would be a better option. We'll make sure to address this as we'll be nearing the full release of the game and we hope that you'll consider giving it another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806286774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31051, 'last_played': 1708310988}
review: why gamepires? WHY???? you ruined my favorite game with your need to complicate an already fun game. the reason this game was amazing was the simplicity in it, nobody has the time to deal with real time cooking and broken hordes. if the goal is to lose your entire fanbase then keep it up cause soon there will be no one left
developer_response: Hi e1mago420! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the changes introduced in the new patch. The ideas with the horde was to up the challenge and introduce more variety into the moment-to-moment gameplay. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the hordes and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to get a gun which will greatly help you with dispatching them with ease. Regardless, the team is looking into ways to further tweak various systems that should greatly improve the experience for our players and we hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

review: the world looks pretty good, and the mechanics seem sound until you can create and host a serve to add true co-op this gets a no from me. it is presented as something it is not and that is a coop game
developer_response: Hi Rabide! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed by the game and that you felt misled. You can definitely play co-op by entering the same server (official or private) and then getting into a squad with your teammate, but you cannot host your private game without renting a server first. The team is focused on bringing the game to its full 1.0 release and rolling out the slated improvements and features. After that, we will be able to divert our focus onto other features that our community requests the most. Until then, we really hope that you'll give the game one more chance or when we exit Early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198988080499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 36224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5485, 'playtime_at_review': 13570, 'last_played': 1712498399}
review:
Nach dem ich erfahren habe das es fÃ¼r den Solomodus auch den Admin Helper gibt, muss ich meine erste Rezension Ã¼berarbeiten. der Admin Helper macht den einstieg in das Game deutlich einfacher. Wobei man sagen muss, dass man es mit dem Admin Helper nicht Ã¼bertreiben sollte, um sich den SpielespaÃŸ nicht zu verderben. Man Spawnt sich eine  erste Grundausstattung und vielleicht eine erste kleine Basis als HQ. Man sollte die Anpassungen an seine Karte nur wenig verÃ¤ndern. So ist gewÃ¤hrleistet das man eine gesundes VerhÃ¤ltnis zu seiner Umwelt behÃ¤lt. Mit diesem Hintergrund kann ich das Game weiter Empfehlen. Ohne den Admin Helper rate ich nach wie vor vom kauf ab. Hier kann das Gameplay bei den Spielern fÃ¼r zu groÃŸe Frustration fÃ¼hren. 

After I found out that the Admin Helper is also available for solo mode, I have to revise my first review. The Admin Helper makes getting started with the game much easier. It has to be said that you shouldn't overdo it with the Admin Helper so as not to spoil the fun of the game. You spawn your first basic equipment and perhaps your first small base as your HQ. You should only change the adjustments to your card a little. This ensures that you maintain a healthy relationship with your environment. With this background, I can recommend the game. Without the Admin Helper I still advise against purchasing. Here the gameplay can lead to great frustration among players.

Kleiner Nachtrag. Wie man sieht hat meine Rezension einen Clown Preis bekommen. Ich habe festgestellt das auch andere Spieler die das Game Positiv Bewertet haben einen solchen Preis bekommen haben. Ich gehe also davon aus das es sich um einen Frustrierten Spieler handelt der mit dem Game nicht zu recht gekommen ist. Ich fÃ¼r meinen Teil habe mich Ã¼ber die Extra Punkte sehr gefreut.  Also, anstatt deine Punkte fÃ¼r Unsinnige Preise auszugeben, solltest du lieber lernen wie man ein Game richtig spielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182263811', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4069, 'last_played': 1703434334}
review:
Really enjoyed the time i spent on this game apart from a few major issues which made me uninstall the game:- 

I enjoy looting and base building a lot but when you spend literally days worth of hours looting and then die (by puppets) you EXPECT your loot to be there on your body when you return.... i got to my body about 2 min later and ALL of my kit bugged out and i lost it all after spending around 10 hours looting today. I played a VERY low pop server and during my 70 hours of playing i did not see one guy so i know it bugged out and not looted. On top of this, you lose about 100 fame points which in themselves took 30-40 hours to get. 

Other frustrating things are time spent being exhausted when there is a complete lack of other transport (cars, city bikes, dirt bikes, boats) etc after 70 hours i could not find one god dam city bike tyre, a boat or a mountain bike ! lastly, why do i have to wait 10 - 15 minutes to cook a dam meal ? 

its just overall a bit to much and it just makes me feel like i have better things to do with my time.......
developer_response: Hi TEALETEAM! We're sorry for the inconvenience and frustration this situation has caused for you. We're aware of the issue and are working to fix it as soon as possible. The game is still in Early access and such issues are unfortunately bound to happen once in a while. Situations like these are the reason the team is committed to bringing the game to its 1.0 release as we'll be making a conscious effort to fix all of these issues that create frustration for our players and hamper their experience with the game. As for the car parts loot, you have to look at specific locations that tend to spawn such items, such as garages. You can help yourself and have a more detailed look at these spawn points on the third party map made by our community - https://scum-map.com/en/ . Again, we're very sorry that you've come across this issue and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we bring to to its full release eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198820740783', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30666, 'last_played': 1706545915}
review:
I have been playing scum for a while and with every new update it goes the wrong way, after the update with the horde i spawned somewhere near a police building location, had no chance with the zombies all over me opening doors now,they spawn out of the blue , sometimes get inside the buildings through doors and walls. If at the beginning of the game it was easy to reload a weapon , after some while you could only reload bullets in a magazine, well that sucks boys  .
Well that is hard core and not for me. Not anymore!
developer_response: Hi Tzuperboy! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to acquire a firearm. Regardless, the team here has their ear to the ground when these situations occur and react accordingly and we'll look into ways to further tweak this and other systems in order to facilitate as awesome of an experience for our players as possible. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561199378093128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1703408637}
review:
As another reviewer put it, "the devs care about the game, but not about the players."

This game does not have anything that even passingly resembles a meaningful tutorial. I felt like I was being actively punished for just trying this game, and I regret purchasing it.
developer_response: Hi Chadodoxy! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that the mechanics of the game could be better explained and that a dedicated tutorial would be more than beneficial - especially for new players. SCUM is still in Early access and we still have a lot of features, QoL improvements and content additions on the way before we fully release the game. We advise that you try to acquaint yourself with the game's mechanics by accessing the MANUAL submenu when you press TAB while in game. We acknowledge that the game may have a learning curve that is on the steeper side, but we'll make sure to address that as we'll be fully releasing the game and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we'll get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967501070', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1703378897}
review:
Tutorials are poor, to say the least. Every once in a while a pop up would show up on the side of the screen for a brief few moments, then disappear. No way to get them to return, that I could find, so I just often found myself scrolling through the keybinds menu to figure out what I am supposed to press. One (unhelpful) tutorial was to let me know that if I am finding lots of empty search items, perhaps another player has been there. That's great, but I'm single player. Who else is around to loot them? No, they're just all empty by design.

Outside of that, the tutorials provide you zero information. Most of my first hour of play time was trying to figure out the absolute basics on my own, such as how to make an axe. Stones are all over the ground so that's fine, I made a stone axe head. But I can't get branches from trees or bushes, and none of the ones I loot on the ground have a stick either. So... how do I get anything crafted?

Oh, you use a stone *knife* to cut down bushes. You can't get sticks from trees, and you can't use the axe head. Instead you somehow slice apart a bush with a rock. Very intuitive. The same thing happens with the tree bark cordage -- is it made from trees? From bark? Logs? Nope, sticks. Huh? Oh, and during all of this, I have to recraft the stone knife. Because reasons. The quality on items degrades so quickly, you pointlessly have to just recraft stuff to keep up.

Well, whatever. I follow a Steam Guide to figure out what to do next. I craft a bow, now that I know how to get sticks and cordage. This requires another entire stone knife almost. And then, arrows are made individually. One at a time. Except oh -- I can't carry them because I don't have a backpack. The starting inventory space is so absurdly limited, I'm not exaggerating when I say you can literally carry one or two items until you find or craft a backpack. So, I get *one shot* against a zombie (or, sorry, "puppet") and that's it.

Which of course, since the game provides no crosshairs or literally any indication at all where the arrow will go, I uselessly launch it straight into the ground three feet away from the puppet, who then screams. I have yet to even enter a building, and a horde of about ten puppets all come down on me, spawning in within feet. Literally even the location I was just crafting in now has enemies on it. Apparently this is a new mechanic in the latest update and is intentional. Why?

Naturally, I die. I am charged "250" of some currency that was never explained. So now, I'm in "debt". To... who? To what? Why? None of this is mentioned anywhere.

I remake a character and try again. This time, "gearing up" is still tedious but now I know what to expect, and finish in about 20 minutes. I make my way towards the nearest buildings, sneaking as quietly as I can, and alas, there's apparently no puppets in this village. I wander around for a bit, make the smallest back pack possible which provides a tiny amount more space, and keep looting. Over all, I find a tomato, a kitchen knife, and a kilt. Just about three hours in, and that's it. Out of like five buildings, that's all the loot I got.

At that point I realized just how tedious the looting and gameplay loop was, and lost interest. I've submitted for a refund, hopefully Vavle will approve it on the grounds I spent the first hour looking up tutorials and scrolling through the keymap.
developer_response: Hi creepy guy in the beer aisle! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that the mechanics of the game could be better explained and that a dedicated tutorial would be more than beneficial - especially for new players. SCUM is still in Early access and we still have a lot of features, QoL improvements and content additions on the way before we fully release the game. Even though you stated that you have requested a refund, we'd like to propose that you try to modify some of the settings of your SP game by entering the main menu when in the game and then picking the ''server settings'' option where you can modify a multitude of the game's elements, such as puppet spawns, amount of loot that can be found, etc. This will enable you to tweak the game to your liking. If you don't have the willingness to do so, we'd like to invite you to at least give the game another chance once we exit Early access so you can retry the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045836160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1706107802}
review: Don't get sucked in from the video trailer for the game....you start by being thrown out of a plane, wrists bound, free falling into a zombie-infested land with no clear objectives. Very limited resources from the get-go. I know this is in early development, and I suggest that starting with some kind of weapon, or a way to create a base of operations, would be a much better start to what could be a great game someday.
developer_response: Hi jmp98531! We're sorry to see that you've found the trailers for the game to be misleading as their purpose is to acquaint the player with the general theme of the game. SCUM is designed to be a gritty and hardcore survival experience where you have to fight relentlessly for your life and resources and where you have to rely on your wits and will to survive. The aim is to gradually build up from small beginnings where you almost have nothing and then step by step creating and upgrading your gear, taking up harder challenges in order to get better gear so you can increase your chances of survival and enable yourself to build a base of your own. We acknowledge that there are things that we need to fix and improve from a technical standpoint and we'll make sure to deliver that as we'll be nearing the full release of the game, and we really hope you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969302776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1703361971}
review:
Whoever implemented the horde mechanic needs to seriously go back to the drawing board. Spawning a bunch of zombies in close proximity to the player and then them instantly know exactly where you are is beyond stupid...

Loot drop rate is to far too low, the damage ratio of what is dealt to the player versus what the player deals to the zeds is far too off balance.  The rate of infection is far to high versus the rate of the players immune system can cure. Overall experience, not fun.
developer_response: Hi DasIstBooschitt! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to secure a gun. Loot has also been increased with the new patch, but if you feel that it is still not enough, we advise that you try playing on private servers where loot is additionally increased. Regardless of the changes, we're aware that there's still a lot of balancing that needs to be done with this system and others as well. We'd also like to reiterate that there is still a lot of work ahead of us as we're nearing the full release of the game, but the we have a strong commitment to make the game as awesome as possible and to make the best hardcore survival experience, and we hope you'll give the game another shot once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984007076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6840, 'last_played': 1703361973}
review: 0.95 ruined the game for me. Before you could tweak the settings to your own preference, and make the game as challenging as you wanted. Unfortunately, the old spawning system apparently was a resource hog, and now they have this silly horde mechanic... sounds cool doesn't it.... its not, the zombies will literally spawn right in front of you even when you're standing silently still. Its so silly, and its not immersive or realistic. Bring back the old spawning mechanics, because this is awful. If you want hordes, make the zombies bunch up and wander the map like a real horde. Or make sounds cause nearby ones group up, but this random horde spawn nonsense is just tedious and really useless, it doesn't even reward players for playing stealthy. I'm out, for now, if they don't fix it, I'm out for good.
developer_response: Hi PhoenixTwo87! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to secure a gun. Regardless of the changes, we're aware that there's still a lot of balancing that needs to be done with this system and others as well. We'd also like to reiterate that there is still a lot of work ahead of us as we're nearing the full release of the game, but the we have a strong commitment to make the game as awesome as possible and to make the best hardcore survival experience, and we hope you'll give the game another shot once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113839361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4019, 'last_played': 1705223995}
review:
Just came back to play this, haven't touched it at least a year. or more.. bought it as it came out as a support to my fellow country men.
got everything updated, just get a FATAL ERROR and crash after anti cheat was initialized... cannot update or reinstall anti cheat. tried uninstalling the game, reinstalling, verifying countless times over steam.. just doesn't work..

generally interested in PVE mode. 
i played PVP, servers often crashed, not to talk about campers and shit.. just isn't fun..

fuck..
developer_response: Hi there dzombalaja! We're sorry to see that you've experienced some issues after the latest update. This sound like something that can be remedied, which is why we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with this. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something that can be taken care of, which is why we truly hope you'll contact us with more info so we can help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008883508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4597, 'last_played': 1708318615}
review: Learning curve is pretty high, so unless you have tons of hours to get even remotely familiar with the game, I would pass on it.
developer_response:
Hi Caliban! 

Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it! 
While we agree that has a steep learning curve, that's why we added the codex with the 0.95 update, which has information on every game mechanic in SCUM and should help out new players and those seeking a little reminder. 
The realism and the difficulty is actually the main draw for a lot of players, but we aim to also make the game welcoming to newcomers, hence the tutorial!
Also, during the polishing phase, every feature will be revisited and balanced out as much as possible before the 1.0 release!
Again, we appreciate your feedback and hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020051016', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1703295812}
review:
So many cheaters in Scum.
So many bugs still after years EA.
So many game balance issues.

It feels like a walking and eating simulator. Everything else is just an add on.
developer_response: Hi Steinaar! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game. We'd like to say that we completely understand your frustration and that we acknowledge that we have to do better in these regards. You'll be pleased to know that the team is committed towards ironing out all of the gripes that you have with the game and that we'll have it as polished as it can possibly be as we're nearing its full release. We're implementing means and processes to react more quickly to cheaters in order to minimize the damage they are doing on the servers. Also, we'll have a dedicated polish phase where we'll just be bugfixing and optimizing the game, making the experience as smooth as possible. Balancing is also something that will be attended to with certain aspects, and we'd like to hear more from you in this regard via https://support.scumgame.com/ if you would be so kind. All that being said, the team is committed to making the game the best possible hardcore survival experience and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

developer_response: Hi podalan9811! We're terribly sorry for the issues that you've experienced and that have soured your time with the game. We're still in Early access and are actively looking for solutions for these occurrences. The team here is committed to making SCUM the best possible hardcore survival game that is as polished as it can be by its 1.0 release. We acknowledge that there's still a lot to do in front of us, but we're certain that we'll deliver on our promise and we hope you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199499893253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6898, 'last_played': 1709583483}
review: this game does not get enough credit for its PVE its the most immersive experience iv ever had in a game at 1st it seems really confusing to keep up with all the health and treatment stats but that makes it so good . Just picture your self standing on a beautiful hill with the wind blowing through the trees looking over 1 of many many towns and locations to go loot or live at the items in game are never ending in a very good way u can strip down your cars u can shoot with a pistol from the safety of your car once u buy one u can search through anything to find something and the game runs off logic u want tools look in garages u want guns go to police stations or bunkers u want food go look in kitchens and restaurant meds u go to hospital ETC , u hate people killing u and taking your awesome loot go play PVE server thats my jam personally u have to pee and poop if u forget to pee pee or poo poo u better grab soap and clean your pants because u gonna have a stinky situation on your hands and be more prone to infections when u have a wound on your leg and finally the fact that u can put things on tables like a meal and a drink or what ever u want to put where ever u want to put it i can go on and on about how great this game is but if i do im  gonna need a book publisher XD get the game its amazing i have played many survival and zombie games nothing compared to this game u will be hooked good luck out there YOU SCUM!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974697238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 44894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5407, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1712027223}
review: My crime is arson and it took me an hour to figure out how to start a fire when I had matches and a lighter.  Imagine Rust where 99% of the containers are empty and the manual consists of watching Youtube videos.
developer_response: Hi there Mellitus1967! We're sorry to see that a lack of a proper tutorial diminished your opinion of the game. There is an in-game manual that you can access by pressing the 'TAB' button where you can find all the information on the mechanics of the game, but we acknowledge that there are better ways to more organically inform the player of the game's systems. This is something that we'll be attending to as we'll be nearing the full release of the game,which is inching ever closer as we've recently released the 0.95 patch. All that being said, we acknowledge your argument and we hope that you'll give the another chance once we fully release the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137647372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 17297, 'last_played': 1711495908}
review:
Don't get me wrong, I love this game, I really do! Truly a fantastic idea, and the potential for this game to be a one-of-a-kind masterpiece IS THERE I SWEAR haha. I recommend it... but wow there are some serious issues that have cropped up from the most recent update. I won't repeat them here, pretty much everyone is aware of and talking about them in other reviews and community discussions.

Here's to hoping that the full release will showcase and live up to the absolute brilliance that SCUM should be... if done right. 
Honestly... and I say this with a heavy heart... hold out buying it for now... but keep this game on your radar, hope isn't gone and it could still be an absolute banger when/if the issues are addressed.

Good luck devs, I really, really hope you guys can pull this off!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012707831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 19062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18733, 'last_played': 1703302106}
review:
The game is still in it's Early Access stages of development, which means the content is somewhat limited for the moment... This is purely a Survival Game in a Zombie and Wild Animal filled environment... It uses a set map, and can cater to both PvE as well as PvP... 

Graphically, the game is alright, requiring a decent system for the highest settings... Being that it's in Early Access there are some bugs when it comes to graphics, which can be frustrating for some folks... The biggest bug being that some folks, when driving too fast in a vehicle, can suddenly drive their vehicles under the map because the visuals did not catch up fast enough, which usually (not always) ejects you from the vehicle... The vehicle can either become unrecoverable, including anything stored in it, or the vehicle might even get launched somewhere (that typically involves the vehicles destruction but not always)... So go into this game knowing that... It doesn't make the game unplayable, but it does push some folks to keeping their vehicles under a certain speed limit, depending on their system, connection speed, etc...

Game play wise, this game uses a more involved system for many things, with only a slight amount of automation... I actually like deeper systems, so it doesn't bother me much... As an example, the crafting system requires manually doing certain tasks and/or steps in constructing certain things... Like crafting the various components and then constructing the whole item... Or planning out building structures, then hand delivering the various required components for construction/upgrading...

Some other things to keep in mind are food and drink, which breaks down into various metabolism based things such as vitamin levels, protein, fats, and do on... You even have to pay attention to going to the bathroom when needed, so that you are not suddenly forced to go in the middle of a fight... :)

The game can be played solo or in teams, and/or a mix...

The only big downside I've seen thus far is how the developer keeps putting out DLC's for a game that is still in Early Access development... It's mostly cosmetic stuff or items that look different but are no better then what can already be acquired in game already... So it's not pay-to-win stuff, but it is sorta annoying that they are pushing DLC's when the game isn't even finished yet... Feels more like a huge money grab, which I can only hope is being used for further development, and not lining the owners pockets...

All in all, the game is still in it's early days, so I expect to update my review when the game eventually goes full release... It's not a bad game, but can eventually feel a bit empty of non-repeatable content, if you don't have folks to play with in order to keep it feeling somewhat fresh... Would I pay full price? I did, but it's really up to you as long as you realize the game is still mid-development... I wouldn't really buy the DLC's unless you enjoy the game enough, and want to help the developers further finance development...

author: {'steamid': '76561199585269070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1703561775}
review: Amazing game. Think of DayZ but 2x better in almost ever aspect (seriously, it is literally just a better DayZ) Solo is very fun since you can customize everything from Item Drop rate to Zombie Damage, to even Mech damage (or you can disable them entirely) Multiplayer is very enjoyable aswell, there is a server for everyone. Want a PVP driven server? There are multiple. Want a server for casual players? There are multiple. Want a server with strictly PVE? There are multiple. Whatver you're looking for, you will find something that works for you. The community is great aswell, there are alot of people willing to teach you the ropes of the game. While it can be a little overwhelming at first, it doesn't take too long to get a grasp/understanding of most game mechanics.

review: It was a great game before the update, now its impossible to play alone and hard to play with my girl and teammates, its a shame because im my opinion it was the best survival game. I was even convincing a lot of friends from my server on DayZ Brasil to come play with us, now ill have to refund some of them myself for a bad reccomendation haha
developer_response: Hi Berseven! We're sorry to see that the last update made the game too challenging for your teammates. The horde update was launched with certain issues, such as puppets spawning too close to the players. You'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so that puppets spawn further away from the players and that we have buffed the melee weapon damage that you deal to puppets to give the players a greater fighting chance in the early game. We'll also be looking further into the situation and will provide additional tweaks if they will be necessary and we'll make sure to improve and polish the overall experience of the game before the 1.0 version of it and we hope that you'll be there with your team when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051899716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26980, 'last_played': 1657435139}
review:
After 5 years of waiting for the server files the dev's said would be released at build 1.0.
Now the dev's are getting close to 1.0 they now state they will consider releasing them after 1.0.
So much for any trust with these dev's even after all the BS skin DLC they kept pumping out and not fixing things from years ago.
developer_response: Hi kir-kanos! We're sorry to see that the unavailability of server files has diminished your opinion of the game. While 0.95 is very close to 1.0, the idea was never to release the server files prior to the release or even with the full release of the game. It was never explicitly confirmed that they will be released in those time frames. If you understood it in that way, we apologize for the miscommunication. To be completely frank, the lead up to the 1.0 will be hectic and our main focus will be delivering the promised content additions and to make sure that the game is polished and optimized and that it is running as smoothly as possible. Once the game will be out, we'll also be all-hands-on-deck for any crazy scenarios or issues that might pop up and until we're certain that everything's stable, we'll be able to focus on additional options and features for our players. We understand that this might not be the answer that you are looking for, but this is realistic and truthful and we'd like to kindly ask you for a bit more patience and understanding until we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199262408191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71871, 'last_played': 1709949215}
review:
This game is great! Although there are many servers you can play on, you will have to find the one that fits you. There is so much to do in this game and boy does time fly by when playing! You get to choose the scum life YOU want to live. You can try to survive without a weapon and let me tell you it won't be easy after this Horde Update. Keep in mind there are other players in the game and it is best to assume they are not friendly especially if you are running around in a PvP ZONE. If you are new to the game I highly recommend joining one of the Facebook groups for any questions about the game because there are a lot of helpful people on there. Well, I hope you enjoy the game as much as I do.
-SCUM <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198236644686', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18917, 'last_played': 1710279299}
review:
Liebe Gaming-Community,

ich mÃ¶chte meine Begeisterung fÃ¼r das Spiel SCUM teilen und betonen, warum es meiner Meinung nach DayZ in vielen Aspekten Ã¼bertrifft. SCUM ist zweifellos ein Meisterwerk der Survival-Gaming-Welt, das durch eine beeindruckende Vielfalt an Funktionen und Innovationen glÃ¤nzt.

Die Grafik von SCUM ist atemberaubend und schafft eine immersive Welt, die bis ins kleinste Detail liebevoll gestaltet ist. Die realistische Darstellung der Umgebung, gepaart mit dynamischem Wetter und Tag-Nacht-Zyklen, sorgt fÃ¼r eine fesselnde Spielerfahrung, die weit Ã¼ber das hinausgeht, was wir von vergleichbaren Spielen gewohnt sind.

Die Charakterentwicklung in SCUM ist ein weiterer Punkt, der das Spiel hervorstechen lÃ¤sst. Die umfassenden AnpassungsmÃ¶glichkeiten und die tiefe Progression verleihen dem Spieler eine persÃ¶nliche Note, die in DayZ oft vermisst wird. Das Skill-System ist gut durchdacht und trÃ¤gt dazu bei, dass jede Entscheidung des Spielers taktische Konsequenzen hat.

Ein besonders lobenswerter Aspekt von SCUM ist die realistische Simulation von Hunger, Durst und Gesundheit. Dies trÃ¤gt nicht nur zur Immersion bei, sondern erfordert auch kluges Ressourcenmanagement und schafft so eine zusÃ¤tzliche taktische Tiefe im Spiel. Die Vielfalt der verfÃ¼gbaren Waffen und AusrÃ¼stungen sowie die realistische Schadensmechanik machen die KÃ¤mpfe in SCUM zu intensiven und aufregenden Herausforderungen.

Zusammenfassend kann ich mit Ãœberzeugung sagen, dass SCUM DayZ in vielen Bereichen Ã¼bertrifft. Es ist nicht nur ein visuelles Fest fÃ¼r die Sinne, sondern auch ein taktisch anspruchsvolles und innovatives Survival-Spiel. SCUM setzt neue MaÃŸstÃ¤be fÃ¼r das Genre und sollte von jedem Survival-Fan unbedingt erlebt werden.

Mit freundlichen GrÃ¼ÃŸen,
Paradeo

author: {'steamid': '76561198097700077', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 14356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13081, 'last_played': 1710055676}
review:
It is often compared to DayZ. Although it is an open world survival game with zombies geared more towards realism, It is not well suited for people new to survival genre. This is meant for those of us who have many hours in survival games and want one that is immersive and deep. Even with 200+ hours I am still learning the game and have yet to build a base. I have had a car a handful of times. Its brutal but beautiful. Still rough around the edges, and needs some work. But the work I have seen done to the game through early access keeps me coming back.

TLDR: If you're a survival veteran, you would like it. If you're new, do some looking into it before purchasing. Go watch some videos as it's a lot.
