author: {'steamid': '76561198171947726', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12829, 'playtime_at_review': 200124, 'last_played': 1712494588}
review:
I play SCUM from the very first day it was up and my review will be the following: 

SCUM is an early access survival game, and the experience has been nothing short of thrilling. Here's why I'm excited about the game's potential:

1. Engaging Gameplay:
The core gameplay mechanics are solid, offering a unique blend of [mention key features, e.g., crafting, exploration, and combat]. The challenges presented are both rewarding and immersive, keeping me on the edge of my seat.

2. Dynamic World:
The game world is not only vast but also dynamic, evolving as new updates are rolled out. I'm constantly discovering new places, encountering diverse creatures, and adapting to ever-changing environmental conditions.

3. Developer Interaction:
It's clear that the development team is passionate about their project. Regular updates and transparent communication on the roadmap reassure players that the game is in good hands. The responsiveness to community feedback is commendable and reflects a commitment to delivering a polished final product.

4. Graphics and Atmosphere:
The visuals are stunning, creating a captivating atmosphere that enhances the overall gaming experience. Whether it's the play of light at sunrise or the ominous shadows in the deep forests, the attention to detail adds a level of immersion that few games achieve.

5. Potential for Growth:
Early access is all about potential, and SCUM has a ton of it. The foundation is strong, and I can't wait to see how the game evolves with future updates. The roadmap promises exciting features, and I'm eager to be part of this journey from the beginning.

In conclusion, SCUM has exceeded my expectations for an early access title. It's a testament to the dedication of the developers and the incredible potential this game holds. If you're a fan of survival games, diving into SCUM is an absolute must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037288805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2467, 'playtime_at_review': 31255, 'last_played': 1712499173}
review:
Bekam es geschenkt und hat anfangs echt SpaÃŸ gemacht, aber mittlerweile ist das immer mehr Frust. 
Das untote Viehzeug gibts in verschiedenen Varianten, aber alle wohl damals in der Schule Erster im Dauerlauf und teilweise auch Sprinten, sowie durchweg Jahrgangsbeste in Hochsprung. Im Fitnessstudioabo hatten sowieso alle. Aber Pfadfinder waren die keine und keineswegs still. Immerhin eine eklatante SchwÃ¤che...
Aber Seit Herbst hÃ¶rt man die Zombies/PÃ¼ppchen nicht mehr, es sei denn sie sind im Umkreis von 3-4m - aber dann schlagen sie einen schon tot. War schon nicht schÃ¶n, aber ging noch...
Jetzt kam das Horde-System, welches man echt als Gefahr sehen muss und darf man auch mal die Hufe schwingen...oder muss. ZusÃ¤tzlich fallen sie jetz gerne alle paar Minuten im Dreipack(minimum) um dich herum vom Himmel, abgeworfen durch StuKas, so nahe wie die runterkommen!?! Das war schon zum kÃ¼beln, man kommt nicht mal zum looten...
Und Gestern gabs nen Patch der deren Schaden nochmal erhÃ¶hte!!! 2-3 SchlÃ¤ge und du beginnst schon zu verbluten...selbstverstÃ¤ndlich auch gleich wenn man frisch anfÃ¤ngt! Ist ja leider nicht so das man hier Ã¼berall vernÃ¼nftige Ausstattung findet, nein mal lÃ¤uft erst herum wie in der Steinzeit...und kommt kaum aus ihr heraus.
Meine Frage an die Entwickler - spielt ihr euer Spiel auch mal ohne "Dev-Cheats" oder wollte ihr die Leute von Server prÃ¼geln???? Diese Richtung ist meines Erachtens die Falsche.
Neulinge werden da ganz schnell euer Spiel zurÃ¼ckgeben, - hoffentlich - jedenfalls solange es einseitig in diese Richtung geht. 

Solange kann ich KÃ¤ufern nur davon abraten, es sei denn ihr steht auf SM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312101412', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 14374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10492, 'last_played': 1710668498}
review: A fun game ruined by constant issues and bad game design/developers, with the most recent update, zombies/puppets will constantly spawn behind you and the horde system just teleports zombies 15m away from you. The game fails to load buildings and terrain constantly while running on an m.2 drive, causing your vehicles to fall through the world and vanish, deleting your hard work and everything in it because for some reason the developers didn't make a failsafe for vehicles doing that. If a building or object renders in on top of you, you become stuck, needing an admin or to suicide to get out. The game has been out for 5+ years, this stuff ruins the game and has needed fixing for years.
developer_response: Hi DawnSapphire! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad experience with the newly updated game. We acknowledge that there were issues with the spawning puppets and you'll be pleased to know that this was tweaked in one of the hotfixes that we've put out after the patch. The situation that happened to you should not occur again and we hope that you'll continue playing the game and give it another go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065653291', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12468, 'last_played': 1703148953}
review:
This game is Garbage Similar to Day Z running Simulator,  Early access for Years but theres several cosmetic skins PAID DLCs just another shit game greedy cash grab with no intention to polish or finish and it looks like shit


Dont waste your money.  Can't believe they have the balls to charge for this shit
developer_response: Hi there IED Ernie! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. SCUM is still in Early access and we acknowledge that the game has certain issues and that we still have a lot of work to do. That is why we'd like to emphasize that the team is wholeheartedly committed to completing the game, improving the existing systems and features, and bring more additional content to the base game which will further enrich the experience of the game. Given your harsh words, we understand that it is unlikely that you will give the game another chance, but we'd like to extend an invitation and ask that you give it another chance as we'll be exiting Early access in the foreseeable future so you can see how the game has changed and improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561199509017424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1703142410}
review: the mouse is not lined up correctly and is making it impossible to play.
developer_response: Hey there the_phantom_sniffer! We're sorry to see that you are experiencing issues with the cursor. It might be an issue with the aspect ratio or the resolution you are playing on,so might want to try changing that. Regardless, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com and kindly ask you to describe the issue you are experiencing so we can make sure to fix it as soon as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353276411', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1703127933}
review: The fighting mechanics are kinda garbage. Way to many zombies that are all way to overpowered. Expect to die a lot. I regret this purchase. I do enjoy the quality in the health system as far as depth but its a waste since all i do is get pushed in a corner by 15 zombies and i have no way to get away from them. Some cool stuff but not enough to warrant a purchase. wait till they learn how to balance the zombies and fighting mechanics.
developer_response: Hi alex westland! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment in the game. We acknowledge that the hordes may have not worked as intended when the patch came out. You'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so that the hordes don't spawn directly on you. We've also balanced the odds by significantly increasing the damage you do to puppets with melee weapons. All that being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and hope that you'll have a much better experience with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401135430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29801, 'last_played': 1705725906}
review: This game has now been in early access for 72 years, game is constantly broken and a nightmare for admins to keep stable servers going. I have experienced server crashes and corruption over multiple hosts and you lose all your hard work with roll backs. Do your research before handing over your cash for this game.
developer_response: Hi there Pandemic! We're sorry that you are experiencing server issues with the game and that they are giving you a hard time. The game has been in Early access for quite some time, that is true. But we are doing the best we can with our capabilities we have at hand. As for the server issues, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with the issues you are experiencing. We'd like nothing more than these issues fixed so we really hope that you will contact us and help us get rid of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098188257', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1703116626}
review:
Yeah, I'm about 90 minutes in, and frankly, I just don't like it.  The inventory system is a massive pain in the ass, and combat is errratic and wonky.  I don't understand why so many people like this game.  Crafting ANYTHING relevant is a massive pain in the ass.

I'm not going to refund it though, I've wasted 20 bucks on many things.  It's not broken, it's just the unconventional inventory system is completely unfun to play with.  It's not like Ark, or The Front at all.
developer_response: Hi there islander! Since you have only 1.5 hours in the game, we'll assume that you did not manage to find some better clothes or gear that would extend your inventory space. Clothes (especially the starting inmate uniform) does not give a lot of inventory space, meaning that you need something to help you until you find something better. We suggest trying to craft an improvised courier backpack. It's easy to craft and will provide you with the necessary inventory space until you find something better. Hope this will help a bit and we hope that this will not discourage you from further enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076444947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4843, 'last_played': 1703085464}
review: a new patch is out, I begin to download it, it finishes updating. In an hour I notice another 60 Mb of another update, begin updating the game and it begins to patch the whole game which is about 60 Gb. After it finishes patching another 60 Gb update begins to download. And it goes into a loop of endless downloading/patching. I begin to think that developers nowadays become more and more incompetent because they keep releasing raw alpha versions for real money and they dont have any incentive to work hard because people would buy any crap in a nice wrap. It is time to forbid developers from publishing their alpha crap for real money.
developer_response: Hi there Reac! We're sorry to see that you're experiencing issues with the download loop. We'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with the issue you are experiencing. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something that can be fixed and attended to, which is why we hope you will contact us.

Entretanto, os bugs como as "pontes fantasmas" (ao atravessa-las de caminhonetes, vocÃª cai no rio e perde seu veÃ­culo com tudo dentro e com risco de morte), as quedas repentinas dos servidores oficiais (se vocÃª tiver dentro do barco, vocÃª automaticamente cai dele quando retornar), e agora na Ãºltima atualizaÃ§Ã£o o respawn de zumbis extremamente rÃ¡pido (menos de 4 min), sÃ£o muito, muito irritantes!
Eles precisam consertar isso, mas com urgÃªncia! Se arrumarem jÃ¡ melhora 50% o jogo.

review:
Used to be a good gun game, with a decent survival game attached.

Now it's a good gun game that's punished with a shit survival game.
developer_response: Hi Arkitekt! We're sorry to see that the newest update is not to your liking. We acknowledge that there were some issues with the hordes (such as spawning too near to the player). You'll be pleased to know that we've attended to this issue by tweaking the distance of their spawn points in the first hotfix after the patch and have also balanced things out by buffing the damage you deal to puppets with melee weapons. Keep in mind that you can also enjoy the game on private servers where puppets are minimized or non-existent, so you can try those if you are inclined. All this being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200068973', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4371, 'last_played': 1703077344}
review:
After 5 years this game still has the worst melee combat I've ever seen in my life.. I craft a spear and I have to spam click like a maniac just to pinch the zombie into the stomach like that's gotta do smth... Just let me stab him in the f head dude wth
Also the same for running animation, jumping, climbing over fences etc. Really disappointed in the game!
developer_response: Hi DeSiNNeR! We're sorry to see that the animations soured your experience of the game. We're aware that melee combat is a bit dated and that it needs to be spruced up and you'll be pleased to know that this is something that we'll aim to improve down the line, as we'll as other animations. The game is still in Early access and we still have a lot of work ahead of us, and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we fully release it with all the necessary fixes and improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184496693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 745, 'playtime_at_review': 16048, 'last_played': 1711994797}
review: Full of cheaters at the moment (70% of population are Chinese). No point in playing this game right now since they can always teleport inside of your base and steal all of your stuff without even unlocking or destroying anything. Waste of time looting something (which takes hours and days) when you can lose it in an unfair way. No matter how many times you report and they get banned they will always come back. Some other solution must be found! Game as survival game is very good but unplayable right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141459820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 752, 'playtime_at_review': 3718, 'last_played': 1711835333}
review: Thanks for making the zombie respawn one meter in front of me. The wonderful update 0.95 means that I will never run out of bots to kill again... The game is unplayable at the moment, respawning bots is a joke at this point
developer_response: Hi there HawkenRoc! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. The situation with horde spawning that you mentioned did not work as intended. We've heard the complaints from our community and you'll be pleased to know that we have attended to this issue and tweaked the horde spawns so that they don't spawn directly on you. We're also looking into ways to further tweak this system if it will be necessary. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance and hope that you'll now have a better experience with it.

I would like to call the 0.95 update a very terrible update
Zombies are refreshed out of thin air, and they are also refreshed at home. Zombies are refreshed indefinitely. Zombies are not refreshed unless they are close (and then self-destruct to refresh their faces).
The map loads slowly, the car gets stuck in the bridge, the car flies directly off the broken bridge, the car goes directly into the fence and cannot get out, the car is on the third floor, and the car is inexplicably out of battery.
This version also swallows more things. It doesnâ€™t even matter the magazine. It also swallows backpacks, boxes and other large objects.
Also, the metabolism in the game is simply ridiculous. It must be increased based on the distance you run. Why not increase it based on your endurance?
This is just what I got after playing for 2 days.
developer_response: Hi there HMSVanguard! We're sorry to see that the new update left you disappointed. You'll be pleased to know that the team has already tweaked the spawning of the hordes, meaning that it should not be an issue anymore. As for the vehicles, we're working to fix as many issues as we can, as soon as we can. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we manage to roll out these fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128200334', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1705973904}
review:
What DayZ could have been. Great map, crafting system is great, you dont starve or thirst to death immediately. No enemies clipping through doors to kill you. 

I do recommend finding a good RP server to play on as it generally gives you a good welcome kit to get started, as well as community to help you learn.

Overall, a very good immersive survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859206419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1703787825}
review:
Game is really tough for the new player, to be honest it wasn't so fun for me in the beginning when I was learning the ropes; I kept failing and ending in fiascos having to start all over again after spending hours and hours on what sometimes felt like going backwards up a steep hill.

There's a LOT to learn and in the beginning you are going to be confused, hurt and most likely fail again and again and you may be left scratching your head asking questions like "how on earth can I do that?!" "how am I supposed to avoid that?!?!?!" "omg I died AGAIN!". 

You can try a community server with massively increased loot and/or with welcome packs or even daily helping packs being able to be claimed; that experience can be more lenient to new players and more or less can hold your hand a little.

But once you get a good grip on how to survive in the game you can certainly enjoy the challenge of surviving and progressing on official servers. 

In fact once you hit 140'ish hours or so you may be starting to feel that it maybe is a little to easy to acquire resources like food, water, weapons etc. Because once you know where they are and have got great experience in effectively and safely combating the "puppets" (zombie type enemies) as well as know how to deal with wounds, you'll be running a surplus of stuff and wont have too much trouble surviving the island. But then there's pvp and the ever continual challenge of amazing more wealth in the form of the games permanent money resource "gold" that will NOT be wiped on server wipes. Every time there's an update servers will wipe off all items and bases. Only thing that will be kept is your character (but not it's gear or inventory) and all your progress for it, be that skill points, attribute points and all of the metabolism stats like amount of muscle and fat on your body. This makes character progression a fun and very long term goal that will persist beyond each update as the game develops. I really like this as it keeps me interested and invested to come back to play.

-------

To help you a little with a very crucial consideration on how to create your character I will suggest you think about what skills to choose for your character. Here is a couple of suggestions:


[h1]BUILD #1 THE REGULAR[/h1] 
3 points in all Attributes: STRENGTH 3, DEXTERITY 3, CONSTITUTION 3, INTELLIGENCE 3. This will allow you to achieve Advanced tier skill level for all skills. 
For Skills I would then suggest: 
[b]Archery to Advanced[/b] (so that you can be very effective with the basic crafted bow and simple wooden arrows which are very easy to make in the beginning, 
[b]Thievery to Advanced[/b] (so that you can lockpick locks much more easily. You can go into police stations in many cities and lockpick their gun lockers and in that way acquire many guns and ammo and all kinds of accessories for them).
[b]Running Medium[/b] (good compromise between extra running speed and still allowing points to assign to Endurance)
[b]Endurance Medium[/b] (Consume less food/water/energy and also have higher max stamina pool and better stamina recovery).
[b]Medical Advanced[/b] (Helps recover from wounds faster, and faster and more effective bandaging of wounds; which can mean the difference between bleeding to death or managing to stop the bleeding when you have only 10% hitpoints left, but at least you live and can recover...!)


[h1]BUILD #2 THE SLICK THIEF[/h1] 
Here's a different idea for an alternative skinny, speedy gonzales, agile character build:
STRENGTH 1, CONSTITUTION 4, DEXTERITY 5, INTELLIGENCE 2. 
[b]Archery midway through Basic[/b]
[b]Thievery to Advanced[/b]
[b]Stealth midway through Medium[/b]
[b]Running skill to Advanced[/b]
[b]Endurance skill halfway through to Basic[/b]
[b]Medical skill halfway through Medium[/b]

(REVIEW BECAME TOO LONG HERE, SEE EXPLANATION FOR BUILD #2 IN THE COMMENTS).

author: {'steamid': '76561198128789679', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5920, 'last_played': 1703501144}
review: Games great dont get me wrong but i would avoid it atm until they fixed what they did in the recent horde update, puppets only spawn  when ur close / in town and respawn every 3-5 minutes. so dont tab out!  and any every puppet that notices you will call in a horde and that process will repeat everytime u come across one. even right after fighting a horde  off. puppet spawns need to be changed back to how it originally was and a new puppet type needs to be added that is the only one that can call for hordes. ( example, the 7d2d screamer )
developer_response: Hi there Soggy! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad run with hordes in the new update, but you'll be pleased to know that we have attended to the exact issue you've mentioned and tweaked the spawn points of the puppets so that they don't spawn near to the player. You'll also be pleased to know that we've provided further balancing of the game by considerably buffing the damage dealt to the puppets with melee weapons, meaning that you will have a much better odds of survival until you get a firearm. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and see if the situation's improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005373607', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3311, 'last_played': 1704673011}
review: This game would be awesome if you had your own server.  Sadly, this company hasn't allowed that.  The servers get hacked a lot and you can lose weeks of stuff.  It makes the game bad when you can't protect your stuff when you aren't online.
developer_response: Hi there SARGE! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad experience with cheaters. We'd like you to know that the team will be implementing better methods of catching and banning cheaters more quickly and efficiently. As for the private servers, we're currently focused on developing the base game and making sure it's feature-complete by its 1.0 full release. However, after that, we'll be more able to talk about additional features such as the ones you've mentioned and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296314148', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11127, 'last_played': 1708294892}
review: I am always excited for every update, maybe this is the one that brings me back and makes me enjoy what was a very beautiful game with in depth mechanics. But with every update this games moves further from the survival part and more to a FPS with survival mechanics just that your character is amazingly fragile. I do love a hardcore survival experience but for me the immersion ends at invincible enemies and invisible hordes which spawn from nowhere. Why give me weapons if MECHs are invincible? Why give me all this survival features if they don't affect my experience or if they do they do it by a a very slight almost non important bit. I believe that instead adding new enemies with every update you could've added a diseases update by now. Also, even if you are a skilled player and you can stealth your way into a bunker with a fresh spawned character and find rare items you sell them for currency which you can't even use, why not? Because of that FP barrier which to me makes no sense whatsoever.
developer_response: Hi there Alecs! We're sorry to see that you feel that the game is steering away from its survival roots. Survival will always be a core pillar of SCUM and all the new features that finding their way into the game serve as elements that bring variation into the overall gameplay experience. As for the hordes, you'll be pleased to know that we've tweaked that system so that puppets don't spawn next to the player. The team is committed towards providing as many improvements and changes to the existing systems and to add as many new and previously featured content as we're nearing the full release of the game and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135065009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5332, 'last_played': 1703028015}
review:
Ich war sehr zufrieden mit dem Game bis zu dem neuem Update jetzt. Einfach alles was man aufgebaut hatte auf dem Server war weg. Monatelange arbeit umsonst! (Ja ich weiÃŸ das es nen Early Access Game ist, trotzdem!)
Und dann noch "Die Horde" In jedem Zombiegame ist es mittlerweile so das sie dich in Massen verfolgen. Ich war froh das es hier nicht so stressig ist. Aber jetzt... Grauenvoll. Viel zu stressig/schwierig geworden das Spiel fÃ¼r mich zumindest. Es macht einfach keinen SpaÃŸ mehr.
Echt schade. Ich habe das Spiel echt gerne gespielt. Jetzt habe ich es wieder deinstalliert und werde es nie wieder anfassen. Das macht mich echt traurig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986932070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1703006218}
review:
[h1] So realistic, playing it is punishment. [/h1]
Perfect for masochists, the gaming version of self-harming. After 3 wipes of Tarkov, I thought i had experience of steep learning curve and challenging gameplay. You spawn in with nothing, every time you die, possibly miles from where you need to be. 20 minutes of running at the beginning of every life, coupled with PUBG grade melee combat makes for an extremely unrewarding time. Wait, the best bit is you only get 10 deaths, then everything you've built up, inch by inch, is gone and you get to start all over! 
I gave it a good solid try because my friends are playing it, but i'd rather insert wooden spikes under my fingernails than suffer through this any more. So glad i got it on sale...
developer_response: Hi The LovelyLimey! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. While the game was always envisioned as a gritty, hardcore survival game, we acknowledge that some things can be tweaked to further enhance the overall experience of the game. The game is still in Early access and there's still a lot that can and will be improved as we'll be nearing the full release of the game. That being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036594890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1708438059}
review:
23h de jeux et j'ai encore tout a apprendre ! 
je sais tout juste craft un couteau, me dÃ©brouiller a manger et a craft un sac a dos, mais petit a petit je prends plaisir notamment a crÃ©er un coffre et l'enterrer quelque part en attendant de m'attaquer aux bases et vÃ©hicules quand j'aurais plus dâ€™expÃ©rience.
Pour les dÃ©butants comme moi il ne faut pas dÃ©sespÃ©rer, le dÃ©but est difficile ( 1er saut j'ai ouvert mon parachute trop tard, 2eme saut j'ai traversÃ© a la nage je me suis fais manger par un requin etc ) mais aprÃ¨s c'est un plaisir, on dÃ©couvre tout ce que le jeu propose est c'est presque dÃ©motivant tellement on sait pas par ou commencer mais il faut tenir bon, c'est en mourant qu'on apprend, et allez sur le discord fr et regardez les tutos youtube, les devs sont a fond sur le jeu et la version 1.0 est actuellement pas encore sorti.
j'ai rÃ©cupÃ©rer mon 1er glock avec chargeur aujourd'hui et je l'ai jouÃ© vendredi 13 aprÃ¨s avoir trouvÃ© une tronÃ§onneuse. j'ai de quoi manger et boire et j'ai un sac randonnÃ©e, comme quoi mÃªme nul comme moi on progresse petit a petit ! excellent jeu que je prÃ©fÃ¨re a Dayz mais ca c'est perso et je trouve que le jeu est mÃ©connu et il faudrait faire de la pub car il est beau agrÃ©able et avec beaucoup de potentiel !

author: {'steamid': '76561198853996625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 77824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 81, 'playtime_at_review': 75422, 'last_played': 1712249591}
review:
I recently changed a negative review to a positive one after some of the horde spawning issues were made more tolerable and the performance issues seemed to have been resolved.

However, after now being able to play the game again I do not recommend it in it's current state.

As is, not recommended. I thought the hunting had been reverted to the old system. It hasn't. It's terrible. You hear an animal, you focus in on the direction and follow it (clues and sound) halfway down a mountain, going South. The next audio cue/clue happens and it's now 180 degrees in the opposite direction, North, back up the mountain. Almost back at the top another audio cue/clue, 180 degrees again, South, back down the mountain FFS! PLEASE, listen to the community and bring back the animals, all of them.

The horde system is way better then at 0.95 release, they at least spawn behind objects now and out of sight, which is still not ideal, we want to clear an area, again, please listen to the community. Many people have also requested a massive roaming horde, this would be awesome, maybe 2 or 3 big roaming hordes at any one time across the map would be amazing.

Some loot-able objects appear to be bugged and will trigger a horde when searched. You can sneak around an entire POI undetected until you search that one box that will trigger a horde and then they coming running to your exact location from very very far away.

This horde system and hunting system cannot be tweaked, they need to go, tweaking will not change what it is, it will only change how it behaves and we don't like what it is or how it behaves.

On a positive note, the way the crafting menu is now organised is great, so much cleaner and easier to navigate and craft stuff. I'm crafting things I would never have given a second thought about. The tips / guides as a new spawn are also very helpful, I learnt about things I never knew about previously.

I am still having fun when I play but the devs are pulling an "Apple" on us, taking things away and making the experience terrible, they then re-introduce the things they took away later but with serious limitations and constraints and we are "happier" because it is way batter than the current state of things - but - it is not what it was originally.
developer_response: Hi there SlutNuts! It was with a heavy heart that we have read your review and we have to say that we are extremely sorry to hear this from a long time fan such as yourself. Some of the points you've brought up are valid and we completely understand your position. Some of the decisions that were made for the game were brought forth as means to preserve the stability and functioning of it. The development has gone for a long time and the ideas that were introduced were always part of that initial vision, but were realized at a later date as time went on and as time for the implementation for some of these ideas came. What we want to emphasize right now is that the team is wholeheartedly committed to delivering the full 1.0 release of the game along with the promised features, and to polish it to the point where virtually all the underlying issues that are present within the game will be gone. With this specific situation with the hordes, we've upheld our reputation for reacting quickly with certain issues by tweaking the horde spawn points so that they spawn further away from the player and have also evened the odds and balanced the combat with the puppets by buffing the damage you do with melee weapons to them. All of this being said, we'd like to thank you for the time you've invested in the game and would love nothing more than to see you return and give the game a chance one more time when we fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024888640', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 15525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12631, 'last_played': 1707127437}
review:
Absolutely terrible. DO NOT TOUCH.

Latest update has broken the game and they will be going forward with this tripe. 18 years and it's still a schoolboy project. Unless you are on a server with settings that you might as well be playing without puppets, or are the first in there, you will NOT get a vehicle, you will NOT live and you will NOT enjoy yourself. Done with this. WAs O K at best 6 months ago, then they took 12x too long to modulize vehicles and now they ruined the game. Puppets run 3x faster than you, so if you attract more than one, its game over. Bushes no longer do anything, they wallhack right through and fixate on your hitbox. Dev does not care, they got their undeserved cash.
developer_response: Hello Iced! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you over the past few months. The game is designed to not shower you with loot, which means that putting together a vehicle is an achievement in itself that is meant to feel rewarding. You will definitely have a harder time putting one together if you are solo, but with a bit of luck and by looking for parts in the right places, it is not impossible to make it yourself. The puppets are quick, but are not impossible to outmaneuver. The leaner ones are fast, but can be quickly dispatched even with early game crafted melee weapons, and the bulkier ones can be outrun. However, we acknowledge that we still have a lot of work to do with optimizing and improving the overall experience of the game, as well as adding numerous content additions that will further elevate the game. While it is unlikely that you'll return based on your harsh words, we'd still like to express our hope that you will give the game another chance once we'll roll out the aforementioned updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561199129206438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1703710323}
review:
[h1] Has Potential, But Is Currently Quite Rough [/h1]


Scum is an open world survival crafting game with a few elements from games like DayZ, Rust, and 7 days to die sprinkled through-out, while still largely being unique. Your diet macros impact your stats, your clothes dry at different speeds, and there are a few other unique mechanics and oddities sprinkled throughout. 

The game is in Alpha, so many if its rougher around the edges condition can be blamed on that and there is a likelihood that it will be fixed in time. But other issues strike me as a fundamental confusion of the Dev's focus. The fact that there is a fully integrated and voice acted 'go to the bathroom' system with particle effects and yet we can not zoom in, pan, or mark the map is something so incredibly bizarre that I actually struggle to put it into words. The fact that any dev time got put into that at all before quality of life features were done is frustrating.

The Character creation is a bit odd, and missing quite a bit. You can choose between male and female, about 8 different base characters with a dozen skin tones and a dozen hairstyles each. The hair has the 'early days unmodded' conan problem of not coloring well and being incredibly ugly regardless of what you choose. You have a few variations of three eye colors to choose from and the ability to adjust your 'iris' for whatever reason (something literally not a soul will notice in world, and is even hard to tell looking at your own character in 3rd person). Also on the odd level, the game does have a genital slider. Which, with nothing else really being customize-able and the differences being mute, feels more like an appeal to horny teenagers going "See, you can have big honkas or a huuuuuuge schlong!", not that either get [i]that[/i] impressive in size.

You have four main stats that give you skillpoints for substats. Many of the substats can be categorized as 'wishful thinking' or non-functional. Items like driving, diving, and flying are exclusively end-game skills that you'll likely have time to train if you're that far ahead anyway, and other skills like 'awareness' don't seem to actually have any impact outside of the PvP stealth mechanic. 

The strangeness continues with your infill method. You are chucked from the sky with your hands bound, your character wriggles free at a certain time regardless of your input and then you can try to direct your landing. The problem is that your time and direction is incredibly minimal and you can't change direction or even slow your descent once your parachute is pulled so at most you'll be avoiding landing on a tree or building. 


Combat is incredibly chunky, for melee at least. Skill appears to make a marginal difference in damage alone, although it claims to add a 'combo' system which, given that you cannot attack in different directions or choose between light and heavy, means that your left click will sometimes thrown an alternate animation, or a second attack, which can often be more harm than a help if it throws off your attack timing with the enemies stagger. Bows were service-able, even the starter one, though the fact that the crosshair goes away when you start pulling the arrow back is incredibly annoying, especially at longer ranges. There also doesn't seem to be any kind of sneak attack or silent take-down to kill undead, and your options, especially early, are incredibly limited and not quite meaningful.

Despite the map being uninteractable, navigation isn't that bad. You get a red dot to show your location on the map, plenty of clear landmarks, and the ability to enter 'focus mode' to see cardinal north. Exploring is a bit less engaging, with crawling into hard to reach places rarely rewarding anything of note, and with many of the buildings devolving into near identical layouts and spreads over time. There's enough variety for moment to moment play, but when you're scavenging for hours and hours, it becomes highly noticeable. Enemies can also spawn randomly in areas you've already cleared and even on the same street as you, so keep an eye on that.

Inventory management is a mess, with half the things that feel like they should be stackable not being stackable, item condition impacting inventory space, and you not being able to store things in the world means that you're back and forth to buried chests. Because your space is so limited and items are so large construction is largely around placing highlighted 'blueprints' of the thing you want to build in the world and then adding ingredients. If you've played Green Hell, it's like that. Which means you are not building any large structures or even a simple hut reasonably. To the point where many players do not bother, relying instead on stashes and simply lean-to shelters if anything. The Dev's know this is a mess and a rework is supposed to be due soon according to the dev blogs. 

Movement is clunky, adjusting speed with the scroll wheel, which given that you only have walk, jog, and sprint, is unnecessary. Arma 3 handles the changing of the crouch height and lean angle in a far better way, with the standard key to toggle walk, key to sprint, and the control + w and S keys to adjust height. The scroll wheel is just an awkward solution in its place. You can't attack while crouched, which is a problem as well when enemies run around the corner while you're trying to sneak. There's no vaulting, though you can sometimes 'step up' onto ledges. There's no sliding or rolling, and given stealth is your best friend and the high energy cost of running, much of your time exploring will be done in low, slow, tedious movements, dragging out the experience.


Items in the world don't update to reflect their status (Opened, has items, looted, etc) visually. And it's all RNG, so you can search an entire corn field and not find a single ear or corn, making food incredibly hard to come by. Supposedly you can hunt but the only animal I ever saw was a bear, who was incredibly aggressive right off the bat and nearly mauled me to death. So food is incredibly scarce and luck dependent and farming is a laughable distant future for the vast majority of the early to mid game. Its also hard to tell what you're looting as sometimes you're looting an individual box and sometimes the whole stack of boxes is one inventory, of which the game could badly use a highlight function to show whats being looted.

Public servers are also super sweat zones. Like Rust had an unholy child with League of Legends levels of toxic, and the above systems sort of guarantee that.

All in all, this game was quite miserable, and not for the reasons I feel like it should be. Luck had an absurd outcome on my runs and with how restrictive the design is the game is quite difficult, but also clunky and tedious. Loot settings can be adjusted on private servers but without mod support my biggest gripes wouldn't be addressed by one. I haven't even talked about the god awful decision to put absurdly short timers on the available minigames, which among other things make cargo drops useless deathtraps, or the worst respawn mechanic and perma-death system I think I've ever seen. 


There are some fantastic ideas here and ones I hope the devs iron out with time but at this current junction I can't really recommend this game to anyone in good conscience.
developer_response: Hi there Eve! First off, we'd like to thank you for the extensive and constructive review that you've left us. We acknowledge that the gripes you've had with certain mechanics in the game are valid and that there a lot that can be improved. As you've mentioned, the game is indeed in Early access and we still have a long road ahead of us to polish and optimize it. Above all, we'd like to thank you for recognizing that the game, despite certain shortcomings, has great potential and we'll do our best to realize it as we're nearing the full release of the game. With all that in mind, we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026494231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 7121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6979, 'last_played': 1702956030}
review:
Buggy mess, can't even start a game because the mouse cursor doesn't align with the menu and you can't click on anything.
Found a work around online but I shouldn't have to look for a fix for an issue that shouldn't even be a thing.

Edit: I wouldn't recommend anyone get this game.
It will never leave Early Acess and the devs put more effort into paid additional content than they do making the game itself playable.
developer_response: Hi there rippl3r0! We're sorry to see that you were experiencing issues with the cursor. It sound like a bug, which is why we hope that you'll contact our support team at https://support.scumgame.com and provide more information on your experience so we can see what we can do about it. We're committed to provide assistance in these matters so we hope that you'll contact us so we can help out and find the source of the issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030462440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 44397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5436, 'playtime_at_review': 6734, 'last_played': 1712469326}
review:
I have owned the game for a while, but had been hesitant to play as it looked 'difficult'.  Finally jumped in a couple of weeks ago and have lived on it ever since haha.  I think it's a great and addictive game.  The new update has upped the scare level a lot.  Especially for us newbies.  I spend a lot more time crouched and sneaking now and my archery is my first priority as soon as I spawn.  
I found my first bicycle yesterday and spent an hour just riding around and looking at things.  I hope I find another one then I will sit on it when I log off to see if I get it back when I start again.   What a great tool.
Highly recommended.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198030930301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1702922106}
review:
One of the slowest paced games Ive ever played, and now that they have added randomly spawning hordes it seems to have become relatively unplayable. You just get swarmed in the middle of the woods for no reason at all, and when you try to return to your body to recollect lost loot, its never there.  

Ark had a similar gameplay loop, but at least it had explorer notes (An underlying story to discover), easier map traversal for its massive map (Via dinos and rafts), and still felt tense without just randomly spawning a group of zombies around you that you cant outrun or defend yourself against making the entire game feel futile.

Some of the systems are cool.  Medical and health tabs for example, but the majority of the game seems to be praying to RNGesus, while waiting for a random spawned horde to take everything from you so you can grind it all out again.  I'll check back later when development progresses.
developer_response: Hey there metaphoenix78! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game. The hordes are no joke and were introduced as a mechanic to additionally enrich the moment-to-moment gameplay. However, we're aware that some aspects of the horde do not function as intended. You'll be pleased to know that some things were already tweaked and that we'll look into ways how we can further improve it. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145374735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1702918462}
developer_response: Hi there Zefnir! We're sorry to see that the latest update made you disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there were certain issues with the horde and you'll be pleased to know that the team has already made some tweaks and is looking to further improve this system. Make sure to always be adequately be prepared when you are going into these horde threat zones and that a tactical retreat is always a viable option and vastly preferable to dying. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance as we'll be further tweaking this system, as well as the rest of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109279302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 136268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125373, 'last_played': 1710590277}
review:
SCUM is most underrated survival game i've ever seen. Dont get me wrong, i am not talkin like this bcs or 2k hours, i have 5k at DayZ also and played too many survival crafting base building theme games. 

Its being beautiful day by day and changes are huge, sometimes u feelin like playing different game.

About hack/cheat, i played almost all the time at officials i see only one time tp hack.

Only problem is server capacities, i think scum is not suitable for more than 40 ppl in one server, more than 40 desyncs being really annoying. Specially full servers having a lot of desync problem, maybe queue system like dayz could help about it but idk, just thinking out loud

author: {'steamid': '76561198096658023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 33557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1024, 'playtime_at_review': 32533, 'last_played': 1712440529}
review:
This game is going downhill and the devs that used to have passion doing great stuff for this game are now just removing items and bringing them back after some time just to keep this game alive!
- Animals removed.
- broken zombie spawn system that you would literally see zombies drop right infront of you!
- empty map with useless areas!
- everyone on the map looks the same!
- loot system is beanies, beanies and more beanies that are all the same color!
- base building that makes no sense!
- Tractors, quad bike, harely davidson bike, water plan, police cars, SUV... all got removed!

This game will be deserted after 1.0 since stupid DLCs are being added to a game that is 20% finished and most features are buggy or broken. This is not the game it used to be, even on sale I would hold off purchasing untill the game stares back to the proper survival aspect it used to be/was headed for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113051215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 163331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'playtime_at_review': 112219, 'last_played': 1711968685}
review:
[b]I will preface this review by not mentioning game bugs as I am aware that I am participating in an Alpha game, as among other things stated in the loading notes.[/b]

I have been playing since January 2020 and have seen this game evolve, starting with the inclusion of the first vehicles, to boats, fishing, motorcycles, planes, cooking, and so on.
I purposely waited for 0.95 before writing a review, accumulating 1800+ hours of play, because I wanted to follow the development of the game, but more so to understand the mindset and approach of the Dev Team towards the game itself, the community, and to understand the way they fix bugs or problems caused by an update, or by the unanticipated behavior of players in the community.

It is unfortunate to have to give it a negative rating because the game itself deserves it, it is feature-rich, it has a nice graphical compartment all the more so now that the graphical optimizations have been made.
What makes it bad for the player experience, however, is the way certain things are first added, and then removed or changed to such an extent that they are unusable.

The most egregious examples are the planes, first included in 0.7, modified afterwards and made unusable, and then made to disappear until 0.9.
During 0.9 the same planes were found to have several problems with maneuverability from the ground, later solved in 0.95.
Another example of vehicles inserted and then removed are quads, other bikes, and craftable boats.

Instead, I dwell on one of the last features inserted, namely the abandoned bunkers.
This I think is the most striking example of a fantastic feature, inserted at the right time and truly innovative, but ruined soon after.
During this phase, an update was released that prevents dragging crates if they turn out to be too heavy.
At the same time the loot inside the bunker was nerfed, and all because it was not intended that players could do this action.
(Two lines of script would have sufficed to prevent crates or wheelbarrows from entering the bunker.)
Nevertheless, we continued to play and support the work of the Dev team.

Now, with 0.95, you have managed to render useless one of the nicest things you have ever implemented.
And I am not referring to the bugs obviously present at this stage of development, I am referring to the fact that instead of thinking about how to curb a problem, you prefer to ruin the experience of the rest of the community.

Abandoned bunkers are currently unplayable on servers with Vanilla Settings and with one player inside the bunker, where even if you stand still without moving and without producing any noise, the spawn of zombies increases, as well as suicide zombies increase, which in my opinion should not have been placed inside these bunkers, already complicated in itself with their operation.
The chances of entering an abandoned bunker, looting levels 1 and 2, and getting out alive are close to 0 even if you play in stealth mode, with katana and silenced compound bow, and a skilled character.

I repeat: the game has a lot of potential, but the player experience is literally being ruined by a lack of problem-solving ability on the part of management, which then spills over to the entire community.

The community already turns out to be small, and rather than making it even smaller, you should focus on not letting your players get away.
Personally, I am grateful for all the features implemented, however, I would have preferred to have them in a longer time frame, but working and with a criteria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367707225', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1630531191}
review: The last time I played this game it was a fucking mess. Most of the store page videos are ultra retarded. Maybe spend more time on the game and less time producing lame story line, ass videos and bad soap operas with movie line hacks and you will have an epic game.Spend the money on programmers instead of buying music rights for advertising.
developer_response: Hi Crashdive007! We're sorry that you've found the trailers to be misleading. Their function is purely for setting the tone of the game and for showcasing its features that are contextualized within the overarching story of the game that we'll be able to talk about more after the 1.0 release of the game. Also, the trailers are done by our talented in-house animators that have done a fantastic job with it, meaning that additional resources on our part were not invested in this. As for the game, while we're nearing the full release of the game, we acknowledge that there's still a lot to do with all the improvements and content additions that we need to do and we hope that you'll give us another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199561793854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 53541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23966, 'last_played': 1706719643}
review: I didnt like the puppets before the horde update and they just keep making them worse and worse. i dont find it fun when i go to even the smallest farm and get attacked by 10 zombies every time. After you kill the puppets they just respawn and you have to do it again. if you go somewhere where there arent puppets, you will get to the middle of the area then all of a sudden the puppets spawn all around you. i dont think the puppets or mechs are fun and its at the point where i dont want to play. another thing that is irritating me is that the developers want you to pay for all the basic things that should already be in the game. for example, if you want more than like 4 character customization choices then you need to buy a pack. if you want to spray paint your guns or cars a different design or if you want your character to be able to dance then its gonna cost you extra. Its not okay. this is not The Sims. I am not paying extra for things that should be included already and the fact that were expected to spend extra to get basic cosmetics to me is extremely greedy and unacceptable.
developer_response: Hi there fumlakakno! We're sorry to see that the bugs you've encountered have diminished your experience with the game. If you've encountered something that greatly breaks your enjoyment of the game, we'd be overjoyed to hear about it so we can fix it as soon as possible. If you would be so kind, you can report them via our support system at https://support.scumgame.com/ and we'll make sure to swiftly take care of it. The game is still in Early access and we'll make great effort to polish the game as much as we can as we'll be nearing the full release and we hope that you'll give us another chance when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145290113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1536989249}
review: Let me know whenever someone makes a mod that kills 70% of the realism that 70% of the players would appreciate. Honestly, its too much. Its like trying to live your life as an adult with your grandma constantly nagging in you in your back seat. "Dont forget to stay hydrated, oh wait, I noticed that you have a scrape on your knee, you should probably have that looked at, speaking of which how are your potassium levels..". I played this for a very short bit when it was first released a few years ago, and with so much of the game leaning on the boring aspect of the apocalyptic dystopi , survival. It just kills the fun factor. There seems to be a huge disconnect with game devs and customers. It seems so simple to us, we want something well rounded. Base building without having to have an engineering degree, staying alive by eating random non rotten food, not having to make sure my blood sugar levels are okay or not. It seems like the people who make these games (which we all have really high hopes) are made by fringe gamers. They have extreme takes on existing titles instead of expanding on a fun, great working formula. Its not what you want, its what the customers want. And the customers want something straight forward, easy learning curve and that has longevity. Daz Mod had the perfect basic layout, and yet everyone else since than has to add their own wacky twist that nobody asked for. Its like the loudest voices are never the majority. Hopefully a future game dev is reading this and will finally understand and make something F U N!
developer_response:
Hi there He11 Hammer! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write such an extensive review.

The realism you speak of was actually one of the draws of the game that led me to it, as a gamer first. It's a difficult thing to balance out in game dev, while still having the fun factor to it. The whole metabolism system you mentioned is still a main draw for players, and no other game has one like it, we're proud of that one. Still, it gets tested out thoroughly with every new feature and has seen QOL changes to it numerous times.
One of our top priorities is to balance out features so that they complement each other, that's why we depend on valuable player feedback up to the 1.0 release and beyond.

With the 0.95 update released, we're getting close to the polish phase where we'll seriously revisit all features in need of rebalancing and tune the hell out of them. 
But, these tiny improvements actually happen on a daily basis, through in-office communication and playtesting of the game.

While I do agree that a great existing formula is a good basis, we wanted to make our own special take on the whole genre and leave our own mark. 
We also believe that a game has to be fun, it's one of our top priorities and while it's also true that it's impossible to please everyone, our goal is to make the game more accessible to newcomers which is why we've added the CODEX in 0.95. A tutorial system which explains in-depth the features of SCUM.
A CODEX that will be also be expanded with 1.0 and beyond. 
We hope you'll give the game another chance and perhaps change your mind.
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1705373982}
review:
This game is a Chore, A Job and very tedious overly complicated massive freaking headache. Im glad i got it on sale for 19 cause Steam wont refund me cause I went over 2 hours.
So much about this game is Not Fun but is tedious Work. I play games to have Fun. I understand making it challenging but when it forces you to have to do everything in the most tedious ways and it takes sometimes 10 seconds or more more craft something or eat something and then having to go to the bathroom. I do that in real life and its like ok. that adds nothing fun to the game having to take a piss. also when your searching for Items you will Hit 9 empty for every one that has something.
Im not looking for this much realism. It makes it not fun anymore.
and there is no need for it. 
I mean if someone tried to make an actual survival game based on actual realism . Literally nobody would play it because it would take you all day to Cut down one tree and then Cut it into usable planks. with hours of sawing. 
Games can have some of them but it has to be balanced .
many games strike that balance nicely . Gathering materials , crafting , hunting , eating and drinking and surviving then building a base and the need for protection from elements.
this game to me is way to much of a grind for me. i wish i could get a refund because im sick of it already.





...Just please make the game Fun. Stop going for so much realism and make it fun. Looting empto container after empty container is not Fun. getting hand ebrasions for crafting and looting is not Fun, and about 100 other things. I play games to have Fun. and this game is WAY WAY overly complicated. you need to simplify it and make it accessable , with more loot , a smaller map , a less comp;icated looting and suvival system and let people get in a craft and then have encounters with other players. thats how your going attract a large player base.



(UPDATE) JUST SEARCHED OVER 200 CONTAINERS AND BOXES. 95% EMPTY. 
JUST A BIG EMPTY GAME WITH EMPTY LOOT. THIS IS SUCH TOTAL CRAP. O AND ITS JAN 5TH AND CHRISTMAS STILL HASNT ENDED APPERENTY. DEVS HAVE NO TIME TO REMOVE THE HOLIDAY PATCH I GUESS.  ALSO THIS GAME ISNT FINISHED AND YET THEY ARE RELEASING DLC THAT YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR. THATS A SERIOUS PROBLEM. THIS MIGHT BE FUN THE FIRST TIME PLAY. BUT AFTER YOU HAVE TO START A 4RTH AND 5TH CHARECTER AND THEN START SEARCHING EMPTY CONTAINERA AGAIN FOR HOURS AND HOURS. NOT FUN FOR LONG. I WISH THE DEVS WOULD STOP SMOKING CRACK OR WHATEVER THEY ARE DOING AND DO SOMETHING WITH THIS COLLOSAL PEACE OF CRAP.
developer_response:
Hi there Gunden_Reaver! 
First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
We're sorry you're unhappy with the game. 

It's an eternal struggle to find a perfect ratio between fun & realism. 
We agree that games should be, first and foremost, fun. That's why we discuss player reviews on a daily basis. 
Having said that, that realism is a draw for many players.
Since the game is still in early access, player feedback is valuable to us. 
With the 0.95 update we introduced the CODEX, an in-depth tutorial system of the various mechanics found in SCUM. 

And we're still working on balancing everything out, small QOL changes happen on a daily basis via in-office communication and playtesting of the game. 
Also, we're getting closer to the polishing phase where we'll revisit all the feature in need of balancing and tune the hell out of them. 

Hopefully, you'll give the game a chance again and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028392027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1704398538}
review:
A mix between zomboid and dayZ in theory, It's just dayZ with more status bars in practice. Not recommended unless you have a group to play with. Gameplay typically comes down to three decisions.
1. High risk. Go to a military loot zone and possibly get insane gear if you can dodge the mechs
2. Mid risk. Go to a police station and pvp for pistols or shotguns
3. low risk. Loot towns and pray you find a hunting rifle, if they even spawn there. I'm not sure because I've never seen one pop up even in high loot servers.

Despite the fancy nutrition bars, this is the typical gameplay loop, and it gets mind numbingly boring fast. Although the screenshots might give you the mental image of a co-operative survival colony builder (and this is possible with a large group of friends), with an emphasis well being and nutrition, as well as character development, It plays no different than DayZ, Tarkov, or PUBG in practice. It's just your standard every man for himself kill on sight free for all. If that's what you're looking for (with the added nutrition bars) then this might be for you.
developer_response:
Hi there Robzilla!

Thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
We appreciate the feedback and, as you're aware, we are still in early access so a lot of changes are still coming to the game. 
I believe your change your mind about the gameplay loop when you check out what's coming with 1.0 release. Armed NPC's, missions, a whole of stuff on a very long list. 
Also, with the 0.95 update out, we're closer to the polish phase. That means that all features will be revisited and rebalanced if needed. 
We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

Hello there Kodak_27! 
It's still the same 55 people working on the game just like before the merger. 
Losing your progress/wipes are normal in early access game, and we are still in early access until we release 1.0. 
Server performance has actually never been better 0.95.
That doesn't mean we're making excuses. We've set high goals for 1.0 and a lot of features will be revisited and rebalanced in order to deliver the best game we possibly can. 
We hope you revisit the game then and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964356884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1535950179}
review:
After years of watching it develop, I can only assume the game devs havent played their own game in years.
There is no aspect of quality of life, and it only gets worse over time. The "puppet" update was the final nail needed to assure the game is sealed. Their official response to complaints is to "play private servers". This says everything you need to know.

I held onto hope as long as I could because of the fishing, but, it is no longer viable with the direction of the main game.
developer_response: Hi probablyfishing! We're sorry to see that the latest update made you lose faith in the game and that some of our responses felt tone deaf. As time went on after the patch and we got our bearings of the situation at hand with the help and feedback from our community, we've found that the majority of the problems stem from the inadequate spawning of hordes which show up way to close to the player. We'd like to emphasize and reassure that the team is looking into ways to make this right and to improve this mechanic as much as we can. Our team definitely has their ears to the ground when it comes to community feedback, but its a balancing act between time, resources and priorities, and we try to do our best in that regard. We hope that this clarifies the situation a bit and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we roll out these changes and fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075308231', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 22013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22013, 'last_played': 1702662336}
review:
This game started as a great idea. And through the growing pains it became a really fun game for both the PvP players and those who wanted to just do survival. The cooking update made life a little better and the game a little more realistic.... then the last update dropped. Now, before I get into the latest update (December 2023) lets go back just a little bit and talk about another brilliant idea that caused a stir and was basically played off as a "Oh well" by the devs. For a survival game where food is scarce, loot is scarce, and has a full metabolism simulation.... they removed animals. Yeah, they removed animals and made hunting a "Mini game" where you "follow the noise" and try to get an animal to spawn in. Except for Wolves and Bears of course which are just there to ruin your day. Deer, birds, etc.... nope. Follow the noise that you cant follow without directional headphones and hope you can maybe get it to spawn.

Now for the newest update.... The brilliant minds who had the thought "Lets lighten the load on our overburdened servers" came up with the idea of removing the puppet AI (Zombies basically) and put in a horde system! Well that is great, now we will have wandering hordes of these mind control chipped zombie things that we will have to worry about and watch for right? Bahahahahhahahaha no..... They removed (yet again) world spawns of the puppets (just like animals) to save resources for servers.... and now you get a group that spawn in directly around you when you make a noise! Not a "Hey they spawned in a couple hundred meters away".... no, in the building you are in and possibly already cleared, within 50 meters of you in the open.... yeah. They took about 500 steps forward as the game came closer to the 1.0 release (full game release) and this update shows someone convinced them to sprint backwards like a real world zombie horde was running at the leadership who make the call on this decision. An amazing game, the absolute ground breaking survival game which requires players to watch their own body functions and intakes just to live while trying not to die to other inmates (players) or puppets (zombies) has become an absolute disaster. Then to add insult to injury, moderators (non devs, but moderators for the forums) calling people toxic for not liking the update and voicing their concerns! Oh boy, I do hope they revert these extremely poor decisions (doubtful considering their history) but if they dont, I guess it will continue to become yet another great idea which has turned to garbage because of the decisions of a few who think their ideas are great yet dont listen to the community when the positive reactions are ratio'd into oblivion by the absolute disgust.
developer_response: Hi there BatWingSix! First off, thank you for the extensive review and for voicing your opinion on the game. The criticism regarding puppets spawning randomly near you is fair and valid, and you'll be pleased to know that the team is looking into ways to mitigate and fix that issue which will greatly balance the difficulty of the hordes and make them more organic. As for the servers, we've done extensive optimizations on that part which enabled us to have these hordes without sacrificing the stability and performance of the servers and we'll make more of those as we'll be nearing the full release of the game. We're getting nearer and nearer to the final release of the game, but there's still a lot to do on our part to make the experience as complete and smooth as possible, which is why we hope that you'll give the game at least one more chance when we get this sorted out.

developer_response: Hi there catdaddyjackson! We're sorry to see that you were experiencing connectivity issues and that this impeded your enjoyment of the game. Usually, the issue with connecting and disconnecting is tied to the game being installed on an HDD instead of an SSD, which is listed as required even under the minimum requirements. If that is not the case, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/  who will do everything they can to assist you with the issue you are experiencing. With hate to lose our players to something that can be attended to which is why we truly hope you'll contact us so we can help you out.

developer_response: Hi iToXicSLi! Thank you for the kind words and sorry that you were disappointed with the lack of loot. While the loot is not abundant by design as the game in its vision leans towards a hardcore survival with elements of realism, it is entirely possible that the spot you were looting was emptied by another player just before you got there. For better loot, we advise that you try looting the military or abandoned bunkers, as well as POI's that are scattered through the map. Just make sure you prepare yourself with some basic gear. We hope that this will help you with your time in the game and that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981547380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 46225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6974, 'playtime_at_review': 44842, 'last_played': 1712474829}
review:
Started with early access v.95, horrible experience, but most things were resolved. Dev listens to community for the most part. 733 hours later, I have more time in this survival game than Valheim, Project Zomboid, Minecraft, combined.  So, what keeps me coming back? It's the variety of activities and server settings, private and official, that scratch the survival instinct. Game play can go days in tranquility, peppered with moments of high dose of adrenaline rush, of my own choosing.

If you are easily irritated by inconveniences, this game or any survival game, is not for you.  You can be part of the solution by reporting issues or research. If you like learning on the fly and figuring things out, this game have tons to keep you motivated.  But, you gotta know how to set goals, then figure out how to achieve them.  Here's a Rocky speech to get you through the rough part "...something you already know. The world ainâ€™t all sunshine and rainbows. Itâ€™s a very mean and nasty place and I donâ€™t care how tough you are it will beat you to your knees and keep you there permanently if you let it. You, me, or nobody is gonna hit as hard as life. But it ainâ€™t about how hard ya hit. Itâ€™s about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward. How much you can take and keep moving forward. Thatâ€™s how winning is done! Now if you know what youâ€™re worth then go out and get what youâ€™re worth. But ya gotta be willing to take the hits, and not pointing fingers saying you ainâ€™t where you wanna be because of him, or her, or anybody! Cowards do that and that ainâ€™t you!...until you start believing in yourself, ya ainâ€™t gonna have a life.â€œ -Sly
developer_response: Hi there insomniac! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game. While the game has some underlying issues, the team is committed to fixing them as soon as possible and before we hit the 1.0 release and we hope that yo'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930492098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1713, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1712497326}
review:
If you're a fan of DayZ, you'll enjoy it. this game is pretty complicated and takes a decent learning curve. It has pretty hardcore survival elements and is more in-depth than other games in the genre I've played. There's dozens of servers to pick from (like ARK), and some have special modifiers. 

A couple of my problems with the games, I'm not sure if it's server settings but the enemy spawns are a problem. I'll be clearing out a bunker, only to find that the way that I cleared has enemies who already respawned. Sometimes the the enemies are glitchy and float around in the area. Like most games in this genre, you can spend hours wandering around to try and find items. I have 8 hours in this game and I have yet to find another player. I play on servers that have increase loot, but yet there's hardly any loot. 

This game is a real barebones survival and is unforgiving. If you enjoy DayZ, ARK, and others, give it a shot, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971918441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 592453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585275, 'last_played': 1711112488}
review: This game was good when it first came out. Then it became a great game.  Now it started to go down hill since the hunting & cooking update, I play it in real time, so now it takes 16 minutes to cook something. This last update they took out the wild puppets & indoor puppets. For the single player there is no reason to find a rifle & scope because the puppets spawn within 40 yards of you. They had a great game going now they are just messing it up. Please don't get  on my case about the hours I have on this game . I'm 63 & disabled, so play this game all the time. I hope they listen what I have said & make the changes back to the way it was. Don't mind the horde update because you can shut it off
developer_response:
Hi Fizznor! Thank you for reaching out, we appreciate the support! 
Would you mind going into a little more detail? 
We would love to hear your feedback because we realize it takes a awhile to get used to a new feature, change in the way how a mechanics works. We're trying to help bridge that gap.
One of the reasons we added the codex/tutorial is because of the sheer number of things you have to keep track of. SCUM is a challenging game, that's for sure. 
The new horde system also brings a necessary change in tactics when trying to loot a POI (point of interest). 
So a lot of people are simply still adjusting to the new mechanics and were building reports to see what works and what doesn't. 
We would love to hear any additional thoughts you might have and, hopefully, you'll give the game another chance and perhaps change your mind.
