author: {'steamid': '76561197971705493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 37548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 29448, 'last_played': 1712285502}
review: After years of early access the game still has bad gunplay, bad melee, and the good aspects of the game are getting worse with each patch. Since the dev now sold out and more and more dlc is released, I dont have much hope left for this game.
developer_response: Hi there oni! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you. We're not sure what you are referring to in terms of bad gunplay, but some aspects such as melee can definitely be improved and we'll see what we can do with that as we're nearing the full release. We're also not sure what you are referring to with features of the game getting worse over time as the team is making great progress with some aspects, for instance the crafting system which is now more intuitive than ever before. As for the DLCs, they are completely optional and cosmetic-only, and they do not detract us from focusing on the game. We completely respect your opinion, but wanted to provide some clarification on some of the things you've mentioned and we hope that it clears it up a bit. There's still a lot of work on our part that awaits us as we're nearing the end of our Early access journey and we hope that you'll give the game another chance when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990725997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 7829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7829, 'last_played': 1662732646}
review:
As much as I love the mechanics and work that went into scum, i simply can not recommend games (especially in EA) that try to gouge money via DLC  from people before completing their product. Again, that is just being nice about it saying it's only in EA, but it sucks even in released versions. I love the game, but simply refuse to support such a business model.

Edit: The DLC's ARE optional and purely for cosmetic reasons, but the game is still in EA when these things are out there simply to make money before it is released; however I have no reason to believe this game will be abandoned, it has been in EA a long time (it's quite ambitious of a project). I have switched to positive due to the sake of my love for the game as a whole.
developer_response:
Hi OP! Thank you for your words of support! 
We do have to mention, however, that DLC's are entirely optional and are here purely for a cosmetic/character personalization/roleplay reason. 
None of in-game features are influenced by the DLC's in any way but cosmetic.
There's also a TON of stuff to do in the game that has absolutely no connections to the DLC's. 
Again, thank you for your support, we really hope you'll give the game a chance again and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138223074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 4088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2121, 'last_played': 1710518571}
review: This is the best survival game I've played so far... Lot of actions, places, weapons, gear, the stats system is good but it takes time to level them up. The community I've been playing on is just amazing and so fun to play with. Bunkers are scary. Immersion is fantastic! Anyways... Its a really good game, don't give up if you play it for the first time, watch some guides, and you will be pretty much ready for anything! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198387588472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7780, 'last_played': 1702807867}
review: game loot feels lack luster its still in early access but pumping out dlc i can get behind skins and dance emotes but when the devs put stuff that should be in character create in the dlc store $10 AUD. horde is broken not fun at all. it will spawn puppets out of thin air to make a horde it looks cheap and feels rushed. the puppets can hear you clearly from some distance away then scream and like magic puppets will spawn in plain sight to. almost 130 hours in this game and went from loving the idea of this game loading it up to see how its progressing to feeling underwhelmed with my  purchase . the hand to hand combat feels sluggish still not sure what happened to the cars or animals on the map but seem to gone still no npc
developer_response: Hi there hazmatt187! Thank you kindly for the extensive review. We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the new update. We acknowledge the criticism related to horde spawning. The team is looking into it and will make some changes to the way they appear on the map. We'll make sure to adjust that so that it doesn't feel cheap and unfair to the player and make it more organic. Hand to hand combat is something that will definitely be improved eventually and the missing vehicles that were removed from the game will be making a return when we conduct necessary optimizations. As for the DLC's, they are completely optional, cosmetic-only, do not influence gameplay and do not impede the team from creating necessary updates, fixes and additions to the game. With them, our community is enabling us to deliver on the vision that the game promises. All that being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another shot as we're nearing its full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198841500452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164775, 'last_played': 1702802754}
review:
I've been playing this game for a few years now, since about 0.2 if I remember right.  I've seen things come and go, and although I realise it's Early Access the development of side content rather than addressing some of the basic mechanics has been problematic at times.  I was very excited to have cars come, then more types of vehicles, then they got removed, and only 2 types of very bugged car were available.  There have been a number of fun additions, like new points of interest, but some of them (like the nuclear plant) have me disappointed.  I'm also an avid S.T.A.L.K.E.R. fan and it honestly seems like they were wanting to wrap that into the ever-creeping scope of the game.  And it destroyed one of my favorite corners of the map, I loved having a base up by the now-gone campground.
I've still kept playing, even with not being interested in the new bunker mutants or the broken fishing process.  However, with the 0.95 release I am finally out.  It has been uninstalled, and I have left the island.  I was here for a survival game and what was, in its original dynamic (and from what I could tell, intent) a survival game with zombies mixed in until real NPC interaction could happen in future updates.  In its dynamic now it appears to be headed more for a zombie game with some survival around them.  Walking through the forest I have a puppet appear 8 feet in front of me, and so I fight it.  Another one hears it, screams for backup, and within 15 seconds I'm dead.  Respawn, and it drops me right North of the nuclear plant, which is toxic without gear.
Speaking of gear, I did buy supporter packs 1 and 2 when they came out but there now seems to be many DLC packs for a game that is still in progress.  Given the cool features that have been introduced then taken away I'm not keen on spending more money on something that might get deleted at some point.
I'm sure there are many who love this game, and if you do, fill your boots.  As for me, I'm finally off the island.
developer_response:
Hello there OP. Thank you for taking the time to write this review and reaching out to us. 
We realize you've been playing for a long time and you've seen a lot of changes come to SCUM. 
Those changes were made with the best intentions and in keeping with our ultimate goal -> to make the 1.0 release the best it can be. 
With a team of only 55 people, making a game this ambitious means that sometimes some features have to take a back seat in order to finish up the high-priority ones. 
But, now that we're past 0.95 we will focus on adding some very important features along with polishing the game, so it will be in the best possible state when it releases with 1.0. 

This game was always planned as a survival game with Zombie (puppets) NPC's. 
And yes, the horde system drastically changes the way you play and we understand that it takes people some time to get used to ti. 
But also, this could be your opportunity for a fresh start, try a different tactic with the puppets. 

Having said all that, once we're in the polishing phase, that's when we'll revisit every single feature and do what we can to make them work even better.
We're sorry to hear you'll be leaving the Island, hopefully you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

review: Am Anfang stand SCUM mit einer Idee da, die gefiel. Gefangener auf einer Halbinsel, und versuchen zu Ã¼berleben. Das gelang selbst als Solospieler auf einem PVP Server. Mittlerweile ist es fÃ¼r Solospieler kaum noch spielbar, spÃ¤testens nach dem jetzigen Update. Einst ging es in dem Game darum, einen Weg zu finden, die Halbinsel zu verlassen. Dieses Ziel wurde meiner Meinung nach mit den vielen aufkommenden Updates aus den Augen verloren. Jetzt ist es nur noch ein gewÃ¶hnliches, wie bereits viele andere Games auch, ein Zombie Game. TÃ¶te die Zombies, bevor sie es tun. Wo bitte ist der Fokus auf das eigentliche Ziel das Games? Mir zeigen die Updates, dass der Fokus nur noch darauf ausgelegt ist, dass man mit mehreren Leuten zusammen in einem Clan sein muss, alleine Ã¼berleben - aussichtslos. FÃ¼r mich ist der Punkt nach mehr als 1200 Stunden erreicht, mich komplett aus dem Game zu verabschieden.

review: Multiplayer does not work on linux
developer_response: Hello Fork Q! We're sorry to see that the lack of Linux support has diminished your opinion of the game. The team is currently focused on bringing the game to its full 1.0 version and exiting Early access. Once we get there, we'll be more equipped to talk about additional features such as Linux support. Until then, we hope you'll reconsider and give the game another chance as we'll be rolling out new features and improvements across the board.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214675632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1704339267}
review: This is a really BAD game. From the obtuse controls to the lack of any inventory management you will constantly be trying to figure out WTF is going on. With the latest update (0.95) nothing on YT or in the manual matches the game so there is no help available. Other than a very narrow group of  hard core players this mess is not worth the time. It will never appeal to 99.9% of gamers and will ultimately die off for lack of support from the developers as there will not be enough revenue to continue. With all of the survival games available this stinker needs to be avoided!
developer_response: Hey there stephen.schuld! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. Once you parachute onto the island, you are left to fend for yourself and one of the first thing that you need to attain is greater inventory capacity. You can do this either by finding a backpack somewhere in the world or you can very easily craft an improvised courier backpack that will help you out until you find better clothes and equipment which will enable you to carry more stuff. The default clothes you start with does not provide a lot of inventory space and you cannot rely on it. There are still things that are in need of improvement and we are aware that we still have a lot of work to be done as we're still in Early access. While we're aware that, based on your words, it is unlikely that you'll return to the game, but we hope that eventually you'll give it another shot once we fully release the game.

review:
Booted the game.
Made a dude with a micro penis.
Sky dived into the map whilst handcuffed.
Cut up my underwear for cloth.
Made a bag.
Ate a mushroom because I was hungry.
[b] [i] Mushroom was poisonous unbeknown to me [/i] [/b]...
Killed a zombie/puppet and looted a few houses.
[b] Felt positive about my situation [/b].
Realised I was slowly dying due to mushroom poisoning.
Notice I have diarrhoea. 
Proceed to shit all over my trousers and shoes. 
Get really confused about how to resolve this. 
[b] Wished I had that underwear from before[/b]...
Literally shit myself to death in a bush. 

11/10

4x mit einem Steinspeer in den Kopf gestoÃŸen und die stehen immer noch (meist 6x bei den dicken).

developer_response: Hi Zoolot! We're sorry to see that you did not enjoy the game. We acknowledge that there are still a lot of things that can be improved and that are missing from the game, but we'd like to emphasize that the team is really committed to addressing the major complaints that the community has pointed out and to making the game as awesome of a hardcore survival experience as it can be. We're still in Early access and we can't wait to to bring about all the planned improvements and content additions, and fully release it. We hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

review: The update actually makes the game GREAT FOR PVE and most negative reviews come from PvP players, there is a game already out there for them(CoD, BF, Fortnite) so I don't understand why they'd stick to SCUM. I used to hate the game for its complexity but once I got the hang of it? I LOVE IT NOW. Also bought the DLC packs to support the devs I just wish they add a HELICOPTER someday. I wouldn't mind funding that.
developer_response: Hi CrazyBlueDog.exe! This sounds like a bug and thank you for letting us know about it. The game is still in Early access and there still a lot that we have to do with audio improvements by the time we'll be fully releasing the game. We hope that this will not discourage you from the game and that you will give it a second chance.

Trotz anfÃ¤nglicher Schwierigkeiten und gelegentlicher technischer Probleme bleibt es fÃ¼r mich das MaÃŸ aller Dinge in der Welt der Survival-Spiele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094860933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18583, 'last_played': 1708787294}
review: UPDATE: i love that the devs are really looking into players feedback. it really means a lot especially for someone who dwells in the game everyday. Thank you for fixing the horde system, its much better now compared to when it launched first day. Of course, more works need to be done for a few small bugs in the game but im sure they are looking into it. Like how the reverse lights in cars are draining the car battery, how sometimes things just disappear when you put it in your hand, and how cooking timer sometimes disappear and you need to switch between ui tabs to fix it. fortunately, things are getting better and i hope to see more improvement moving forward. keep up the great work devs!
developer_response:
Hello OP and thank you for reaching out. 
The Horde is a new mechanic and we are looking for player feedback so we can determine the best way to balance it out. We've had some reports about unrealistic puppet spawns, the team is aware of this and we're doing our best to resolve the issue. 
Having said that, it was intentional that the horde changes your play style drastically, it does require a much more careful/stealthier approach. 
Like all things, it takes a while for players to get used to the new mechanic and we're confident that after a little rebalancing with a little player feedback, the hordes will be much more managable. 
We hope you'll revisit the game (we have a ton of stuff coming in 1.0) and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280294355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 74157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73011, 'last_played': 1710770615}
developer_response: Hi there Szabla! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the new update - especially someone that has invested so much time in the game. While we don't know what exactly made you dissatisfied (whether it's the hordes themselves or an issue that popped up for you), we'd like to point out that we're still in Early access and that things are still subject to modification and tweaking. If you want leave us with any constructive feedback, we'd love to hear it. You can leave it here https://support.scumgame.com/ or here if you find it more convenient. If you encountered any issue, we'd also love to hear about it so we can fix it as soon as possible. All that being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually and that we'll hear from you. We'd really hate to lose an avid supporter of the game like yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970362408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 39244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38308, 'last_played': 1704975951}
review:
So, 638 hours in right now. Played allot of DayZ and moved over to SCUM because of the graphics and the "more in depth" health system.

This game is something different. Its hardcore survival at its finest and did not see many games like this. The devs release updates regularly and if they make a booboo they will instand hot fix patch stuff. 

In short some key points about this game:

Zombies, allot of them ( since last patch ) HOARDS!!
Base building
Advanced health system aka eat shitty food, get fat, get slow, get eaten or killed by other players
Fancy weapons from melee to bows to assault rifles, pistols or just crowbar some brains out
Customise weapons by adding scopes, suppressors, new paint etc
Multiple biomes with multiple styles of game play ( aka snow = warm clothes needed, coastal region is warm so less clothes )
Exploring the beautiful country side, finding old bunkers ( WO2 ) or newer once ( and the abandonment once... spooky )
Crafting ( bows, spears, improvised weapons )

So if you dont want to play the average shooter like COD and want to go more in dept survival / zombie / shooter, SCUM is a good one to grab!

author: {'steamid': '76561198410046280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 106186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106186, 'last_played': 1700300016}
review: perfect example of a game that adds too many useless functions SCUM used to be a really fun pvp game before base building, repairing vehicles and sickness me and my friends played official servers and RIP to .51 but now official servers are unplayable join a official server and withing 10 mins (if lucky) a hacker will hunt you down and kill you even on a server with a population of 1 LOL pathetic too many bugs to count the devs are really toxic was banned from the scum discord for calling a dev out after they trolled and mocked a person that bought the game to support them and kept crashing and was in the discord asking for any help game is on 0.95 and missing a shit ton of features they promised the zombies are broken and this game has no future RIP to scum dont buy this game if you dont want to be sick or hurt from 1000 different things this game gets 2 thumbs down LMFAO what a joke it has become :(
developer_response:
OP, thank you for reaching out to to us.
Could you go into a little more detail? We would love to hear more from someone who's obviously been playing for a while. 
Base building was a "planned from the beginning", very requested feature and we've ironed a LOT of kinks that players were mentioning, and a LOT more optimizations and improvements are coming before we release of 1.0. That infamous naval base was built with the old base-building system, and it was only possible on a private server with no base building restrictions. That cannot happen on a official server due to the sheer number of bb elements and the new modular system.

Also, the "sicknesses" you're referring to are "infections" in game if I'm not mistaken, and they were added for extra realism. 
In real life, infections are not treated lightly and untreated infections can sometimes lead to serious, life-threatening condition like sepsis. Just like we've added in the game. Your immune system will fight off a couple of small infections by itself, but when the strain on it is too great (meaning, more infections than it can handle), your body will start feeling it and you need to find some antibiotics. 

We would also like to know of this case where the dev was toxic and they trolled and mocked a guy asking for help. When did this happen? 
Again, we would love to hear your detailed feedback. 
Hopefully, you'll give the game a chance again and perhaps change your mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963029157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 67950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67950, 'last_played': 1702604169}
review:
[h1]do NOT buy this game if you want a Survival game like 7 days 2 die / DayZ.. 
this game is HEAVILY based on [b][u]Realism[/u][/b] and more of a [b]Simulator[/b] then a game.[/h1]

[h2]Pro[/h2]
Big map
Graphics
Weaponry
Boob jiggle physics!!

[h2]Con[/h2]
Realism
Simulator
Micro-managing skills
Over complicated character stats
Buggy Character stats
You VS WORLD system
Immortal Bosses
Broken PVP system (has been for years.)
Broken Merchants.
Infinite Merchant goods
Unbalanced prices (Buy and Sell (buy something at 35k, sell the same item, same quality,  get 10k)
and much much more
developer_response: Hi å…é™¤ã™ã‚‹! Thank you for contacting us and leaving your review. We're sorry to see that the game is not to your liking. SCUM is indeed envisioned as a hardcore survival experience that leans on realism, but we've made sure to accommodate our game for players that may not prefer these settings. That is why we've enabled private servers where players can modify a slew of settings to cater to their own needs and preferences. We'd like to invite you to try some of them with hopes that you will give us another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079421487', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5132, 'last_played': 1704171803}
review: The game is still being updated and the updates are decent
developer_response:
Hi there OP and thank you reaching out to us. 
The Horde is a new mechanic that is supposed to drastically change the way you approach clearing out a town, and forces you to change your strategy. 
Like all new things, it takes some time for players to get used to it.
That being said, there are reports of strange puppet spawns, our team is aware of it and working on resolving this issue. 
Since it's such a new mechanic that REALLY changes the game, player feedback is very important to us so that we can further balance out the feature. 
Thanks again for supporting us, we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037692245', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23775, 'last_played': 1678506167}
review:
Le jeu a commencÃ© il y a des annÃ©es de cela comme un survival tout Ã  fait basique, mais Ã  force de travail et de temps, les dÃ©veloppeurs ont su ajouter et polish toutes les features qui manquent le plus souvent aux jeux de survie.

Le systÃ¨me de mÃ©tabolisme avec une gestion des maladies et de l'alimentation Ã©quilibrÃ©e et rÃ©aliste, de maÃ®trises des compÃ©tences poussÃ© avec des rÃ©percussions bien prÃ©cises pour chaque domaine, un systÃ¨me de base building simple mais fonctionnel, un feeling bien particulier pour chaque arme avec des alÃ©as comme de l'enrayement, une carte grande et travaillÃ©e qui Ã©volue avec le temps, une mÃ©canique de survie mÃ©langeant mÃ©cha et zombie intÃ©ressante et qui a Ã©voluÃ© des deux cotÃ©s avec des mÃ©chas plus dangereux et des hordes de zombies et surement encore bien d'autres choses que j'oublie. 

Si je devais trouver un point faible au jeu, ce serait qu'il peut Ãªtre difficile pour un nÃ©ophyte des jeux de survie d'y trouver ses repÃ¨res et que le plaisir de jeu laisse place Ã  une frustration et une recherche constante de rations ou de soins.

En bref, je suis d'avis que toute personne qui a apprÃ©ciÃ© un dayZ ou un The Forest tombera fou amoureux de SCUM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198848976756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1700824534}
review:
"SCUM" is undeniably on the verge of greatness, offering a survival gaming experience that's both ambitious and promising. However, despite its potential, the game falls short in certain key areas, preventing it from reaching the heights it aspires to achieve.

One of the standout aspects of SCUM is its intricate and detailed survival mechanics. The game boasts an impressive level of realism, from managing hunger and hydration to monitoring metabolism and physical attributes. The depth of these mechanics adds an immersive layer to the survival genre, promising a gameplay experience that rewards careful planning and strategic decision-making.

Moreover, the game's open-world environment is expansive and visually stunning. The diverse landscapes and dynamic weather systems create an atmospheric setting that draws players into its immersive world.

However, where SCUM falters is in the execution of its ambitious vision. Despite the richness of its survival mechanics, the game struggles with balancing and optimization. Some systems feel overly complex and convoluted, deterring players from fully engaging with all the intricacies the game has to offer.

Additionally, the performance issues and technical glitches hinder the overall experience. From frequent crashes to server instability, these issues disrupt the immersion and gameplay flow, frustrating players who want to fully immerse themselves in the game's world.

Furthermore, while SCUM's potential for engaging PvP encounters and teamwork is evident, the lack of player-driven narratives or meaningful endgame content diminishes the longevity and replayability. The absence of compelling goals or narrative arcs beyond survival challenges leaves a sense of aimlessness in the gameplay loop.

In summary, SCUM showcases a wealth of potential and ambition in the survival gaming genre. Its detailed survival mechanics and immersive world lay a strong foundation for a standout experience. However, the game is held back by technical issues, balancing problems, and a lack of compelling endgame content, preventing it from realizing its full potential and leaving players wanting more to truly elevate it to greatness.

review:
0.95 was the update this game needed.

especially if you haven't played the prior patches. This game is in a great spot performance wise and the zombies are actually entertaining finally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074361922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1702663474}
review:
Loot, die, respawn, loot, die. You finally manage to kill those annoying zombies around you, yay, you just treated your bleeding, yay, zombies spawn around you again, you die. You try to jump in the water in the hopes they can't swim: they can't! they run in the water and still hit you, while your weak character swims with -100 speed. Congratulations, you died again.

You found good items? Nice, too bad you don't have enough space.

Zombies teleporting, zombies outrunning you on bicycle. Did the devs not try their own game?
developer_response: Hi there Potatopooper! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. The puppets do indeed die eventually when they get into the water, but it takes a couple of until they suffocate. As for the hordes, we're aware of the issue of their spawning and you'll be pleased to know that we've tweaked the distance where they spawn so that they don't do it near you. We've also balanced things out by increasing the damage dealt to puppets with melee weapons. As for the inventory space, the base clothes that you have will not be enough until you find something better. We recommend that you craft an improvised courier backpack that will help you with inventory until you find better clothes and backpacks. All that being said, we'd like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and that we still have a lot of work with improving the game and adding additional features and content. We really hope that you'll give the game another try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001413769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1702586121}
review:
Another DayZ clone and not a very good one.

Graphics are the only thing this game has going for it.
Animations are goofy and Zombies just go through walls exactly like in DayZ.

Refunded.
developer_response: Hello Classicsniper00! We're sorry to see that the game did not live up to your expectations. We respect your decision to refund the game and would like to thank you for trying it out. While we're still in Early access, the team is hard at work to roll out as many fixes, improvements and updates to existing systems, as well as bring much -needed content additions that will further elevate the experience of the game. While it is highly unlikely, we hope you'll consider giving the game another chance as we'll be exiting Early access and fully releasing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065046437', 'num_games_owned': 2296, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1702891501}
review:
It was some night at 3 am, my friend and I found ourselves separated. Eventually we met up and headed out together on the search for cars. Navigating the terrain we eventually found a factory, before we even entered about six zombies materialized from thin air and swarmed us. We won the battle but at what cost, wounded and infected we climbed a nearby hunting post and took off clothes off and rested. My friend quickly realized we would probably die, so he fed me a ton of tuna and pasta to try and keep me alive. That didn't work out so we walked a far distance to his hidden cache, we stored our loot and then walked off into the ocean and drowned ourselves. Shortly after respawning my friends game crashed, we quit for the night.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199176869161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 67267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 588, 'playtime_at_review': 60363, 'last_played': 1712492458}
review: 1000+ and loved it befor 0.95 not its just not fun you have to fight to do anything at all, you hit anything driving your gonna die the bunkers are now locked down and hords are too much and to top it all when you die its a 50/50 if you can get your things back IF you can even make it back to your body, you put so much time in just to lose it in a flash so if you want a game that will pay off this is not it some loser will pop shit you and take everything ,,,,DEVS LET US DOWN!
developer_response:
Hi OP, thank you for taking the time to write this review.
We're sorry you're unhappy with the game, but we are still in early access so a lot of stuff is subject to change until we release 1.0 and after it, because SCUM will be supported for a long time to come. 
That being said, we are aware of player dissatisfaction with certain aspects of the horde system (uneven puppet spawning) and the team is looking into it as we speak.
The horde is a new mechanic and it does drastically change the way you would approach a POI as well as make you adjust your tactics to adapt to the situation. As a new mechanic, we depend on valuable player feedback such as yours to improve it and balance it out! 
For any other bugs you may have encountered, please visit https://support.scumgame.com/ 
and open a new ticket. Some from our team will get back to you as soon as possible. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074209166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1705722193}
review:
Editing Review

There have been some patches since the horde update and I noticed that one specifically addressed "fixed puppets spawning around the player when they shouldn't" and decided to try it out with a friend.

So far I've managed to survive for a few days in the game, get some decent loot and have a few encounters that were very terrifying, but survivable. My friend did not survive the one horde we encountered, and unfortunately his body despawned because he had to choose between dropping across the map or suicide and dropping closer to his body.

I am playing on a PVE server, since the threat from players is honestly more than I can handle. I would rather make friends than enemies. 

Things I like:
1. It is challenging.
2. Some changes seem to have been made on infection status, and it doesn't seem to be inevitable from every injury anymore. For example, you can sometimes use regular rags to heal injuries and not get sick immediately.
3. The environment looks really nice, shifting light patterns from clouds keep things dynamic.
4. The ability to stash some money and use that to respawn in a specific zone on death is useful, once you can prepare for it.
5. The updated crafting system is easier to use than before and has come a long way in one update. 
6. There are helpful tips that randomly pop up at the right times. 

Things I don't like:
1. AND THIS IS A BIG ONE...Melee doesn't feel like it works. I can be standing directly in front of a puppet, and with my reticle over it's face swing at it and nothing happens. I know that this game "enforces" your skill tree, such as when things that you "shouldn't be able to see" might be visible in 3rd person, you still won't see them. Is melee like this as well? When I am swinging is there a % chance to hit? If so, this just feels broken and is very unsatisfying. If I hit it, I should hit it. Right now, If I can't run away I have to find a roof and pray that the puppet won't randomly teleport on top of it. 
2. Sometimes puppets come at you from absolutely nowhere, and for seemingly no reason, despite moving at a snail pace while crouched. Stealth seems to be meaningless. Though this is improved somewhat since the last time I played, just not to a point that I feel is realistic. The puppets are like stupid ninjas who immediately know where you are, are able to vault through windows like parkour enthusiasts and just generally have more skill than an animated dead person seems like they should.
3. Unlike DayZ, puppets make very little sound when just lurking around so it's possible to just walk into them out of nowhere. I appreciate what this adds to the game, but I think some balancing needs to be done. 
4. The rain effects are disappointing and I would love to see some attention paid to them. It could add a lot of ambiance to the game and that would be great.
5. Player body should stick around longer on death. 
6. Some of the crafting recipes don't work correctly, and it is not clear what some of them are asking for. 
7. Auto-Equiping gear on pick-up should be optional. I have lost a few items because I'm double clicking to pick things up and suddenly my good shirt is on the ground and I'm wearing garbage.

The developers seem to have reacted quickly to complaints about the horde, and the game is playable at this point, though I think it still has a lot to balance out before being officially released. The dev response is commendable, and hopefully will continue.
developer_response:
Hi there OP and thanks for taking the time to write this review. 

The Horde is a new feature, we're still collecting player input about it. 
What I can tell you is that hordes drastically change the way you have to approach clearing a POI. Stealthy approach is the way to go, you really have to take your time and be aware of anything that can go wrong. The rooftops are your best friend at the moment since puppets can break down doors and jump through windows now!

That being said, we've had some reports of improbable puppet spawn locations and we're looking into it. 
For the time being, as I've said, we're collecting reports and feedback from the community and we're going to do our best to balance it out in the best way possible.  

We thank you for your kind words and we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032689401', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1702606388}
review:
Honestly wish I refunded this as it seems to have just gotten worse with patches. Long story short this is a C potentially even B tier game with so many QoL issues dragging it down it feels more like F Tier.

Spawning in is slow and tedious with no way to manipulate the speed of the parachute once it has been opened.
The (broken) quests they had when I first started that guided you through the basic mechanics are gone, now you have to look through an ingame manual because quests are hard apparently.

The animations across the board are a joke, as you statically parachute down with no motion in you or the parachute, zombies glide across the ground like its 2002. Player movement speed is controled by the mousewheel, yet there seems to be only 3 speeds, walk, run, sprint (Aka attract every zombie in 40 feet regardless of line of site to come slide attack you to death) either add more speed increments like tarkov, or don't copy tarkov.

The inventory system though is by far my biggest issue, your inventory slots are determined by your clothing, this means when you drop you have, a half full 2x2 storage with 2 slots used by a credit card, and pants with an empty 2x4 storage capacity, you might also be lucky enough to spawn in a cold area which nets you a hoodie with actual F capacity, but lets assume you didn't get that lucky. You'll need a knife, thats 2x4 and it can't be equipped into a holster slot to free up capacity even though you'll literally always want a knife on you. You now have 2 slots, which is only enough for extremely small items (Money, needles,etc), clothing degrades so don't get hit before getting real clothing otherwise you wont be able to carry that knife anymore.

This game has good features, character, skill, health and vehicle systems on their own aren't bad and have a lot of potential, the problem is first 1-2 hours of this game are a slog at a minimum and anyone who thinks that this is "close" to a 1.0 is insane, unless they somehow pack in a few hundred QoL changes, New Zombie AI and new animations, I can't imagine anything being enough to look like an actual 1.0, unless it's a No Man's Sky style of 1.0 where that actually means 0.1,0 Beta.
developer_response: Hello Death-RtH! Fistly, we'd like to thank you for taking the time to write this extensive review and voicing your opinion. We acknowledge that some of the elements that you've mentioned are due for sprucing up and are in need of improvement. As for the inventory system, base clothing that you have on yourself as you parachute down on the island is not designed to be a viable source of inventory space and you need to either find or craft backpacks that will serve you until you find more and more items that will allow greater inventory spaces. We recommend that when you start the game, you craft an improvised courier bag that will serve you well until you find something more adequate. Also, bags and clothes can be repaired, meaning that you can restore their capacity if they get damaged. Regardless, we'd like to emphasize that we still have a lot of work to be done until the full release of the game and that we'll further improve upon it until we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088362497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7204, 'last_played': 1703282629}
review: Game was amazing until this horde update, now its not remotely enjoyable and way too fucking hard.
developer_response: Hi there Gay Assault Charges! We're sorry to see that you are not enjoying the new patch. The idea behind the horde is to create an additional layer of challenge and to make the player even more cautious when exploring the island. Since the puppets are substantially more hostile and dangerous than before, a modified approach towards encounters with them is necessary. Regardless, we understand that a part of our community does not prefer to play with these additions, so we'd like to recommend that you try out private servers where hordes are turned off and the number of puppets is regulated. That being said, we'd like to express our hope that you give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320670218', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2963, 'last_played': 1703149648}
review: waste of computer space and years of devolpment. Game eats your storage for no reason while offering very little when it updates. 20 gig update took almost an hour and added what seems to be alot of WIP and only QOL and UI updates, not sure why you need to eat my storage to add 4 things into the game and not fixing anything else. absolutely mad you expect people to have 100 gigs of storage for this game that is on a good day a quarter of the way finished.
developer_response: Hi there Bambustuff! We're sorry to see that the file size of the game made you disappointed with it. The patch included more than just quality of life updates as there were many other additions that affected the file size of the patch. You'll be pleased to know that the game is not far from finished and that we are inching away from the full release of the game. There are still substantial content additions that we need to make, and we cannot say for sure how large the last download will be, but we'll be making a lot of optimizations for the full release of the game which may impact the file size. All that being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually and that you'll enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058770423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3451, 'last_played': 1703265592}
review:
Amazing game, really had fun in it. 0.95 kinda killed it for me.
It might be an amazing update for the hardcore players out there & the bored veterans.

But for me, I love survival games, building bases and having fun engaging zombies, bigger cities with the risk of pvp.

The zombies still glitch out way too much to explain an update like this, but now.. instead of 2-3 glitching zombies you can somehow cheese to balance it out, you got endless spawning zombies that tear you down, while you barely can hit most of them because they're so stupidly bouncy/glitchy all over the place.

For people who like a hardcore experience, its a great game. For me as a casual who likes the balance of pve and pvp. - this update was the end for me. / Hopefully they adjust it in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561199195586531', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14304, 'last_played': 1710310059}
review: After the latest update, I cannot enjoy the game without a team. Because puppets multiply, every time I kill 10, 10 more come to me. the game is unbalanced. How could the Solo player kill so these crowds of puppets ? I do not recommend buying the game if you do not have friends to help you and after 200 hours of playing, my story with scum is over.
developer_response: Hi there YASUO! We're sorry to see that you are not enjoying the new update. We acknowledge that solo players may have a harder time with the hordes. Fighting them head on if you're not adequately geared is a surefire way to the afterlife. We'd like to recommend that, if you encounter a horde, that you make a tactical retreat and wait for the situation to die down. On the other hand, you can try playing on private servers where settings for puppets are regulated and their numbers are reduced. Regardless, even though we are very close to release, we still have a lot to do and a lot of improvements and content to add which will also make the game even better and we hope that you'll give it at least one more chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102772987', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1701994376}
review:
TL;DR- Scum is like a modded DayZ server that has added things you may or may not want in your survival game. 

Overall it's a more "gamey" version of DayZ. Don't let that fool you into thinking it's any less complex. The survival mechanics are deep and very deadly.

There's live traders with a full in game economy, a mini-map, mechs that patrol the high tier loot. Think the same general gameplay loop of DayZ but a totally different vibe. The island feels more alive, there's more things going on than the imposing cold, dead feel of DayZ. And the player interactions are a little bit different because you can spawn anywhere in Scum, so anywhere on the map you could run into someone super geared or a fresh spawn and everything in between, as opposed to the general fresh spawns being huddled on the coast in the south.  

Overall I like it and do recommend it but if I had to choose just one I would still go DayZ because of the overall feel of the game. Things that I think Scum has going for it are better graphics, more fleshed out and better crafting and building with it's own UI, and better(?) zombie AI. It has a bright future with constant development being done.

Also there is no mod support as of my writing this review, but I understand it is coming one day, which may be the final nudge I need to get off of DayZ.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964894094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8083, 'last_played': 1703460674}
review:
I have been playing this game on and off through the various updates. 
I have only played it PvE with friends, and we have always opted to rent a server and tweak the settings to make the puppets more numerous and harder. While this is more of a PvP focused title i do believe this is up with the best survival simulation experiences i have had. Especially with friends. 

Climbing the survival ladder, growing stronger, finding vehicles, and finding a spot to build an outpost is all done very well in my opinion. I wish the animals worked better, but we never eeeeeever see deer or boars or the likes anymore. We can spawn them, but hunting animals for food is simply a no go, wich is a real shame. 

As we edge ever closer to 1.0 release i see vast improvements since i started playing at day one.
Looking forward to giving another real go at 1.0!

review:
FÃ¼r mich ist SCUM im Grunde ein wirklich tolles Spiel. Immer mal wieder schaue ich mir den Fortschritt des Early Access an. Doch leider verliere ich immer zum selben Zeitpunkt vÃ¶llig die Lust. Man lootet sich langsam hoch. KÃ¤mpft nicht nur mit Zombies sondern auch mit Hunger und Durst. Soweit alles fein. Doch so vorsichtig man auch ist. Irgendwann wird man doch von mehreren Zombies Ã¼berrascht. Und das ist was mich so vÃ¶llig nervt: Ich finde meine AusrÃ¼stung nicht wieder. Es wird einem ja nicht angezeigt. Man spawnt neu, irgendwo am anderen Ende der Karte. Rennt in das Dorf in dem man gestorben ist. Und das wars. Alles weg weil man nicht weiÃŸ wo man gestorben ist.
Sorry SCUM, ich bin fein mit dem RealitÃ¤tsaspekt beim Essen, Trinken, etc. aber das verdirbt den SpielspaÃŸ. Gebt den Spielern doch die Option es selber zu entscheiden. Ich wÃ¼rde mich freuen die Weiterempfehlung auf positiv zu Ã¤ndern. Danke

author: {'steamid': '76561198046777933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1702564881}
review:
I really like this game and the realism aspect, but it goes way too far with the realism in some situations to be fun. In my specific situation, it was the inventory damage system. I spent hours making a bag and also found a jacket that offered me significantly more inventory space, I was stoked. Then a couple zombies hit me a few times and now all of my inventory has been damaged and I can't put items into most of the spaces because it is blocked off due to the damage to the bag and jacket. 

I wouldn't have even been in this mess if it wasn't for the fact that you DROP YOUR WEAPON WITHOUT WARNING if you do ANYTHING that requires your hands and you don't have an open equipment slot. 

Now I am not the one to leave feedback without offering a solution. so, please add a system that makes it so you don't put down items without warning. name a game where you drop items without hitting the specific button intended to do so? I would prefer to hold the item and be told I need to drop something, rather than losing what I have.

For the inventory damage, PLEASE slow down the amount of damage done to clothing or remove it completely. Zombies don't use weapons so why are they able to rip through my Thick winter coat like the hulk rips off that rag.
developer_response: Hi there Speshul! First off, we'd like to thank you kindly for the extensive and informative review and express our regret that you found the game disappointing. However, there are some things that were mentioned that we want to additionally clarify. Based on the situation you've described, it seems that you've picked the ''Take in hands'' option which resulted in you dropping the item because you did not have enough space in your inventory. Usually, when you have an item in your hands and want to take an item from your inventory, the items will swap if you have enough space for the item that is in your hands. The situation that occurred for you is specific, but not illogical or unrealistic. As for the clothing damage done by puppets, it all depends on the type of zombie that hit you (bigger, meatier ones do more damage) and the type of clothes you had on you. You'll be pleased to know that you can fix your clothes by crafting an improvised sewing kit which restores the capacity of your bags and clothes if they get damaged. Regardless, the game is still in Early access and there are a lot of things that will be tweaked as we'll be nearing the full release of the game, which is why we hope you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561199146647326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1702545815}
review: Run around, find nothing of any use. Get killed by puppets. Open eleventy hundred cupboards and boxes, find some nails, some gloves and a hat. Run over the whole map, find nothing, try to defend as best as possible with sticks. Eventually die. Try again, find ammo for guns that don't exist, have some more fights with puppets, clothes and backpacks fall apart, can't carry anything. Youtubers spend 5 minutes and have assault rifles, grenades, cars etc etc. I never even seen anything other than rocks and sticks and some worn out clothes.
developer_response: Hi there gleese1973, we're sorry to see that you found the update to be disappointing. We'd like to point our from the get-go that the influencer event was specially designed to focus on showcasing the new features in the game. More sophisticated loot can be found in dangerous areas such as abandoned bunkers and killboxes as our intention is not to shower the player with items as we believe that they should come as a reward for completing something challenging. You don't have to run with sticks as you can basically immediately after you land on the island craft axes and bows that are (while rudimentary) far more efficient at dispatching puppets. If you prefer to receive many items, you can also try playing the game on private servers that have modified loot settings. We acknowledge that lots of our players prefer the game this way and we have accommodated to their need by enabling these settings. All this being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance and find enjoyment in it.

developer_response: Hi there Texmexquisite! We're sorry to see that you've had disappointing run in the game. The loot system and the overall game, as it is currently set up, caters towards hardcore survival enthusiasts as the game is envisioned in such a way. The game is still in Early access and there's still a lot that we have to do as we're nearing the full release of it. In fact, the upcoming patch will be addressing the loot drops in the official servers which should make it more rewarding in that sense. Alternatively, you can try playing on private servers where loot drops are modified in a way where loot drops are increased. All this being said, we hope that you'll give the game one more chance and that you'll find more enjoyment in your future playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561199506542665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1702503240}
review: You make the graphics look so good in all of the advertisements and screen shots, this game looks like crap when you actually play it..DayZ is a way better game in all aspects. And your additional DLC is very annoying, you'd be better off just opening this game up to the modding community, you might at least draw some more interest. The zombies look horrible too, nothing like the previews I've seen you dump out. I'm guessing you've put more time into the previews and screen shots to get people to buy than you've actually put into making your game. Not even worth the %50 off price that I bought it for, c ya.
developer_response: Hey Dino! Sorry to see that you've found our marketing materials to be misleading. This was not our intention in the slightest. We'd like to emphasize that the game is still a work in progress since we're in Early access and we still have a lot of work ahead of us with bringing much needed improvements and content additions to it. We know that we're not perfect, but we have a lot of great things in our game that we're proud of. But this does not mean that we will become complacent. We acknowledge the criticism and we'll make sure to address it as much as we can as we're nearing the full release of the game. Even though you've express thorough dissatisfaction with it, we hope that you'll give it one more chance when we fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143387961', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 20599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20243, 'last_played': 1702737193}
review:
Qu'est-ce que SCUM avant tout ? SCUM se dÃ©roule sur l'Ã®le de Bagne, une Ã®le fictive utilisÃ©e comme lieu d'exÃ©cution de condamnÃ©s dans un programme de tÃ©lÃ©rÃ©alitÃ© futuriste. Les prisonniers sont Ã©quipÃ©s de dispositifs de surveillance avancÃ©s et sont forcÃ©s de participer Ã  des Ã©preuves de survie brutales diffusÃ©es Ã  la tÃ©lÃ©vision. L'objectif ultime est de divertir les spectateurs et de permettre aux dÃ©tenus de gagner leur libertÃ© en survivant dans des conditions extrÃªmes, que ce soit face Ã  d'autres joueurs ou Ã  des menaces environnementales comme TEC-1, une organisation militaire.

La survie est un aspect crucial de SCUM donc dans un premier temps, et le jeu se distingue par sa profondeur et sa complexitÃ© dans ce domaine comparÃ© Ã  d'autre sans pour autant Ãªtre trop invasif.
[list]
[b]Nourriture et Hydratation :[/b] Les joueurs doivent constamment gÃ©rer leur faim et leur soif. Trouver, chasser et cuisiner de la nourriture est essentiel pour maintenir la santÃ© de votre personnage. Ca reste la base de tout jeu de survie, mais ici, vous ne devez pas simplement vous nourrir avec n'importe quoi et tout redevient normal. Un systÃ¨me de digestion, de temps d'assimilation des calorie, de dÃ©pense des calories selon les activitÃ©s prend en compte votre faÃ§on de subvenir Ã  vos besoins les plus Ã©lÃ©mentaires.
[/list]

[list]
[b]MÃ©tabolisme AvancÃ© :[/b] SCUM propose un systÃ¨me de mÃ©tabolisme dÃ©taillÃ©, oÃ¹ les joueurs doivent surveiller l'apport en nutriments, les calories, les protÃ©ines, etc. Un rÃ©gime Ã©quilibrÃ© est nÃ©cessaire pour maintenir les performances optimales du personnage. Que cela soit les bases de l'alimentations comme les lipides, glucides, matiÃ¨res grasses etc ... Jusqu'aux vitamines, tout est prit en compte afin que les stats de votre personnage soit au top ! Cela peut toutefois devenir vite anecdotique.
[/list]

[list]
[b]SantÃ© :[/b] Le jeu simule divers aspects de la santÃ©, y compris les blessures, les maladies et les infections. Les joueurs doivent trouver des mÃ©dicaments, des bandages et d'autres fournitures mÃ©dicales pour rester en bonne santÃ©. Donc vous devrez soigner divers blessures et infection. RÃ©cemment, les dÃ©veloppeur ont confirmÃ© l'ajout des maladie suivant l'environnement et nos actions comme une grippes par exemple.
[/list]

[list]
[b]Environnement Dynamique :[/b] Les conditions mÃ©tÃ©orologiques, les tempÃ©ratures et les saisons changent, impactant directement la survie. Les joueurs doivent s'adapter aux diffÃ©rentes situations climatiques suivant oÃ¹ ils se trouvent. Vous vous habillerait diffÃ©remment, vous trouverez des ressources diffÃ©rentes, ect.
[/list]

[list]
[b]Construction et Artisanat :[/b] Les joueurs peuvent construire des abris temporaires, fabriquer des outils et des armes Ã  partir de matÃ©riaux trouvÃ©s dans le monde. Mais au fur et Ã  mesure de votre expÃ©rience, les crafts se compliqueront et vous pourrez bÃ¢tir de vÃ©ritable forteresse comme dans Rust ! En plus rÃ©aliste et complexe. Je dirais qu'il manque l'ajout de systÃ¨me Ã©lectrique mais l'avenir pourrait nous surprendre, nous avons eu rÃ©cemment l'ajout des gÃ©nÃ©rateur Ã©lectrique pour divers Ã©quipements.
[/list]

[list]
[b]Interaction avec l'environnement :[/b] La chasse dans le jeu donnent pas mal d'atout au joueurs surtout au dÃ©but, et celle-ci rend le jeu plus immersif quand Ã  la possibilitÃ© de pister l'animal au son et aux indices, un peu comme dans Hunter.
[/list]

[list]
[b]Menaces Environnementales et IA :[/b] Comme dans tout jeu de survie, vous avez l'aspect PVP qui reprÃ©sente un vÃ©ritable danger. De plus, l'environnement lui-mÃªme peut s'avÃ©rer pÃ©rilleux, car mÃªme si les zombies de base sont assez simples, quelques-uns qui vous attaquent suffisent Ã  vous tuer. Autant dire qu'il ne faut pas sous-estimer ces derniers, surtout si votre endurance est faible. En plus de cela, certaines zones Ã  haut loot sont gardÃ©es par des MÃ©cas, sortes de robots bipÃ¨des protÃ©geant les zones et n'hÃ©sitant pas Ã  rÃ©agir violemment Ã  votre prÃ©sence (lance-flammes, roquettes, mitrailleuses, fusils, grenades fumigÃ¨nes et lacrymogÃ¨nes). Enfin, d'autres crÃ©atures plus redoutables vous attendent dans les bunkers abandonnÃ©s, anciens sous-terrains appartenant Ã  TEC-1 qui abritent aujourd'hui des crÃ©atures redoutables.
[/list]

Ce n'est lÃ  que les bases du jeu, je ne peut Ã©videmment pas tout mettre en avant comme la variÃ©tÃ© de la carte assez grandes, la constante mise Ã  jours des dev du jeu qui apporte sont lot de nouvelles mÃ©caniques, ou la minuties dans le dÃ©tail de beaucoup d'objet tant sur l'utilisation que les effets.

Bien sur, le jeu Ã  ses dÃ©fauts.
[list]
[b]Courbe d'apprentissage :[/b] SCUM Ã  une courbe d'apprentissage abrupte, en particulier pour ceux qui ne sont pas habituÃ©s aux jeux de survie complexes. La gestion dÃ©taillÃ©e du mÃ©tabolisme et d'autres aspects peut Ãªtre intimidante pour les nouveaux venus. On peut vite se retrouver perdu en pleine nature sans savoir quoi faire. Un tuto Ã©tait prÃ©sent avant pour n'avoir ne serait-ce que les bases qui Ã  aujourd'hui disparu.
[/list]

[list]
[b]Manque de Contenu PvE :[/b] AprÃ¨s un long moment, vous commencerait Ã  trouver le contenue peut Ãªtre redondants. Ils font beaucoup d'effort en vrai, comme l'ajout de la centrale nuclÃ©aire ou bien des bunker abandonnÃ© avec les nouveaux Z. Mais une fois les mÃ©caniques comprises, le challenges disparait. Cependant, une mise Ã  jour dÃ©voilÃ© par les Dev qui arrivera bientÃ´t, ajoutera de nouveaux Meca. Ce point nÃ©gatif est Ã  prendre avec des pincettes, car l'ajout de contenue dans ce jeu est trÃ¨s prÃ©sent.
[/list]

[list]
[b]AccÃ¨s AnticipÃ© :[/b] Comme SCUM est en accÃ¨s anticipÃ©, et je trouve cela... moyen. Cela fait longtemps que le jeu est disponible sur la plateforme, et il a Ã©tÃ© maintenu Ã©normÃ©ment. Il est stable, fonctionne trÃ¨s bien, permet aux configurations modestes de jouer aussi, moyennant des graphismes plus bas ou un DLSS trÃ¨s prÃ©sent. Cependant, le jeu semble encore se cacher derriÃ¨re le bouclier de "Je suis en accÃ¨s anticipÃ©, donc je peux me permettre d'avoir des problÃ¨mes, ce n'est pas grave".
[/list]

Au final, SCUM offre une expÃ©rience de survie en monde ouvert profonde et immersive qui se distingue par son approche rÃ©aliste de la survie. Avec un systÃ¨me de mÃ©tabolisme avancÃ©, des aspects de santÃ© dÃ©taillÃ©s, et un environnement dynamique, le jeu propose aux joueurs une simulation riche et complexe. La variÃ©tÃ© des activitÃ©s, de la chasse Ã  la construction, en passant par l'exploration PVE et le lore, permet une grande libertÃ© d'approche pour la survie.

Cependant, il est important de noter que SCUM n'est pas exempt de dÃ©fauts, comme mentionnÃ© prÃ©cÃ©demment.

MalgrÃ© ces inconvÃ©nients, SCUM parvient Ã  offrir une expÃ©rience unique aux amateurs de jeux de survie en quÃªte d'un dÃ©fi rÃ©aliste. Les mises Ã  jour frÃ©quentes tÃ©moignent de l'engagement des dÃ©veloppeurs Ã  amÃ©liorer et Ã  Ã©tendre le jeu. Si vous Ãªtes prÃªt Ã  surmonter la courbe d'apprentissage initiale et Ã  patienter pour des amÃ©liorations continues, SCUM peut offrir une expÃ©rience de survie captivante avec des Ã©lÃ©ments de gameplay complexes et une immersion notable, surpassant de loin bon nombre de jeux de survie connus Ã  ce jour.

Nous avons ici des dÃ©veloppeurs passionnÃ©s par leur jeu, Ã  la diffÃ©rence d'un certain The Day Before.

En bref, je recommande ce jeu qui est un pur plaisir Ã  jouer avec des amis ou simplement seul.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065846206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1702432642}
review: Bought it when it first came out to early access years ago, was able to play just fine. Understandably they added alot since then. When to try and play today, kept getting connection lost when trying to play an a official server. when looking online to see the issue it seems to be an issue that exists since 2018? In steam forums their support sugested to have the gave on a SSD, I did that and still persists. The bad part is that they says it is a PC issue, which I doubt and that to be working on IT is lazy solution. My PC is new and handles the new releases just fine. Dont recommend it.
developer_response: Hi there ReapersAAA! We're very sorry to see that you are experiencing issues with the game. While a lack of an installed SSD is the main cause of the problem, there are some other things that may cause it. We'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to help you with alleviating this issue. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something that can be fixable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067501226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5190, 'last_played': 1694688528}
review:
With the update 0.95 things are looking better. The inventory looks a lot cleaner, with quick pick options to what u would like to craft on the go now. Its quick and easy to look at, but things are still a little too small to identify for new players. The crafting items are just too small to identify with ease for new players, u almost have to question ur self - if the item u would like to craft - is what u are looking at. Of course we are neat picking here, but it is important to mention this small but rather annoying flaw that new players will encounter. 
Things are coming along nicely with this latest update to Scum, it is a fun open world survival game - that in my opinion is somewhat over done when it comes to character (Health, metabolic rate and well being) 
But if u would like a game that goes in to deep detail on such gaming parameters, then Scum is for u. 

I will start naming some of the Scum features that i think need to be added to the game, in order to make the game more realistic and immersive. 

- Fix the character movement, it is too robotic and snappy at the moment. The movement has to be more fluid and life like. 
- Get rid of the wall that is present along the map, its very unsightly - can i call it ugly? Make the map in to an island all 
  around would be a better option. More beautiful beaches to look at :). 
- Get rid of the robots (The big Mech robots are not needed and add a very unrealistic, futuristic paradigm to the game) 
  Perhaps NPS-AI- Human soldiers guarding the high loot areas is a better option. Perhaps they have dogs that can sniff u 
  out of bushes - if u get too close. 
- Add new images for crafting items that are easier to identify (Perhaps larger more simple images are needed) Its a small 
  detail - but it is needed before full release. 
- Get rid of the microchip on the back of the characters head, once again it is a very futuristic/unrealistic feature of the 
  game - that in my opinion ruins the game. Perhaps an ankle bracelet that inmates usually get is a better option. 
- Make the game playable without any onscreen HUD, some games need to have the HUD on at all times in order to play 
  the game. They might have a turn off feature for the HUD - but when u turn it off - u cant really play the game the way it 
  should be played.
- A game of this caliber has to have a down state for the player (wounded so badly - that a long time has to pass by before 
  u can get up off the ground again) Knock out state - when hit by a large caliber round in the helmet. A Winded state when 
  hit by shotguns in the bulletproof vest from close range - center mass. Losing an arm or a leg in combat, surviving the 
  longest has to be rewarded somehow - so players wont quit after losing a hand, foot, arm or leg - there has to be some 
  reward to survive as long as possible even if crippled. The game has to be a struggle - it is a survival game after all. 
- When killing another player - being able to see how long they survived for and how many kills they have. Perhaps on the 
  ankle brace that all prisoners should have when let out in the world. U can see the time they survived for on the ankle 
  bracelet (Digital ankle brace). As for the kills - perhaps players collect a tooth from every kill - that is placed on a necklace 
  the players wear around their necks. After a kill is confirmed a player will want to look at two things - the ankle bracelet 
  and the necklace - seeing how many teeth are on it. Full necklace being something like 50 teeth - beyond that point u 
  know u killed a bad ass player when u see a full necklace and a ankle brace that reads 500hrs. 
  
Those are some of the features i would like to see Scum add to the game. One of the features i like the most in Scum is Gun play - having to load up all ur bullets and see it live in the 3d world is very nice.
Fixing a jammed weapon is nice as well, however it could have been simplified somewhat - Hold R to check mag and bolt, click R to reload. If weapon becomes jammed  - spam R multiple times until the fix animation finishes. 
Some things need to be simplified and some things need to be added in order to make Scum more immersive in my opinion. 
We can right a book im sure on how to make the game better and what parts to tweak in order to ease the Scum experience. Making the most immersive online survival game is the dream of every creator im sure. 

After the Update  0.95 - i give Scum a rating of 6.5/10 - The game is much better polished now - the inventory is a massive improvement with this update. Solid 6.5/10 !!!
developer_response: Hi there TopGun-Daddy! We're sorry to see that you are thoroughly disappointed with the game. As we're nearing the full release of the game, we'll be making significant improvements to its systems and mechanics - even some of the ones that you've mentioned in your review. To address some of the things mentioned for the story - making the game 'post-apocalyptic'  would make it an entirely different experience and would stray away from what our creatives initially envisioned. We'll be adding loads of new content by the full release of SCUM and we hope that you'll give the game another shot when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199578750865', 'num_games_owned': 2, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1706808890}
review: Scum if very addicting whether you are going solo, with friends, or just looking for the pvp. I personally would enjoy more bushcraft survival and living off the land with more craftables unlocked as your survival skill goes up. The idea that I am forced to go to a town at any point at all can be annoying when wanting to avoid other players or swarmed by puppets. That being said it is a well rounded game with a good combination of both urban and off the land survival!!!! Keep up the good work!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978625389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6021, 'last_played': 1704850276}
review:
Du bist casual Gamer, weit Ã¼ber 30, hast eigentlich kaum Zeit und RP ist neu fÃ¼r dich? Du hast nie groÃŸ gefallen daran gehabt ewig nach Dingen zu looten? Du willst eigentlich nur Abends ne 1-2 StÃ¼ndchen was zocken? Dann geht es dir wie mir und folgendes ist fÃ¼r dich (Spoiler, es ist gut und du wirst dich Ã¤ndern!).

Ich bin mit Scum vor ein paar Monaten durch einen Kumpel in Kontakt gekommen und war Anfangs Ã¼berhaupt nicht begeistert. Grafik war so mittel, Audio ziemlich kacke und abgeholt wurde man auch nicht.
Nun habe ich mich mit einem Kumpel vor ein paar Wochen fÃ¼r einen RP Server entschieden. In der Zwischenzeit kam ein Patch, der meiner Meinung nach das Spiel technisch auf ein ganz anderes Level hebt. Kurz und bÃ¼ndig: Das Spiel sieht absolut klasse aus.

Nun zum Inhalt. Ich habe viele Stunden mit einer Einarbeitung verbracht, wurde von netten Admins an die Hand genommen und bin in die ganze (fÃ¼r mich neue) RP Welt abgetaucht und es bringt einfach unfassbar viel SpaÃŸ. Wer absolute Immersion und Realismus in Sachen Survival Games haben will, der ist bei Scum absolut richtig. Es gibt eigentlich fast nichts, was nicht mÃ¶glich ist. Fliegen, fahren, zu FuÃŸ. HÃ¤ndler, Bauer, Assassine. Solo oder im Team. Hier sind keine Grenzen gesetzt. 
Ja, es dauert alles. Wie im echten Leben. Da kann man schon mal Stunden damit verbringen,fÃ¼rs Craften bestimmte Sachen zu suchen. Die Erfolge sind sehr kleinschrittig, fÃ¼hlen sich dafÃ¼r aber um so besser an. Selbst wenn es nur eine erfolgreiche Ernte (Ja, Cannabis und Koka gibt es auch), die richtige ErnÃ¤hrung (Ich kenne kein Spiel das so akkurat die Vitalwerte eines Menschen simuliert) oder einfach das erste eigene Auto ist: Es freut einen!

Alles, wirklich alles hat Einfluss. und du kannst bestimmen, was Einfluss auf deinen Charakter nimmt.
Das Spiel ist schwer, auÃŸer Frage. Gerade fÃ¼r Casual Gamer wie mich, gab es sehr sehr viele Frustmomente. Mit der Zeit versteht man jedoch, worauf es ankommt. 

Die fÃ¼r mich einzig nervige Sache ist die fehlende Variation innerhalb von GebÃ¤uden. Es gibt gefÃ¼hlt nur 3-4 verschiedene Designs, die u.a. immer gleichen SchrÃ¤nke stehen an der immer gleichen Stelle. Das fÃ¤llt beim Looten einfach auf und sorgt fÃ¼r wenig Abwechslung. 
FÃ¤hrst du mit einem Auto ein Zombie an, wirkt es sehr buggy und unfertig. Ragdoll Effekt gibt es nicht, gerne clippen die auch mal durch die Karre. Das ist einfach unschÃ¶n. Gleiches gilt auch in Sachen SFX seitens der Zombies. Zu oft denkt man, es steht hinter dir einer, der dann aber zwei Stockwerke Ã¼ber dir ist. Bin mir sicher, dass das nochmal verfeinert wird.
Und natÃ¼rlich der Wipe auf den Servern, sobald eine neue Version da ist. Mich hat es bisher nicht getroffen, wird es aber jetzt bald und das stimmt mich mies. Das bedeutet, dass man wieder von vorne anfangen muss. Allerdings fÃ¼r jeden Spieler. Respekt an jeden, der das schon mehrmals mitgemacht hat.

Ich zocke Scum viel zu viel. Eigentlich hat kein anderes Game gerade Platz. Der Suchtfaktor ist enorm. Ich bin kein Freund von early access Spielen, gerade wenn sie schon so lange auf dem Markt sind. Bei Scum hat man aber das GefÃ¼hl, dass viel Liebe in Details geflossen ist.

Tue es!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085261420', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1702588933}
review:
Game continua em acesso antecipado e jÃ¡ tem 7 DLCs. 2 DLCs de cabelo (masculino e feminino), conteÃºdo de customizaÃ§Ã£o que jÃ¡ devia estar no jogo, 2 DLCs de atores, devia ter usado o dinheiro gasto com direitos de imagem desenvolvendo conteÃºdo pra finalizar o desenvolvimento do jogo. 1 DLC de emote de danÃ§a, conteÃºdo inÃºtil, devia estar no jogo. 2 DLCs de apoiadores, apoiar o que exatamente? o desenvolvimento de DLCs?

Se os desenvolvedores do jogo nÃ£o fazem o minimo que Ã© finaliza-lo e ficam fazendo DLC quer dizer que pra eles o game jÃ¡ esta bom, sÃ³ nÃ£o sai da tag de acesso antecipado pra evitar reclamaÃ§Ãµes da comunidade.

RecomendaÃ§Ã£o: Compre DayZ ou Rust, esse jogo Ã© simplesmente um simulador de caminhada (ainda mais que DayZ) mal otimizado, bugado, com servidores mortos e desenvolvedores que "programam" em blueprint.


English:
The game is still in early access and already has 7 DLCs. 2 hair DLCs (male and female), customization content that should have been in the base game, 2 actor DLCs - the money spent on image rights could have been used to develop content to finish the game. 1 dance emote DLC, useless content that should be part of the base game. 2 supporter DLCs, supporting what exactly? The development of more DLCs?

If the game developers don't even do the minimum, which is to finish it, and instead keep releasing DLCs, it suggests that, for them, the game is already good enough. It just doesn't leave the early access tag to avoid community complaints.

Recommendation: Buy DayZ or Rust instead. This game is simply a walking simulator (even more so than DayZ), poorly optimized, buggy, with dead servers, and developers who "code" in Blueprint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844365250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1702390325}
developer_response: Hi there sacchihau! We're sorry to see that you've found your encounter with the puppets to be disappointing. Puppet health varies greatly based on their physique and the gear they have on them. Bigger, meatier puppets have more health on them and won't fall as easily as the skinny, sickly ones. Also, your STRENGTH attribute, as well as the weapon you are wielding also have a great impact on the speed at which puppet are felled. For early game, we propose that you craft a small stone axe for an up close and personal encounter with them and an improvised bow to pick them from afar. This will help you get your bearings in the early game until you find some firepower to protect yourself with. Hope this helps a bit and we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007332010', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 45502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4127, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1712499348}

developer_response:
Hi Rogue. Socom! 

Thank you for your feedback and support. 
We understand your frustration. Our team takes cheaters and hackers very seriously and often works outside their working hours to take them down. 
Since 0.95 was our last major update, we'll be entering the polishing phase soon where we'll revisit all the features/mechanics and fine-tune them. 
This also applies to the anti-cheat detection system! 

Please keep in mind that we are a small team working on a very ambitious project and we have to manage resources (people) carefully. 
Again, we understand what you're saying and we're doing our best! 
We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001939379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1702264374}
review: Reductive of other titles without adding anything new to the genre. Depth of the food mechanic is great, but inconsistent with depth of other mechanics. Also early access DLC is just ... scummy.
developer_response: Hi there Bobert Hillson! We're sorry to see that you're disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that some of the mechanics of the game need to be additionally improved and you'll be pleased to know that we will indeed be doing this as we'll be nearing the full release of the game. As for the DLCs - they are purely cosmetic and serve as an additional means for our community to further support the studio and the development of the game. They do not detract us from making progress on the game, however we understand the negative connotations they bring with themselves. Hope this clears it up a bit and we hope that you'll give the game another chance - at least when we fully release the game.
