author: {'steamid': '76561199141667177', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19330, 'last_played': 1702249289}
review:
SCUM, sie ewige Early Access. 
Dennoch finde ich dieses Spiel bisher sehr gelungen. Aber Vorsicht, dieses Spiel verzeiht keine Fehler! Gerade am Anfang hat man so seine Probleme am Leben zu bleiben, Die sehr reale Survival-Mechanik im Spiel ist vielleicht nicht fÃ¼r jedermann, Hunger und Durst sind hier nur die Spitze des Eisberges. Man sollte auch darauf achten, dass einem nicht zu warm oder kalt wird. Genauso spielt es eine Rolle wie man sich ernÃ¤hrt, denn wie im waren Leben gilt es sich ausgewogen zu ernÃ¤hren um keinen Mangel an bestimmten Vitaminen zu erleiden oder ins Ãœbergewicht abzudriften.
Der Spielablauf ist typisch Survival, Zombies (Puppen) machen einem das Leben schwer. Man erkundet die Map und ist quasi permanent auf der Suche nach Loot. An speziellen MilitÃ¤rspots (besserer Loot) bekommt man es auÃŸerdem mit sehr starken Gegnern zu tun!
Des Weiteren gibt es auch Fahrzeuge, die quer Ã¼ber die Map verteilt sind, diese sind aber meist nicht fahrbereit und mÃ¼ssen vom Spieler erst mit Ersatzteilen versorgt und repariert werden. Auch Flugzeuge kann man sich ergattern.
Wer stirbt, verliert erstmal seinen ganzen Loot und kann versuchen wieder zu seiner Leiche zu kommen, was ohne Waffen oftmals aussichtslos ist.
Verletzungen gibt es in verschiedenen Schweregraden und sollten dringend behandelt werden, meist zieht man sich auch gleich eine Infektion mit zu.
Man bewegt sich auf einer sehr schÃ¶n gestalteten Map (Texturen werden hier nach und nach Ã¼berarbeitet) in verschiedenen Klimazonen. Es gibt immer etwas zu tun, auch wenn bis dato keine Quests o. Ã¤. implementiert sind. 
Es gibt ein modulares Bausystem, also kann man sich auch recht einfach eine Base errichten. Hier muss aber noch von Seiten der Entwickler nachgebessert werden!
Alles in allem das realistischste Survival-Spiel, dass ich gespielt habe. Doch auch eines der schwersten und frustrierendsten! Wenn jetzt noch etwas Spielphysik dazukommen wÃ¼rde, wÃ¤re ich voll zufrieden. Aber wie gesagt, ist ja noch EA, also gibt es hier und da auch noch Macken!

author: {'steamid': '76561199560517745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1710455813}
review:
After the latest updates the game has gotten much better but I'd still like to see better editing for base building. like snap on top, bottom, front, back, and free place. Item holders for things like food, drinks Jack 'o' Lanterns and lanterns. Also after the latest update... Why can't I paint the boat?
I would also like to see a "use item" function button and a flashlight on the combat helmet. 
The game is headed in the right direction and I like the dev communications with the community.
developer_response: Hi there Dumptruck The Destroyer! We're sorry to see you disappointed with the game. We'd like to emphasize that, as we're nearing the full release of the game, the team is hard at work on improving as many features and systems in the game as we can to create a more polished and complete experience for our players. As for the specific situation with the pooping - you gotta go when you gotta go! Jokes aside, the necessity of your character to excrete is something that should be taken with utmost seriousness and should not be postponed to ensure optimal health for your character. Having said that, we hope you'll give the game another chance once more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989556557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22344, 'last_played': 1702820814}
review:
They have changed a zombie survival game into a car restoration game.
The SUV and Pickup Truck are removed and you can now get 2 hatchbacks, however they are never complete so you have to walk around the map gathering car parts like wheels and seets.
The funny thing is that you cant fit a driver seat in a boat so you have to walk around miles and miles with a car seet in your hands and you cant drive the car without the driverseet.
You apperently can drive around on 3 wheels ??
I get you want to make a game realistic but driving a front wheeled car with only one frontwheel is not possible in real life. What is possible in real life, is to be able to place a car seat on a boat !!!
The stamina on you character is so low because of the heavy car seat walking is you only option.
After half a mile your character will start complaining that he/she is in pain because of that car seat. 
It's Fing Awesome !

author: {'steamid': '76561198053718396', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2786, 'last_played': 1703012586}
review:
I purchased this game when it first hit Steam EA back in 2018. 

It looked promising, a unique twist on the whole survival genre with some cool mechanics that set it apart. On top of that it was developed by a Croatian company and I wanted to contribute in supporting my fellow Croats and even got a few of my friends to purchase the game. 

At launch it was pretty bare bones but I gave it a pass. It is Early Access after all. I played until I felt I've seen the majority of what the game has to offer and left it aside, waiting for the full release. Over the years I would return to the game just to see the progress. There were some major updates which peeked my interest such as vehicles, base building and map expansions, but all in all nothing that would keep me playing for more than a couple of hours. Then I saw the cosmetic packs. 

Honestly, an EA game should not be allowed to sell additional content. Yes, it's cool that Danny Trejo lent his likeness to a character in the game, along with Luis Moncada, but those are the things that the devs should focus on AFTER the game is actually released. And yes, I do understand those are just cosmetic items, but someone had to spend time putting those characters into the game which means less time developing the game towards a full release.

I want to see this game succeed, but, This is NOT the way.
developer_response: Hi there Clooney Tunes! Thank you for supporting the game for such a long time and for inviting your friends to purchase and try the game. We still need a bit more time to deliver on the promise that we've set out for ourselves, but we'd like to emphasize that we are definitely on track and that if you look at our updates, we're inching ever closer to the final release of the game. It took us more that we would have wanted, that's for sure, but a game of this ambition and complexity takes time and resources. We understand what connotations these practices carry with them, but we'd like reassure that these DLC's helped the studio stay afloat in trying times and that it supported the development of the game (as well as the team behind it) without compromising the time spent actually developing the game. All that being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance, at least when we'll deliver the full release of the game and exit Early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136959839', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1710188208}
review:
Looking in empty container's simulator. 

I am a fair person. I do not expect to find a RPG in a dresser drawer. However in any house that I searched everything in. I did not find a single firearm, when I did find a firearm at a military base it had no ammo. I searched all the crates after finally luring away the undead only to find that none of them had any ammo for the rifle I had finally found. X_X   

I was a little upset when I wrote this review because of that considering my playtime of eight hours.  I will look forward to your update. If you make the game better with loot mechanics in mind. I will not only change my review but buy the supporter packs. Because listening to the customer not a lot of companies do anymore.
developer_response: Hi there Brian_Belmont87! We're sorry to see that your experience with the game was less that satisfying because of the scarcity of the loot. We'd like to emphasize that the game is envisioned to be a hardcore survival game where survival is challenging and the scarcity of loot is one of the elements that supports that vision. However, we acknowledge that some players find this to be unsatisfying, so we addressed that through our private servers where admins can regulate the spawning of loot and significantly increase it. Also, we will be making certain adjustments with the loot in the upcoming patch which is why we recommend that you either wait just a bit more for the new update or try and find a private server with modified settings that suit your playstyle. All this being said, we truly hope that you'll give the game another chance.

Punto negativo el sistema de caza, el cuÃ¡l he leÃ­do que es nuevo, ya que antes los animales spawneaban por el mapa y ahora no, ahora escuchas sonidos y tienes que seguirlos, buscar pistas y cuando sigues unas cuentas, te spawnean el animal. review:
Welcome to Scum, where survival is the name of the game... unless, of course, you find yourself inexplicably attached to the zombie buffet line. Hereâ€™s a rundown of my rollercoaster ride through this zany world:

Character Creation:

Creating my character felt like assembling a contestant for a â€˜Survivorâ€™-meets-â€˜American Ninja Warriorâ€™ mashup. I could customize everything from muscles to, well, uh, some rather personal attributes. Needless to say, my Scum character ended up looking like a cross between Rambo and a professional sumo wrestler with a penchant for bright orange sneakers.

Survival Tactics:

Apparently, Scum wants to remind you that life is all about the simple things â€“ like foraging for food, crafting weapons, and, oh yeah, dodging everything that wants to turn you into a chew toy. After desperately hunting for sustenance, I finally found a can of beans. Victory! Until I realized I didnâ€™t have a can opener. Lesson learned: Hunger can be more lethal than any zombie horde.

The Wildlife:

Encountering the wildlife was like stumbling into a National Geographic documentary directed by a mad scientist. The majestic sight of a deer gracefully prancing through the woods was quickly overshadowed by the chaos of watching said deer charge headfirst into a pack of zombies. Survival of the fittest, indeed.
Friendship in Scum:

Teaming up with fellow players led to both hilarious antics and desperate attempts not to become zombie chow together. Communication was key, but it turns out that yelling "Donâ€™t eat that mushroom!" is surprisingly ineffective when your teammate is already mid-chew.

Death:

Death in Scum is like being handed a participation trophy... for dying. When I inevitably met my demise (letâ€™s just say mistaking a landmine for a pet rock wasnâ€™t my finest moment), I respawned â€“ minus my hard-earned loot. Itâ€™s like the game said, â€œWelcome back! Hereâ€™s a pat on the back for your spectacular failure. Try not to explode this time!â€

In conclusion, Scum is a wild ride thatâ€™ll have you laughing, crying, and possibly yelling at your screen in equal measure. Itâ€™s a survival sandbox where even the best-laid plans can end up as comical disasters. But isnâ€™t that the beauty of it all? Embrace the chaos, enjoy the absurdity, and remember: in Scum, being a little "scummy" is all part of the fun.

Hope that brings a smile to your face!

review: It's actually a fun game, especially when you play with others.   The devs have slowly been adding more QOL and RP items and mechanics to the game, bringing it more inline with games like Day-Z, but it's not quite there yet.  What this game DOES give you, though, that Day-Z does not, is single-player mode.   That feature alone makes this game a definite winner in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336262774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 334095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4497, 'playtime_at_review': 322049, 'last_played': 1712431627}
review:
[h3]Genialer Ãœberlebenskampf - SCUM setzt MaÃŸstÃ¤be im Survival-Genre![/h3]

SCUM hat meine Erwartungen an ein Mehrspieler-Open-World-Survival-Spiel in jeder Hinsicht Ã¼bertroffen und stellt fÃ¼r mich das Beste in dieser Genreklasse dar. Das Spiel nimmt die Idee der Charakteranpassung, -steuerung und -entwicklung auf eine vÃ¶llig neue Ebene und schafft eine immersive Welt, in der Wissen und KÃ¶nnen die entscheidenden Faktoren fÃ¼r langfristiges Ãœberleben sind.

Die Liebe zum Detail ist in jedem Aspekt spÃ¼rbar, von der atemberaubenden Grafik bis zur realistischen Simulation von Hunger, Durst und anderen lebenswichtigen BedÃ¼rfnissen. Die CharakteranpassungsmÃ¶glichkeiten sind schier endlos, und die Tiefe des KÃ¶nnensystems erÃ¶ffnet ungeahnte taktische MÃ¶glichkeiten im Ãœberlebenskampf.

Die Entwickler haben es geschafft, eine offene Welt zu schaffen, die nicht nur visuell beeindruckend ist, sondern auch eine stÃ¤ndige Herausforderung darstellt. Die Interaktion mit anderen Spielern bringt eine zusÃ¤tzliche dynamische Komponente ins Spiel, und die Notwendigkeit, sich Wissen anzueignen, um zu Ã¼berleben, verleiht SCUM eine einzigartige taktische Tiefe.

Insgesamt bietet SCUM ein Spielerlebnis, das seinesgleichen sucht. FÃ¼r alle, die nach dem ultimativen Survival-Abenteuer suchen, ist dieses Spiel schlichtweg unverzichtbar. Hier werden neue MaÃŸstÃ¤be gesetzt, und SCUM zeigt eindrucksvoll, wie fesselnd und innovativ ein Survival-Spiel sein kann!

review:

Sortie depuis 2018 c'est impressionnant comment les devs travaillent Ã  fond dessus (une grosse maj tout les 2-3 mois), on peut le comparer Ã  DayZ en version encore plus complÃ¨te, plus beau et plus realiste.
Un vrai jeux de simulation de survie avec du pve attractif (bunker, bunker abandonnÃ© style horreur, survie hard, zombie, crafting de base...) et un pvp trÃ¨s bon au meme titre de Rust!
Qulques bugs sont encore prÃ©sents mais les devs amÃ©liorent Ã§a frÃ©quemment, et chaque serveur sont gerÃ©s par des admins qui en general sont lÃ  pour pallier aux bugs rencontrÃ©s in-game.
Bref je surkiff depuis 2018, le jeux change et s'ameliore enormement Ã  chaque MAJ, les graphismes sont magnifiques, le rÃ©alisme des armes et de la map pareil et la survie est impressionnante ! Vivement la 0.95 semaine pro !

author: {'steamid': '76561198052567657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1703570485}
review: Would not recommend at this time.  The game may be improved in the future it is still in early access,  The graphics are awsome.  The initual directions are a joke, when u first start the game you are thrown out of a plane and it states to hit I to deploy parachute, but I doesn't work, neither do any number keys.  Took dying numberous times to figure out it was the F key.  The dietary system is a nightmare also.  Hopefully they have fixed this part, balancing carbs, fat, protein, salt, chlorine, etc is a nightmare.  Who cares, if ur gonna die then eat, doesn't matter what it is.
developer_response: Hello Atigress! We're sorry to see that you've had a disappointing experience with the game. The situation you've had with the parachute and its corresponding input is quite peculiar. If you did not change the inputs before starting the game, then the default input should always be F. Maybe some specific graphic setting you lowered distorted the UI element which tells you to press F that pops up when you become able to open the parachute. This is all speculation currently and we'd love to hear more details about it via https://support.scumgame.com/ if you would be so kind. As for the metabolism, we acknowledge that better explanation of that system is necessary and we're pleased to report that this will be addressed in the upcoming patch, which is why we hope you'll give the game another chance once we get it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998002129', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 29213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29213, 'last_played': 1701489418}
review:
I have been playing off and on since release and here's what I think.

First the game is NOT early release anymore. It's been out for years.

The game was better when they released it imo. I have seen all the updates and played them all, and here's what I think about the game in general...

It seems like the devs have it out for the player. Everyone agrees the game is the most micro managed survival game ever. So if you're not into that, then this game is NOT for you.

After all the updates it's clear the Devs hate their player base. Here's why...they have made the game so impossible to play that it's not even fun anymore. I mean we get it, we are prisoners on an island. We must pay for our crimes, but ffs it's a game not reality!

Between not being able to find any loot anymore, and everything in the world that can kill you now it just isn't fun period! 

There's no room for fun, unless spending every second trying to survive is fun. No breaks because there's too much to kill you!! And of course you cannot find what you need to survive. They have made it impossible to find anything. The loot system is terrible now!

I'm done with this game for good!
developer_response: Hi there Kon-Trak-Killa! Firstly, we'd like to express our gratitude for supporting the game for such a long time and say that we're sorry to see that you no longer find the game to be enjoyable and fun. SCUM was always envisioned as a hardcore survival game that leans on realism and it was meant to be challenging. However, we're aware that some players enjoy a bit more relaxed approach to survival, which is why we've enabled private servers where certain settings (such as number of puppets, existence of Sentries, loot spawns, etc.) can be modified. If you think the game is no longer fun for you because of the lack of loot, we'd like to recommend that you find a server where loot spawns are more generous. All that being said, we'd like to emphasize that the team is still hard at work with bringing full release of the game out the door and to bring about all the necessary improvements and content additions that we have planned and we hope that you'll reconsider coming back to the game once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990427994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14990, 'last_played': 1702956799}
review:
Short review-
buy it on sale 10-15 dollars, especially if you are ok with rust, and like zomboid. If you can't make it past the initial huge learning curve you won't waste too much money.


Longer review-
Recommending was a toss up. There is so much potential it is insane, and I do ultimately enjoy it, but there is a lot to unpack. 

Scum is the love child of Rust and Project Zomboid. Like Zomboid it has a steep learning curve. Very steep. If you are learning on your own, I estimate 50 hours if you have limited similar experiences to really have a grasp on how to survive, assuming you are learning most of the game and not skipping things.

Like Rust there is raiding and pvp, but it heavily depends on the server. Make no mistake 60 people on 1 server at once is a lot. Once you have the basics down, you can largely simplify the game if you please. You can sustain yourself on a simple diet, and you don't have to build or farm, and making money becomes easier. Many players live off of stashes they place in world and are baseless.

The way I see it the devs care about the game, but not about the players. This deserves further explanation. There are basically 0 quality of life features. If you want basic wood arrows, you need to cut sticks into small stick, then craft each arrow. Find a box of nails? Have fun right clicking and then left clicking remove nail for the next few minutes. That isn't fun, it is work. 

To add insult to injury there used to be faster ways to do it, like being able to craft a nail with the required material being a box of them, but that was removed for some reason. It is a simple recipe, it wouldn't take an hour to code it in from scratch, and if you just used a form it would take minutes. 

To make things a little more aggravating you need dozens if not hundreds of nails, bolts and bobby pins, which means you are unpacking for an hour of two if you do it all at once. Again, this is work, not fun. Further, your first base will likely be made with primitive gear, which means a simple 2x2 can take hours. 

Not very much is intuitive either, so it can be VERY frustrating. There are even keyboard commands that arent shown on the keybindings, which should piss anyone off. Because of this the game ultimately feels like the devs don't respect the players time which explains why the game is on life support.

In my experience official servers are more toxic than Rust official. The main reason is feuding. Some people hold grudges in rust, but the reality is that in rust there is usually such a high pop that are all doing the same thing, that people forget because in 30 minutes it happened again 2-3 times. Sometimes it goes further but I have yet to hear about long time players holding a grudge more than a day or two without a specific reason, like racism etc. Scum servers have to be smaller, so people will try to punish you specifically often. While this can be fun if it is a friendly competition, most people who are new don't want to deal with that. Ever have someone find all your bases and only raid you and constantly hunt for specifically you, before you were really established? I have it sucks, and there was literally nothing I could do. I was prim, and he had rifles. Why? apparently I built my first base too close to him, but I had no idea where he was. Maybe 2 hours in on my first time loading.

The actual gameplay is great, the animations are really good, plenty of things to do if you just want to learn playing solo. I do find the shooting to be the most accurate to real life than in any game I have ever played, with there being a bullet rise before drop, windage etc. So sniping can be really complicated compared to most other games, and in one case I hit a friend in the head with a shot at over a grid away. Unfortunately most servers wont have draw distance that high, but hey that happened and it was awesome. The hunting is incredibly hard, and the best way I can describe it is like spot and stalk irl, which isn't practiced a lot, and is quite difficult, harder than irl to be honest. Anyone who hunts knows hunting is not easy either. The fishing is fun. PVP is fast, as in incredibly fast. 1-2 shots and it is likely over, and even if you win, you could still die from the injury or infection. That is why server pops can not be too high.  

The game can be very fun after the learning curve, and there are many people who are helpful, and nice (relatively speaking, don't ask where their base is and they wont say goodnight). The online tutorials are ok, but until you figure it out do yourself a favor and start on a pve server. The game is immensely different than any other I have found, and you will need time to acclimate to it

author: {'steamid': '76561198038669217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 61539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5353, 'playtime_at_review': 8404, 'last_played': 1712500775}
review: This has to be hands down one of the best survival games I have ever played. The crafting system is immense, the map is stunning. I was an avid DayZ player and I cannot go back to DayZ after playing this. PVE or PVP this is a game for everyone. If you bought the Day Before today then get a refund and buy this! You will not be upset at all this has hours and hours and hours of fun and exploration!!!!

Servers restart very quickly to reduce lag, usually 10 seconds of downtime between restarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054312563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 27042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3796, 'playtime_at_review': 14650, 'last_played': 1712456151}
review:
Metto si, nella speranza che aggiungano un obiettivo, o una serie di obiettivi e non quest procedurali. Inoltre spero che diano la possibilitÃ  di ospitare server non a pagamento, altrimenti direi che Ã¨ un gioco giÃ  morto.

Ci ho speso numero sufficiente di ore per dire che ora come ora comunque Ã¨ un gioco di "simulazione" apprezzabile ma senza scopo. 

Ogni volta che inizio una partita, trovo esaltante l'essere catapultato in una cittÃ  sperduta della mappa e fare tutto per sopravvivere. Difatti nelle prime ore hai la sensazione di poter e dover far di tutto per sopravvivere  ma Ã¨ una sensazione che svanisce di li a poco perchÃ© la sopravvivenza Ã¨ un problema solo all'inizio, poi arrivato ad una certa potenza di fuoco, avrei giustamente come obiettivo quello di razziare e comprare le armi vere e proprie dai vendor, e li sparisce la magia. Super forte, razioni illimitate, nessun problema con gli zombie...puoi edificare, ma le costruzioni finiscono in fretta(non sono poche)... ovviamente ci sono delle parti con zombi potenziati e quant'altro ma difendono solo del prezioso loot che ti permette di ottenere soldi...ma hai giÃ  tutto quindi anche il fare soldi Ã¨ una attivitÃ  che passa in secondo piano....quindi rimane poco in sostanza(non fraintendetemi il gioco non Ã¨ misero, ha davvero delle potenzialitÃ ).

Graficamente Ã¨ bello, paesaggi mozzafiato, mappa enorme, molto molto da esplorare.

Le regole cambiano da server a server cosÃ¬ come il loot e la difficoltÃ  nel sopravvivere (sempre noioso in poco piÃ¹ di una settimana), vorrei qualcosa di pre-settato dai creatori del gioco per essere davvero difficile e godermi almeno la sopravvivenza in qualsiasi server. 

Alcuni luoghi/case/edifici sono disegnati davvero bene, ma per la maggior parte delle cittÃ  sulla mappa(quelle piccole) Ã¨ tutto un riciclo di ambienti e case(Questo a parer mio strozza un po l'immersione al gioco), ma Ã¨ una cosa che si puÃ² aggiornare.

I vendor fatti bene ma creano un vero proprio posto sicuro che stona con l'atmosfera, dovrebbero essere ciclici non h24. Addirittura la valuta e la banca per quanto puÃ² essere comoda buttano giÃ¹ l'atmosfera, dovrebbe esserci solo il baratto, tanto o meno conveniente in base ad abilitÃ  del personaggio, quindi cose limitate, oggetti limitati.

Una cosa che davvero odio, Ã¨ che sia consentito costruire nelle cittÃ , porcaccia di una miseria Ã¨ uno schifo. Le mura non dovrebbero essere edificabili in cittÃ , dove porca miseria infili lo steccato nell'asfalto?? ridicolo. E se proprio lo lasci fare, fai in modo che gli zombi di una cittÃ  possano attaccare in continuazione queste strutture, rendile davvero deteriorabili poichÃ¨ nelle cittÃ  si concentrano molti piÃ¹ zombi. CosÃ¬ come quelle costruite all'esterno, tutto deteriorabile e attaccabile quando sei offline, altrimenti rendi stagnante il gioco, il che non significa che devi far usare piÃ¹ materiali per riparare le strutture, vuol dire solamente che devi essere piÃ¹ presente online se ci tieni al tuo rifugio e ultimo ma non ultimo se gli zombi spaccano tutto, allora tu che sei offline nel tuo rifugio muori! Il disconnettersi e diventare invisibile ti da la possibilitÃ  di essere sempre al sicuro, alias fine sopravvivenza.

La prima idea che uno si fa, Ã¨ diventare un collazionatore seriale di oggetti, ma ci si stufa presto!

La mia paura e che buttino via questo progetto, continuando semplicemente ad abbellire e aggiungere cianfrusaglie, senza occuparsi di dargli uno scopo.

Ci sarebbero molti altri difetti e pregi che potrei elencare, tutto converge in un incredibile potenziale tuttora inespresso. 

Speriamo in bene! Per ora mi sento di dire la direzione Ã¨ giusta ma non basta!

author: {'steamid': '76561199011177056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4618, 'last_played': 1701392265}
review:
The game is extremely raw. Lack of normal interface, bad looting system, no any clues of why did the charachter died, buggy puppets which are randomly coming through walls, sounds and lights which are coming to a bunker from the above, overcomplicated and almost unusable inventory, lots of problems with translations, items disappearing around you, etc. Instead of fixing existing problems, they are adding new content, whish is as buggy as previous.  Since they are "working" on this game ~5 years, I would not expect all the bugs and problems to fixed soon.

Doesn't worth money spent. I would not recommend anybody to pay for this (v.0.9). You will be a beta tester for your own money, with no salary. I would  not  complain, if it would have ben free.  But now - it's like  "I had an obligation to pay them, but they have no obligations to fix problems, since "its in early access"".
developer_response: Hi there Murinos! Thank you for the extensive review and for pointing out specific gripes that you have with the game. You'll be pleased to know that almost all of these elements will be touched upon and spruced up - some of them (like the interface and looting) in the next patch whose release is imminent! As for the other things, we are aware of these issues and we promise that we'll fix them as we'll be nearing the full release of the game. We acknowledge that these fixes are a long time coming and we understand the frustration their persistence in the game is causing, but we'll make sure to get rid of them and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we'll get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072069736', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1703132136}
review: If you're looking to play with friends and don't have an SSD you won't be able to connect to multiplayer. You can do single player.
developer_response: Hi there Mentally Confused Duck! We're sorry to see that the SSD requirement prevented you from enjoying the game. However, we'd like to point out that on the official store page for SCUM, the SSD is listed under the minimum system requirements. The game and its systems are very complex and the HDD simply cannot generate the performance necessary for an optimal functioning of the game. That being said, we hope that you or your friends will be able to upgrade to an SSD soon or at least until we full release the game when you will be able to enjoy it in full capacity and as intended.

author: {'steamid': '76561199130111295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 196, 'playtime_at_review': 6365, 'last_played': 1712451191}
review: Just started on Scum. Playing single player for 100 hours just to see how everything works. Going to add Zombies and Mechs a little at a time to get use to defending myself, then on to multiplayer.  I feel if you jump into full game mode to soon you could get discouraged and quit. Tons of videos on line to help learn how to do things such as cooking and such, things you tend to take for granted. Anyway, having a blast getting totally immersed in this "game".  So far, I've run into no glitches that I know of, and even if I do its just a game and the devs are doing a phenomenal job to keep it  interesting. All done with zeros and ones? Geezzz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045256564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9382, 'last_played': 1649243993}
review: Early Access Games simply should not be permitted to release paid DLC on steam.
developer_response: Hi there Howler! We're sorry to see that the existence of DLC has soured your opinion of the game. We'd like to emphasize that these DLCs are of immense help as they support the development of the game and they help support the team that is working on it. They are purely cosmetic in nature, meaning that they are completely optional and they do not provide any unfair advantage to those that have purchased them. The game is ambitious in scope and it would not be possible without the support that our beloved community is giving us, in any shape or form. Make no mistake, we understand the position you are coming from but rest assured, we are committed to delivering the full 1.0 version of the game and to exiting Early access. We talk about specific dates just yet, but judging by the version number of the upcoming patch, you will see that the release is definitely on the horizon, and we hope you'll be there to experience it yourself. We truly hope you'll give us one more chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561199184306034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2759, 'last_played': 1701745509}
review: game is good, but servers are owned by people who ban you for anything. and they take all the good loot. thats why its falling off now.
developer_response: Hi Freegapz33! Sorry to see that you've had negative experiences with server owners. If you were not engaged in cheating or any other inappropriate behavior, then you've just had a bad run or a stroke of bad luck with server admins. There are plenty of adequately moderated SCUM servers that should cater to your playstyle so we'd like to advise that you try out more of them. We're certain you'll find something to your liking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005605319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8110, 'last_played': 1701715151}
review:
Was fun when I bought it a few updates into development. I was able to play solo offline.

Now I return, after the "FUN" bunker update...
Unkillable Boss.
Enemy that stunlocks you, only way to get out is hitting "f" like mad, got out and bled out two seconds later.
Many doors have a keypad with two or three used keys and you have to guess the combination, six possible combinations. If you get it wrong an alarm gets triggert. AND the unkillable boss starts marching in your direction and the stunlock enemy spawns close by.

Now that sounds like fun...

In the early updates  I was OK with not going into the killbox and missing that loot, but now the armory is the new killbox. Nice development.

But on a positive note the server settings are nice, might want to add the option to disable brenner.
developer_response: Hi there Arashi! We're sorry to see that the abandoned bunkers are not to your liking. These bunkers are designed to be challenging sections where the best loot is hidden away and where your skills as a player are tested by Razors and Mr. Brenner. Their removal as a private server setting is definitely something worthy of consideration, but is not something that we focus on at the moment. There are ways to go through the abandoned bunker almost unnoticed, but it will take time and preparation from your side. Regardless, there are things that will be changed with regards to the way abandoned bunkers function with the new update, so we'd like for you to stay tuned for news on that. All that being said, we'd like to kindly ask you to give the game one more chance - at least when the new patch rolls out which will be in the foreseeable future.

author: {'steamid': '76561199098321868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7479, 'last_played': 1703912237}
review: Best thing about this game is that you can have over 100 hours and still learn something. Granted thereâ€™s always (except for holidays) a soft patch on Monday that very so slightly changes things. However, if youâ€™re new to the game I would suggest not doing the new content they have implemented becauseâ€¦. Damn itâ€™s hard lol. Yes the game is in beta, yes you will randomly lose a fully armored car with 3 chests full of loot that youâ€™re gonna sell. Yes your house will randomly grow a tree through a chest that houses your axes and youâ€™ll have to either make one or find one. author: {'steamid': '76561198080514785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1703641564}
review:
First I'd like to say this game has a ton of potential and a vast gaming experience for the survival and FP shooter lover. It's a gorgeous game and some really well thought out aspects on survival, hunting, FP shooting etc. I will look forward to future developments. However, in the 40hrs I have played SP mode I'm not sold on the game. Yes it's in early access for 5 years now, yes it's still being developed and a lot of work has gone into making this game, there's no doubt about that. For the SP that is not into competitive multiplayer, I'm not sure this game is worth it at this time. 

Day One-Getting a feel for the game, start crafting tools/weapons, live off cactus and aloe plants. Look for loot and anything I want to craft doesn't exist through 3 towns. Thread and food being a main focus along side killing the same puppets that spawn within 30secs of killing them. Ok fine, tweak some settings. Once in a while I heard chickens and goats, look into how to hunt them but was never successful at ever finding them. They may be a myth.

Day 2-Saw a patch with crafting update, I get excited. Yes, I found some thread! Ok cool, so now I'm thinking I can make more stuff. I find a wheelbarrow and start stashing loot in it so I can use it once I find all the mats I need. Run around a few towns with this thing gathering mats and call it a day.

Day 3-I find a drill press, excellent go get my wheelbarrow and wheel it over. Maybe I can craft some cool stuff! Now I hear a wolf. If you don't go hunt this thing right away the howling will drive you insane. So I go kill it, finally. It was right outside the house I was looting where the drill press was. Grab the goods and head back to my drill press and stash. Well WTF?! it all dissapeared. So disappointed, I google what the hell happened and this is normal. There are spawn timers on the items, which an explanation was given as to why the devs did it this way. There is also no option to turn that off in SP. So I'm thinking well how the hell do you craft anything if it takes you 3 towns and many hours of game time of looting to get all the mats you need to have it all vanish. Cool stuff... 

The more I read into forums, the more I found out that SP is not a main focus of this game. Yes, I understand this game is still in development, but I'm not interested in just running around killing puppets. How boring. I'm more into survival aspect and crafting.  If the devs want to focus on multi player, then just make it multi player. At this time I do not recommend it for SP. Maybe a year down the road this will be a better gaming experience for the SP, but the 40hrs I've put in all I got was this stupid wolf hat!
developer_response: Hi ZÃ¦! We're extremely sorry for the inconvenience you've experienced. As you've already mentioned,  the game is still in active development and we're still working to fix the issues that are present in the game. This bug usually occurs in multiplayer, so the fact that you got it in SP is rather rare. That is why we'd like to kindly ask you to explain what happened in as much detail as you can at https://support.scumgame.com/ so we can fix it. This will help us immensely and we'd greatly appreciate the assistance.

review:
Followed scum since 0.001 and only thing to know is "real like" really means if real life will F you like this then Scum will do it harder. NO not first game  I've followed from 0.001* and won't be last. You want a game not afraid of hitting with even the kitchen sink + ultra? here's the game for you. You want real without a "true" death that lets you try weird? Scum. Want a sandbox that lets "survival meets crazy"? Scum. Want a life without leaving your house? Scum. AND to be honest only thing Scum can't do is ..... So yeah have fun and Scum it up. It's a game for fun/fkery. enjoy

edit: Scum can and is too real for some people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087730269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1701447546}
review: IF YOU WANT TO PLAY A GAME WHERE YOU SEARCH AND NEVER FIND ANYTHING BUT FOOD THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU HOPE THE DEVS FUCKING DO THERE JOBS AND FIX THE SEARCHES AND SHIT FROM DELETING FROM EXISTENCE WHEN YOU DROP IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
developer_response: Hi RonanTheNeko! We're sorry that you've had a less than satisfying experience with the game. The game (and, therefore, its loot) is designed as a hardcore survival experience, meaning that the game will not shower you with items and that it will hide its best loot in places that will put your survival skills to test. Regardless, we acknowledge that new players can have a harder time with the game, which is why we'll be tweaking loot spawns with the upcoming update. In the meantime, we advise that you try out playing multiplayer on private servers which have modified settings for loot if you feel that it is too scarce on official servers. We'd also like to stress that the game is still in Early access and that there's still a lot of work ahead of us and we hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027400738', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1701404951}
review: This is one of those games that unless you're ready to watch countless hours of tutorials on how to even play this game at a very basic level, you'll just be wandering around aimlessly not sure how to do anything. It's cool it exists for people that are looking for that kind of thingâ€”but I'm more of a "casual" survival game player like Rust or 7 Days to Die.
developer_response: Hi Pherocity! We're sorry to see that you did not enjoy your time with the game. We understand your preference for a more casual-oriented experience and acknowledge that we can do a better job at explaining the mechanics of the game. However, we're pleased to say that this is something that will be addressed with the upcoming patch. As fo something that caters more to your playstyle, we'd like to recommend that you try out the private servers where certain settings (such as Sentries, loot, puppets, etc.) can be modified. Once you find a server that catersto your preferences, we're certain that you'll be able to find enjoyment with the game, which is why we really hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218656139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1701397352}
review: like DayZ but EVEN LESS rewarding lmao
developer_response: Hi Slick Deuceman, Attorney at law! We're sorry to see that you find the experience of the game to be unrewarding. The game is envisioned to be a hardcore survival game where everything's your enemy and where sheer survival is something that you have to fight for. Conducive to that is the scarcity of loot where you have to desperately search for scraps in order to be able to craft or find items that will help you survive on the island. We acknowledge that sometimes new and solo players can have a hard time on official servers, but that is why we have dedicated PvE servers and private servers where server owners can modify certain settings like the number of puppets, loot spawns, presence of Sentries and more. Perhaps a server that has increased loot spawns would be more rewarding and fun for you as you would be able to find more items, craft more complex items earlier, as well as attempt more challenging bunkers. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance, especially since we have an update coming soon and since we're nearing the full release of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857302425', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1701377442}
review:
Exploding suicide bomber zombies, no fun.
Zombies taking 20 stabs to the face with a spear to kill one, no fun.
Robots, no fun.  Hordes of zombies that actually die when hit would be fun.
Crafting system where nothing makes sense and cant craft anything or craft a backpack to have room to hold anything, no fun.  makes me want to get a refund. (i heard they are fixing crafting but no changes to the rest of the game)  Not sure if i want to wait in hopes or just refund...
We just want a nice looking game like this where we can all grind up from nothing but HAVE FUN doing it.  Nobody wants annoying overly tanky ai or suicide zombies, or robots or to know every detail on how many vitamins we have in our body like holy shh we just want to grind and loot up and build bases and survive in a fun and beautiful world like this one.  Like it looks amazing,  Ai actually looks and handles ok (much better than DayZ) but no need to make them that tanky its just annoying more than fun.  Lower their health make them die in one shot to the face but add more of them.  get rid of the overly complex healing / health bs imo.  Getting heavy bleeds and not being able to treat them is annoying and the only reason i even have them is because the zombies dont die when repeatedly stabbed in the face.   Cant wait til one of these developers makes a game thats actually fun without all the dumb shit.  Their game will explode and every other game will die.  Until that happens ill continue to give my two cents to the games that have potential like Scum...
This game could easily be top 10 on steam and #1 survival game with much bigger player base than dayZ and Rust or any game that dares to compete IF you just make the necessary adjustments to make it FUN & not annoying to play.  The environment looks amazing and gunplay/ loot is solid (could use more polishing & more loot), survival aspects as far as eating and how food grows like irl is awesome (but need to be able to drink from freshwater sources with chance of sickness but also implement purification tabs and water filters to minimize chances would be nice),  just tons of potential here and i want to help make it better because honestly this feels closer to what im looking for than any other game.  Hope my review helps shape it into what it needs to be not just for myself but all gamers to enjoy & hope everyone that feels the same can chime in as well comments are open :) <3
developer_response:
Hi there 31! We'd like to thank you for taking the time to write this extensive review - we greatly appreciate when we receive constructive feedback such as this. There's a lot to unpack here so let's start from the top:

The suicide puppet are extremely dangerous foes and if you don't have something to kill them from a distance (a bow and arrow at least) - run like hell! Going head to head with them is a sentence to a quick and painful death.

Your efficiency at killing puppets depends on many things - your strength attribute, your weapon of choice, the puppets themselves (the bigger,  meatier ones can take more hits). But the main issue here is your weapon of choice. We assume that you were using an improvised spear which, while good at keeping the distance between you and the puppet, is very weak when it comes to damage. Our suggestion (for a starter weapon) would be a small improvised hatchet as it is easy to craft and packs a solid punch. 

Crafting will be reworked in the upcoming patch and we can't wait for you to see the improvement. As for the initial backpack - an improvised courier backpack will help you and serve you nicely with carrying items until you find something more useful (like a backpack). 

Some of the things (like sentries or puppets) can be modified in private servers. For instance, some private servers have settings where sentries do not appear and where the number of puppets are limited. If you think that some of these suit you better, we advise that you look for private servers with these settings and try the game that way. You may find more enjoyment there.

Also, we'd like to emphasize that the game is in Early access and that we still have a lot of work on our hands to fix the issues that are present in the game and to add the content that we still have planned. We're nearing the full release of the game and we can't wait to roll out all the stuff that we have in store for you.

All of that being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance as we can see that you find genuine enjoyment with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427465131', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 20343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20343, 'last_played': 1677204897}
review:
SCUM, developed by Gamepires and Croteam, is not your run-of-the-mill survival game. It's a gritty, hardcore experience that throws you into a massive open world and challenges you to survive against both the elements and other players. This game is not for the faint of heart, but for those who thrive on a brutal, unforgiving environment.

The first thing that strikes you about SCUM is its realism. The attention to detail is astonishing, from the meticulously crafted landscapes to the intricacies of character customization. Your character's metabolism is simulated to an impressive degree, requiring you to manage everything from calorie intake to vitamin levels. This adds a layer of complexity that sets SCUM apart from other survival games.

The game world itself is vast and diverse, ranging from dense forests to military bases, each offering unique challenges and opportunities. The variety in environments keeps the gameplay fresh and encourages exploration. The day-night cycle and dynamic weather further contribute to the immersive atmosphere, creating an ever-changing landscape that impacts your survival strategies.

SCUM's standout feature is its robust character development system. You're not just a survivor; you're a contestant on a televised deathmatch. This adds a layer of meta-game as you strive to gain fame and sponsorship deals, affecting your in-game abilities and appearance. The progression system is deep, allowing you to specialize in various skills, such as marksmanship or crafting.

The PvP aspect of SCUM is both thrilling and nerve-wracking. Encounters with other players are intense, and the stakes are high. The realistic ballistics and weapon mechanics make every firefight a tactical challenge. Teaming up with other players can be beneficial, but trust is a rare commodity in this cutthroat world.

However, SCUM is not without its flaws. Bugs and performance issues can occasionally mar the experience, and the learning curve is steep. New players may find themselves overwhelmed by the sheer complexity of the game's mechanics. The interface, while functional, could use some refinement for a more intuitive experience.

In conclusion, SCUM is a hardcore survival experience that pushes the genre's boundaries. Its realism, expansive world, and intricate character development set it apart. While it may not be everyone's cup of tea due to its steep learning curve and occasional technical hiccups, those who embrace its challenges will find a uniquely immersive and rewarding survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976257026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 36980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3771, 'last_played': 1710698124}
review:
If you like that cold chill down your neck from being frightened, get this game! It will do that. Nights are long weapons are scarce and you start with nothing.

Feels like a disgruntled high level dev left DayZ and started up a new franchise of their own. Haven't tried multiplayer yet. Learning curve is steep to go it alone as a noob in MP. Building is similar to The Forest and DayZ etc... uses a blueprint system instead being able to plop a block down anywhere like 7 Days, Valheim, Impyrion or Space Engineers. Wish they had more blocks, but there is a decent amount of furniture and clutter.

I like the fact you have to worry about more than just zombies, which are pretty tough early game, but there are other creatures to kill you if you get board of dying from zombies or infections. Saw a bear terrorizing zombies in the town I'm hold up in. Makes you think twice about roaming the forest at night without a light. Already got my monies worth out of it.

One day I'll try MP and report back if it is horrible, but for now it is one of the best SP games I've played.

Cheers

review:
A simulation is not a simulation where you have to learn how to use a stupid inventory system before learning how to craft stuff.
Why is my left hand redundant ? why can I stick (yes stick) two sticks to my back but only carry one rock ? whats the purpose of quick slots ? why does it take three seconds between strikes with a wooden spear ? i can cut up a dead body with skin and bones with a small knife yet I can't cut up an old mattress for rags ?
Thats just for starters.
Loads and loads of empty boxes, crates etc, but no way to store stuff in them ! Reminds me of old story of a guy moving a sand beach, grain by grain. The grind is perceptively and tangibly grindy.
Drop bullets by accident, can you pick them up again....??
Drop a knife in the outdoors when picking up a stick, good luck finding it again !
Again, why is my left hand redundant ??
So this is a survival simulation ? ... no its not !! its torture for SM fans.
developer_response: Hi there SnakeOil! We're sorry to see that you've been disappointed with some of the features of the game. The logic is that you can your you can attach things that you can attack with to your holsters. While small sticks are extremely ineffective as weapons, they can still be used in that regard. Storing items in each box you can find in the environment would severely impact server performance and overall stability of the game. You can craft an improvised courier backpack almost immediately when you start playing which should help with your inventory problems until you find something more adequate like a backpack. Regardless, we'd like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and that we still have a lot of work ahead of us to further improve the game and to add lots of new content. That's why we hope you'll give the game another chance

developer_response: Hey there PERSIAN EPIC! We're sorry to see that a lack of food-related loot diminished your time with the game. If you were playing online, it is entirely possible that someone looted that exact spot where you were looting, leaving you with empty shelves and cupboards. However, there are spots around the map where you can easily find food. There's a cool third-party map that our community created https://scum-map.com/en/interactive_map where you can find crops that grow. You can also try playing on private servers that have modified loot settings, where you will be much more likely to find food. Hope these suggestions will help and we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121821234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 43369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1485, 'playtime_at_review': 27200, 'last_played': 1712445835}
review:
Bin gespalten.
Es ist nicht wirklich ein Spiel, es ist eine Erfahrung. Das Entwickler-Team hat sich leider Ã¼bernommen und die paar Leute hinter dem Projekt schaffen es nicht ein richtiges Spiel daraus zu machen.
Es hat fÃ¼r mich sehr viel Potential, aber wenn man die Mechaniken des Spiels mal verstanden hat, dann wird es fade.
Die ersten 2-4h jedes Neustarts sind spannend, danach hat man aber letztendlich nichts mehr zu tun bzw. es gibt nichts mehr neues zu entdecken.
Die Karte ist zwar sehr groÃŸ, aber letztendlich wiederholt sich alles permanent. Alle Polizeistationen sind gleich, die meisten HÃ¤user und LÃ¤den. Die Zombies spawnen an den gleichen PlÃ¤tzen  und es gibt leider gar keine Story oder Aufgaben/Quests.
Mir ist klar, dass das Spiel noch im EarlyAccess ist, aber machen wir uns nichts vor - was in den ursprÃ¼nglichen Trailern gezeigt wurde wird so nie ins Spiel kommen.
Wer Bock auf eine kurze Erfahrung fÃ¼r ein paar Abende hat ist hier gut aufgehoben. (Das haben die Entwickler wirklich gut gemacht - man ist dauerhaft angespannt und hofft, dass nicht gleich irgend ein Zombie auftaucht und einem das Leben aushaucht. Der Sound und die generierte Welt tragen auch sehr zur AtmosphÃ¤re bei).
Dennoch, es gibt leider nach einigen Stunden nichts mehr zu entdecken und das sieht man leider auch in den Updates des Spiels. Es wird die, gefÃ¼hlt, 1000000nde Waffe implementiert, aber an den Spielmechaniken oder der Interaktion mit der Spielwelt wird gar nichts gemacht.

Fazit: Wer ein paar Abende eine immersive Survivalaction genieÃŸen mÃ¶chte ist hier richtig. Allerdings gibt es da auch ganz andere Kaliber, welche so eine Erfahrung anbieten. Muss jeder selbst wissen. FÃ¼r mich aktuell 5/10.

Update: 
Wird StÃ¼ck fÃ¼r StÃ¼ck besser, allerdings wÃ¼rde ich es immer noch neutral bewerten (Diese Option gibt es aber leider nicht). Aktuell 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199541831553', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 44, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1711399084}
review:
The ability to buy in-game loot from an external "Store" makes it very pay2win-esque. Why pvp when your enemy uses this "Feature"  It has no place in a survival game. 

You have 3 options, Play official with hackers, Private servers with the bot shop. Or private servers without the bot shop that aren't even populated.

Kill a guy and 2 minutes later he reappears fully kitted after global chats says "Order #69 is dispatched" or whatever the he'll.

"How is that pay2win" - RayKit
developer_response: Hi Osowienie! We're sorry that you've had a bad experience in a P2W server. The practice of receiving items for real-world money is strictly prohibited and we immediately react as soon as we find out about something like that. It's okay to accept donations as a server provider, however every player within the server must receive the bonus items, not just the one that donated. That's why we'd like to kindly ask you to report the server where you encountered this via our official SCUM support at https://support.scumgame.com/ As for the issue of cheaters, we're taking steps to improve our server moderation and to speed up the process of removing cheaters from there so our players can enjoy their time without fear that a cheater will undermine their progress.All that being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126559482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1701117623}
review: Didnt care much for the melee combat and finding resources takes hours. Requires way to much devoted time to actually make progress.
developer_response: Hi there HalfBakedcheeto! We're sorry to see that you find the game too cumbersome and that you did not have a sense of progression. We acknowledge that the game may have a steeper learning curve and that it can sometimes be a bit punishing for solo and new players on official servers. That is why we would advise that you try out the private servers with modified settings such as increased loot, removed Sentries, fewer puppets, etc. Also, melee combat will be reworked and improved upon in the near future. That being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance and that you'll managed to find enjoyment in it.

review:
Very good and realistic game, a balanced mix of PvP and PvE.

It's just that there are still lots of bugs and sometimes updates are always sudden, when the developer is going to update there should be an announcement so that players can prepare for the latest update.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996020837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 38671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1978, 'playtime_at_review': 33977, 'last_played': 1712163063}
review:
The journey from day 1 that SCUM came out till now has been exciting.
With each time a new update drops (New content, bugfixes, . . .), it actually improves the gameplay.
(Now days you can not say this about most games)

Yes they have taken out a few things to improve it and it did bring its own problems with it.
The timing for updates was long and not always fun. But overall the game is great.
Now since they are pushing the updates and being more transparent. I see the game improving in no time.

Everything that has been taken out and put back in had an overhaul with so much better mechanics.
A lot more realistic and detailed gameplay.
The survival itself is more realistic and not just some "hunt/survive" mechanic.

Every decision you take comes with its own benefits and problems.
The risks are high but the rewarding feels satisfying.

The graphics, the AI, the details, and the gameplay overall is well tuned. 
Hopefully they add mods in soon so people don't have to get an extra PC and steam account to run their store bots.

All I can add is;

 â†’ Keep the updates coming â†

review: It's got quite a few glitches and nuisance bugs that are in line to be fixed. But it's also on a continual track of creating new areas, points of interest to explore and items to search for. Some of the graphics are really beautiful to be surrounded by. Whilst other graphics are still generic yet quick to load. It's an upgrade from DayZ and Rust. I got 1600 hrs in and play it every now and then to see whats new and try different servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024010529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1701032047}
review: Wouldnt recommend this POS on my worst enemy.
developer_response: Hi there Mambooman! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad time with the game. The game can be more on the punishing side for new players that play on official servers and we acknowledge that. There's safety in numbers and playing in a team greatly increases your chance of survival. We'd like to recommend that you try out the private servers with modified settings (such as increased loot drops, no Sentries, fewer puppets, etc.) Also, we'd like to reiterate that the game is still in Early access and we're still working to add loads of new content and improve existing features and mechanics. Even though your harsh words likely mean that you won't be returning to the game, we hope that you'll give it one more shot, at least when we fully release it and exit Early access

author: {'steamid': '76561198038547270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1701464865}
review: Every aspect of this game is just bad. Looks bad, feels bad, everything in the world either reacts poorly or not at all. Loot is terrible. They throw the ability to be nude in to ensure the Rust rejects stopped in for this bite of soggy toast. Anyone who cannot find their way off the DayZ coast is likely to end up here as well. Do yourself a favor and take the money you're gonna spend on this and just eat it.
developer_response: Hello fiddlestix! We're sorry to see that you've had a thoroughly bad time with SCUM. While you've cast a wide net with your gripes, we'd like to reiterate that the game is still in Early access and that we are still very much in active development and that we still have a long road ahead of us with adding new content and features to the game, as well as improving existing mechanics. As for the loot, this is something that we are also looking into and that will be modified, even though the in-game loot is designed to be more scarce which enhances that hardcore survival feel the game is aiming for. Even though it seems unlikely that you will return to the game, we'd like to kindly ask that you give the game another chance and try it out once we'll fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188191578', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1701009423}
review: my revies was edited after a dev respond and fixed my request technical issue  , really helpfully and thanks to the Dev Scum team !
developer_response: Hi there, SHASYS! We're sorry to see that you are experiencing technical issues with the game. The majority of these issue occur if the game is installed on an HDD. However, if your game is installed on an SSD, then we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with finding the cause of it and hopefully help you fix it. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something like this, which is why we hope you'll contact us with more details on this issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042334735', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6453, 'last_played': 1701463360}
review:
I am hesitant to give this game a thumbs down, I love it, it's a great blend of survival and PvP elements from similar games.  I probably won't give it a thumbs down for that reason alone, I will continue to play it.

But China needs to be region locked, and further measures should be taken even to stop the flood of chinese players onto servers they really have no need to play on, especially when a large portion of them are cheating.

Go ahead, hide in a random building in the middle of nowhere and say something about Tienanmen square or Winnie the Pooh.  They track you down (they already know via ESP) and kill you.

Fix this problem, please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870653191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1701061423}
review: Got game on sale for $25. I wouldnt have picked it up for more. Has a lot of great aspects to it. Its basically a death simulator. You land then run about 4 miles to a town fighting off zombies that basically have you bleed to death with one hit. You find a nice built up area and someone has put a lock on every building and boarded up all the windows to grief the town. Can still be fun in large teams.
developer_response: Hi there DemiLovatos*Tub! We're sorry to see that your experience with the game was less than satisfying. We acknowledge that the game can be a bit more on the challenging side for solo and new players when playing on official servers as the game is designed as a hardcore survival experience. We would advise that you try the private servers that have modified settings (such as number of puppets, availability of loot, presence of Sentries, etc.) which would make survival on the island much more likely. Additionally, we'd like to emphasize that the game is nearing its full release, but that we're still in Early access, meaning that we still have a lot of work to do to bring the game to a place where we can say that we have something truly awesome on our hands and that's why we hope you'll give us another chance once we get there

author: {'steamid': '76561198008786113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 27274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 389, 'playtime_at_review': 19152, 'last_played': 1712102056}
review: Muy buen juego, le faltan detalles, pero aun asi es mas lo positivo que lo negativo. Lastima los cheaters que hay como en todo juego para fastidiar a los demas, no son muchos, pero aparecen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009071653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1683981067}
review: Boring / Dead / Loot is bad = Go play Day Z
developer_response: Hi there BATMAN #1! We're sorry to that you found yourself disappointed with the game. We'd like to reiterate that the game is still in Early access and that we still have a long way ahead of us to implement all the features that we have planned and to fix and improve all the mechanics that are present. While you seem thoroughly discouraged with the game, we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

review: This is by far number 1 game when it comes to attention to detail and realism in gaming. You can do pretty much anything you want, explore and go anywhere you want and there's a dose of "fear" most of the time because of game's atmosphere (zombies and even worse other players). Supported it by buying multiple DLC's and can't wait for full release and more new features.

review:
519 hours says it all. 
This game is a MUST have for all survival fans! 
This game is still being built but has an amazing reality simulation and it's trully awesome. No game has achieved yet the complexity this game has. 

It's great fun to play, alone or with friends, but it's not easy until you master the basic survival skills. 

I trully recommned you to get this game. You can get it with 50% discount if you follow the developer closely.
Have FUN! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198235388104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 37288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21888, 'last_played': 1708956868}
review: Honestly this game is does have potential.. I do see the devs putting in effort to keep new content coming out and the graphics are great. However I will say that the amount of glitches, errors, and overall instability of a game that has been out for years at this point, is a tad disappointing. New content should always take second seat to overall gameplay issues and glitches.
developer_response: Hi there CJ! We're sorry to see that your experience with the game was less than satisfying. The official servers and their settings are modified to provide a truly hardcore survival experience, which can be sometimes punishing for solo and new players. However, we can see that you've invested a substantial time in the game, meaning that you've probably just had a couple of bad runs with unfortunate puppet spawns and too few helpful loot. Perhaps you would benefit from playing on private servers that have modified loot settings, making the issue with dying from various body effects, illnesses and injuries more bearable. Also, you can reclaim what you've lost by respawning to the zone where you died, although it will cost you a bit more. Regardless of everything. the game's still in Early access and we still have a lot of work to do with improving the overall experience of the game, as well as improving a variety of features. We hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get that done and see how we've elevated it.

review: This game is absolute trash, got it right when it came out, and it was trash. Just tried playing again, still absolute trash. Still cant believe that I paid full price for this garbage when it came out and cannot get a refund. takes hours to link up with friends, thats if you dont get killed by something wasting hours to get to them to even start the game.
developer_response: Hello â™¦IVEEâ™¦! Firstly we'd like to express our gratitude and say thank you for giving the game another chance even though you did not like it the first time. What we can tell from your review is that, apart from issues with the gameplay itself, you've been experiencing some technical/connectivity issues that ruined your time with the game. While you seem completely dissuaded from the game and have conveyed that returning is not an option, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to find and fix the solution you are experiencing. With that, we hope that you'll contact us and that we'll find a way to make your purchase at least a bit worthwhile.

review: I love the realism. (EDIT) I dont remember what amount of hours i had but i now have at least more. This game is really fun if you have friends and a okay server if you dont have friends you could probably make some on RP servers iv only played about 4 of them and all 4 were good, this game is also really good if you love realistic gun physics and models the combat is somewhat realistic (hint: head should be 1 shot almost any gun, body 1-2 shot almost any gun and lower is about 2-5 shots) anyway i hope this review was helpful and please leave comments if it was. Thanks

author: {'steamid': '76561197976708362', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6485, 'last_played': 1700804261}
review:
Spawned in, built some basics, headed off to town.  Got a pistol, ammo, magazine, shotgun etc. at police station.  Loaded up my pistol clip with 45 ACP, put in into my pistol.  Put pistol on hotbar.  Loaded shotgun, put it in the 2 slot.  
A few minutes I come across 5+ puppets that aggro me.  No problem, I hit a few with bow and arrow and pull out the shotgun.  It drops to the ground.  I run around the shotgun trying to grab it while 5 puppets pound on me.  I bail, leave the shotgun and switch to my pistol.  But the pistol is no longer in my hot bar slot.  
I have to manually equip it from my inventory.
Still alive, thank god for the pistol.  Aim down sights, pull the trigger and ... nothing. click click.  As I am running away I realize the pistol clip has literally disappeared along with all the ammo.
This is pretty much a typical experience for me on Scum.  
Then you die and respawn randomly and have to run 1 to 2 hours in real time to get back to your body/base.  Unless it's night then traveling generally ends in death unless you are really prepared.  
Until the developers finally fix all the bugs, network performance issues, poor respawn mechanics, this game is more aggravating then it is fun.
It has a ton of potential but so far these bugs continue to plague every server I visit.  Disappearing items are super frequent.
developer_response: Hi there Alpha âˆ Omega! We're sorry to see that you've experienced a bug that severely undermined your time in the game and we'd like to thank you for the extensive review. The bug you've mentioned is known and we're working to fix it, along with a host of other known issues that are present and we'll aim to get those ironed out once we fully release the game. Until then, we'd like to kindly ask you for more patience and express our hope that you'll give the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364261340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1700819797}
review: Bought this game really excited to try it after seeing a lot on it and couldn't even get it to load. I know have the specs and the wifi to run it but every time i go to join a game it says network lost. I've tried everything i can think of and have looked all on the internet from deleting the files to the game. The game looks cool and i respect that you are still adding things to it but you need learn how to fix the basic problems of the game if you cant even load the game whats the point of all the jack o lanterns and junk you add.
developer_response: Hello Hazardous1026! We're sorry to see that you've been experiencing technical issues with the game and that those left you discouraged from it. If the issues are still present and you would be kind enough to give the game another chance, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with this issue and hopefully help you fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366459939', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8519, 'last_played': 1700955146}
review:
If you ask me what I prefer: It is SCUM and not DayZ. Come on man, just look at the difference e.g. in the combat system against the zombies in SCUM vs. DayZ. DayZ charges for content like the Livonia map. And what else will it be in the future? SCUM is free content. (Don't count skins please). SCUM is less expensive than DayZ. DayZ is played because of the nostalgia, so people ignore everything else and give it a positive review regardless, or if there really are people who like it... whatever. SCUM is new, more interesting, less buggy, 3 times more things to do, better graphics, every update is rich and more frequent than in DayZ.  
Just Djude! What else can I say? Open your eyes! 
The thing is, I've played both games, for both I payed (Also for Livonia). I can tell you which game is more attractive at the moment. DayZ is developed since 2013. And a look at how the game still does not work, even after all this time... SCUM is 5 years ahead of DayZ. And in general, it is better in every way + IT'S IN EARLY ACCESS. You still not playing full game! Can you believe this fact?

author: {'steamid': '76561198125186393', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 25546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'playtime_at_review': 13495, 'last_played': 1711478190}
review:
Welcome, Welcome Welcome :-)
Fordernder Einstieg in das Game. Nach einer gewissen Einspiel zeit und viel Geduld wird es Solo aber noch mehr mit Freunden, zu einem fantastischen Survival Game.
Viel verschiedener Loot (Kleidung, GegenstÃ¤nde,Waffen auf Privaten Servern), gute und teils lustige Ideen der Entwickler machen es zu einem richtigen Zeitfresser.
Es gibt viele unterschiedliche MÃ¶glichkeiten Scum zu spielen, also ist fÃ¼r jeden etwas dabei (PVP/PVE).
Kleine Macken, wie bei jedem Survival Spiel gibt es immer, diese sind aber nicht Spiel entscheidend.
Die Welt ist sehr groÃŸ (mit verschiedenen Fahrzeugen zu bereisen), wunderschÃ¶n gestaltete Landschaften mit verschiedenen Klimazonen und deren Auswirkungen.
Top -> Die Radios spielen Musik fÃ¼r jeden Geschmack, macht den Basebau und die Fahrten wesentlich angenehmer :-)
Klare Kaufempfehlung!

Polecam, dobra gra. Slavic Power.
